40|finger or fist the choice of decimal or binary representation the binary number system offer many advantage over decimal representation for high performance general purpose computer the greater simplicity of binary arithmetic unit and the greater compactness of binary number both contribute directly to arithmetic speed obvious and perhaps more important is the way binary addressing and instruction format can increase the overall performance binary address are also essential to certain powerful operation which are not practical with decimal instruction format on the other hand decimal number are essential for communicating between man and the computer in application requiring the processing of large volume of inherently decimal input and output data the time for decimal binary conversion needed by purely binary computer may be significant slower decimal adder may take time than fast binary adder doing an addition and two conversion careful review of the significance of decimal and binary addressing and both binary and decimal data arithmetic supplemented by efficient conversion instruction |

46|multiprogramming stretch feasibility consideration the tendency towards increased parallelism in computer is noted exploitation of this parallelism present number of new problem in machine design and in programming system minimum requirement for successful concurrent execution of several independent problem program are discussed these requirement are met in the stretch system by carefully balanced combination of built in and programmed logic technique are described which place the burden of the programmed logic on system program supervisory program and compiler rather than on problem program |

48|shift register code for indexing application in this communication the use of shift register code with n is described for calling wireless telemetering station in fixed cyclical order high degree of redundancy is used permitting single error correcting code minimum distance three code with bit code word to be employed the station identification code embedding this in the shift register code with period permit the code to be employed without punctuation each of the telemetering station receiver simply putting received one and zero into shift register each time the given code combination arises identifying the particular station barring for tuitous error combination of very low probability it been called the communication describes the property and application of the code in some detail and the finding of the particular example to be employed on ural the soviet built drum computer donated to the indian statistical institute by the united nation technical aid administration untaa |

71|proposal for feasible programming system this paper proposes designing programming facility itself involving digital computer and program which will assist the preparation of large scale real time program this facility is to be capable of preparing program for any of variety of machine having characteristic similar to those of the facility computer one of the basic assumption is that there will be enough random access storage available to avoid the necessity for segmenting constructed program in any fashion other than trivial one while this assumption is somewhat unrealistic it is intended to provide an opportunity to concentrate on the other aspect of program construction the programming system should stress the discovery in source program statement of many error possible before attempting to construct an object program among the computer characteristic which are advocated are program interrupt scheme large set of character and indirect addressing |

78|remark on the practical solution of characteristic value problem this paper is concerned with the practical solution of characteristic value problem for an ordinary differential equation it is at once apparent that sequential computer be they digital or analog solve initial value problem rather than boundary value problem and some mathematical process must be found to compensate for the machine inadequacy compensating for machine imperfection is of course the normal activity of the numerical analyst number of other paper have applied particular device to particular problem the purpose of this note is to establish mathematical framework or model for these practical procedure and thus assist in the use and extension of the idea in other particular problem |

95|elimination of special function from differential equation set of ordinary differential equation which contains mathematical function requiring the use of subroutine for numerical solution by electronic computer tabular data for numerical solution by hand calculation or function generator when analog method are applied can sometimes be expanded to an equivalent set of equation which do not contain the function this is practical if these function satisfy sufficiently simple differential equation thus among those function which can be eliminated by this procedure are the trigonometric inverse trigonometric exponential and many other transcendental function |
96|on computing radiation integral the relative merit and cost of four way of evaluating typical radiation integral containing spherical bessel function are investigated these method are desk machine evaluation of finite series integration of the appropriate differential equation by reef electronic analog computer and by litton ibm computer result are generally applicable to equation separated from helmholtz or wave equation |

103|cope console operator proficiency examination each year electronic computer become more sophisticated and the program they must process become more complex because of this dependence of those in computing on the skill and experience of operator is increasing at the same time selection and training of qualified operator grows more difficult to meet the need for quick accurate uniform operator test and training aid the author have developed cope console operator proficiency examination outlined below while this examination is programmed specifically for the ibm model ii with two tape record coordinator similar program could be developed for other computer |
104|digital simulation of discrete flow system the discrete flow system discussed are characterized by the movement of randomly arriving item along interacting channel programing digital computer to simulate such system utilizes some technique not common in other approach to physical problem the principal portion of the paper is discussion of two simulation study that illustrate some of the programming problem involved one is of an extensive package handling plant with the objective being optimization of parameter such storage capacity and processing rate in the other air traffic flow and control procedure are simulated to compare the effect of alternative control decision |

106|method for overlapping and erasure of list an important property of the newell shaw simon scheme for computer storage of list is that data having multiple occurrence need not be stored at more than one place in the computer that is list may be overlapped unfortunately overlapping pose problem for subsequent erasure given list that is longer needed it is desired to erase just those part that do not overlap other list in lisp mccarthy employ an elegant but inefficient solution to the problem the present paper describes general method which enables efficient erasure the method employ interspersed reference count to describe the extent of the overlapping |

144|do it by the number digital shorthand present communication system transmit single character in group of coded pulse between simple terminal equipment since english word form only sparse set of all possible alphabetic combination present method are inefficient when computer system are substituted for these terminal using numeric representation of entire word or common phrase rather than character by character representation requires approximately one third of present transmission time this saving is reflected in overall cost other benefit accrue in code and language translation scheme provision is made for transmission of purely numeric andor binary stream and for single character transmission of non dictionary word such the name of people or place |

185|multiprogram scheduling part and introduction and theory in order to exploit fully fast computer which posse simultaneous processing ability it should to large extent schedule it own workload the scheduling routine must be capable of extremely rapid execution if it is not to prove self defeating the construction of schedule entail determining which program are to be run concurrently and which sequentially with respect to each other concise scheduling algorithm is described which tends to minimize the time for executing the entire pending workload or any subset of it subject to external constraint such precedence urgency etc the algorithm is applicable to wide class of machine |

241|machine calculation of moment of probability distribution method is presented for the calculation on machine of the moment of probability distribution necessitating little more than n addition and n reference to memory for each moment instead of the minimum of n multiplication n addition and n reference to memory required by the most straightforward method where n is the number of entry in the probability distribution the method is directly applicable when tabulated distribution exists when it been computed by repeated convolution but in this case it conserve both time and accuracy |
242|note on geometric weighted check digit verification this note describes method for utilizing geometric weight modulus checking digit on computer which doe not have either multiplication or division in addition some attempt been made to show some limitation of this system |
243|n dimensional code for detecting and correcting multiple error the paper introduces new family of code for detecting and correcting multiple error in binary coded message the message itself is arranged conceptually into multidimensional rectangular array the process of encoding and error detection are based upon parity evaluation along prescribed dimension of the array effectiveness of the code is increased by introducing system check bit which is essentially parity check on the other parity bit only three dimensional code are discussed in this paper with parity evaluation along the horizontal the vertical and one main diagonal however the family of code is not restricted to three dimension evidenced by the discussion by minnick and ashenhurst on similar multidimensional single bit selection plan used for another purpose four dimensional code correcting three and detecting four error been developed the extension to higher dimensional code with greater correction power is straightforward |

278|general formulation of storage allocation formalization of general computer storage allocation process is attempted with given computer m is associated fictitious computer m essentially identical to m except in respect to possession of unbounded primary storage mapping of the total storage set internal and external of m into the direct address set of m are introduced program sequence p for m is termed m admissible relative to specific execution time period if there is mapping underwhich p and it effective data referent are all located in the direct address set of m storage allocation is considered process of establishing for an arbitrary m program sequence of mapping decoupling of the program into m admissible subprogram and linking set of interlude an existence proof in term of completely interpretive m program indicated some special case are discussed various restriction on generality of m program are considered under which more practical realization of allocation process becomes tractable |

281|putting hex on ex recent note on approximate natural antilogy have not considered indirect formulation for describing ex in this note we produce particular family of very fast high precision and eminently practical exponential evaluation formula derived from one such formulation |
282|optimum tape writing procedure consider magnetic tape system with read check after writing where an error occurs in writing record programmed error routine may either bypass some or all of the area on tape or try to rewrite the record on the same area this paper evaluates these two procedure on the basis of expected loss of computer time and develops decision rule for selecting the optimum procedure the rule depends critically on the number of time the tape being written will be used in the future in the case where the optimum procedure is to bypass an area second decision the size of the area to be bypassed is necessary formula is developed to determine the optimum area to be bypassed for each procedure |

319|on class of iteration formula and some historical note the class of iteration formula obtainable by rational approximation of euler formula is derived with the corresponding error estimate some historical note on iterative procedure are followed by derivation of euler formula with the associated error estimate in new notation which simplifies the error estimate and suggests generalization the final section considers the pade approximants to the euler polynomial and show how number of known formula may be derived from this unified approach there is short discussion of the best formula |
320|logic structure table logic table are an excellent way of developing and expressing the logic required in procedure operation system and circuit set of rule for writing and using logic table is explained by mean of some simple example then the logic structure of vending machine is given in which two logic table are used logic table are two dimensional in nature enabling u to fully express and consider both the sequential and parallel aspect of logic they can be compiled directly into computer program and so eliminate the need for flow charting and hand coding |
321|algol confidential the algol report when first encountered seems to describe very complex language which will be difficult to learn the metalinguistic formula admirably serve the purpose of precisely specifying language but they are certainly not very readable for beginner however experience shown that once the report is explained it is in fact easy to learn algol and to write algorithm in it the language is so general and powerful it can handle an enormous class of problem it is not hard to learn those part of algol present in other compiler language how to write assignment and go to and for statement etc indeed lot of the unnecessary restriction imposed by other compiling language have finally been lifted but algol also allows many unobvious thing to be written we will see later and herein lie problem algol seems to have become too general so many restriction have been lifted that lot of technical detail crop up which are hard to learn and to use correctly in this paper some of the more obscure feature of the language are considered and their usefulness is discussed remark are based on the author interpretation of the algol report |
322|operational compatibility of system convention the general standard committee of the share organization devoted considerable effort to the problem of operating computer efficiently in view of the growing number of programming system available each of these programming system been coded to utilize fixed set of hardware component without recognizing the fact that others may be occupying storage medium required by the first these incompatibility are currently resolved by manually setting up the computer for each system required the following set of convention is being considered to minimize computer set up time they are of sufficiently broad interest that we feel other computer user should be aware of them george f ryckman chairman |

497|further remark on line segment curve fitting using dynamic programming in recent paper bellman showed how dynamic programming could be used to determine the solution to problem previously considered by stone the problem comprises the determination given n of the n point of subdivision of given interval b and the corresponding line segment that give the best least square fit to function gx in the interval bellman confined himself primarily to the analytical derivation suggesting briefly however how the solution of the equation derived for each particular point of subdivision ui could be reduced to discrete search in this paper the computational procedure is considered more fully and the similarity to some of stone equation are indicated it is further shown that an equation for ui involving minimization may be found in addition it is shown how bellman method may be applied to the curve fitting problem when the additional constraint are added that the end of the line segment must be on the curve |

533|digital synthesis of correlated stationary noise in this note we propose method of generating stationary noise with prescribed auto covariance function by digital method the need for such technique often arises in testing the performance of data processing and engineering system where input corrupted with correlated noise of known form are required the technique is quite simple and produce strict sense stationary noise which agrees approximately with rt the prescribed auto covariance function acf over an interval t t the method consists of approximating the spectral density by periodic process with spectral line and then synthesizing the periodic noise with random phase and appropriate amplitude in order to simplify discussion of the statistical property of the noise generated the technique is first presented in term of exact harmonic analysis in practice discrete harmonic analysis presented in the third section is used |

616|an information algebra phase i report language structure group of the codasyl development committee this report represents the result of the first phase of the work of the language structure group the goal of this work is to arrive at proper structure for machine independent problem defining language at the system level of data processing the report is based for the most part on mathematical model called an information algebra developed primarily by r bosak it is hoped that this report will be read with avid interest by programming language designer and implementors and all those interested in developing theoretical approach to data processing b with interest and understanding by professional programmer and system analyst and c with appreciation by the businessman analyst manager the author have not attempted an exhaustive discourse in this report rather they have tried to present philosophy to the professional people who are vitally concerned with providing working language for the system analyst use they trust that the idea in this report will stimulate others to think along similar line question and comment will be welcomed and can be addressed to any of the member of the language structure group robert bosak system development corporation richard f clippinger honeywell edp division carey dobbs remington rand univac division roy goldfinger chairman ibm corporation renee b jasper navy management office william keating national cash register george kendrick general electric company jean sammet ibm corporation |

670|some legal implication of the use of computer in the banking business the introduction of computer in to the banking business wide variety of legal implication that merit careful attention at this very early stage the industry is highly regulated by government and hence is subject to many statute and regulation it also is affected by important common law rule established by court the legal ramification involve not only the mechanization itself but also the very significant economically attractive phenomenon of off premise processing it is essential to identify and provide for many legal aspect right now before system and practice crystallize in order to avoid the later impact of unanticipated physical complication and expense the legal aspect of computerization in the banking business are especially diverse in some state there might be the basic question whether bank are authorized by law to invest in the new facility either directly or through cooperative more challenging are question relating to off premise processor particularly with respect to the obligation not to disclose information concerning bank customer the adequacy of fidelity bond coverage the extent of liability for improper refusal to pay check and susceptibility to regulation by government agency also pertinent is the propriety of data processing by bank for nonbank entity and particularly of the rendering of that service without charge for bank depositor |

724|profile of the programmer synopsis member of the acm participated in study concerned primarily with the attitude of programmer toward their career and job very high percentage of programmer have apparently entered their career by accident it proven happy choice for most and they expect to remain in the field during the next five year their principal job satisfaction relate to the nature of their work and mostfind their job offer high level of professional interest and good working condition salary and advancement prospect however are not satisfactory more than half report positive attitude toward programmer and programming on the part of their organization turnover among themselves is attributed primarily to poor management salary is seen the principal motivating factor in turnover among other programmer nature of the work offered and salary are principal determinant in accepting new job programmer are mobile than expected programmer tend to see their colleague in favorable light on the whole personality seem to vary with function system programmer differing from application programmer four principal problem for programming in the immediate future are listed by participant language personnel various specific application and technique and building programming profession |

796|sabrag time sharing low cost computer the serial sabrac computer designed and built in the scientific department of the israel defense ministry location magnetic drum main store to avoid need to resort to optimum programming technique and to increase it overall efficiency the computer also been given word ferrite core store from which the program is obeyed transfer between the core and drum store and to and from the twin paper tape input and output channel are all available autonomously concurrently time shared multiplication and division order are also autonomous so that the machine may be executing up to three order simultaneously all function naturally are interlocked number of other advanced order and facility are also incorporatedin particular an execute order permit temporary jump for up to four order and second modifier register permit double modification in general and relative addressing of subroutine in particular thus the overall effective speed of the machine is muchhigher than it basic specification would lead one to expect and it design indicates one way in which the concept of time sharing may be incorporated in low cost computer |

848|note on range transformation for square root and logarithm there wa the germ of an idea in two previous paper which one seems to have picked up in almost five year for certain function it seems desirable to transform the argument to short range symmetric about will give example of this usage for the square root and logarithm function for both binary and decimal machine |
849|use of tree structure for processing file in data processing problem file are frequently used which must both be searched and altered binary search technique are efficient for searching large file but the associated file organization is not readily adapted to the file alteration conversely chained file allocation permit efficient alteration but cannot be searched efficiently file organized into tree like structure is discussed and it is shown that such file may both be searched and altered with time proportional to slogsn where n is the number of file item and s is parameter of the tree it is also shown that optimizing the value of s lead to search time which is only per cent slower than the binary search the tree organization employ two data chain and may be considered to be compromise between the organization for the binary search and the chained file the relation of the tree organization to multidimensional indexing and to the trie structure is also discussed |

854|some characteristic of sorting in computing system using random access storage device the substantial difference in characteristic of random access storage and tape device dictate that concept and objective of computer program design be considered from the viewpoint of the external file medium used this is particularly true in the case of sorting in tape oriented system the major sorting problem is that of minimizing merge time despite the limited order of merge possible in contrast sorting in random access oriented system encourages the selection of the optimum order of merge from many possible order the latter problem is discussed in this paper along with criterion developed for determining the optimum order of merge according to the various property of random access storage device attention is also given to the problem of key sorting versus record sorting and the possibly serious disadvantage of key sorting on random access system |

861|read backward polyphase sorting read backward polyphase sorting provides more efficient use of the tape available to sort than most other sorting technique backward polyphase produce continuous merging process from n tape where n is the total number of tape being used in the sorting process any of the available presorting technique may be used in conjunction with the polyphase merge sort provided that the presort the capability of producing both ascending and descending string and distributing the string on the various tape required by the polyphase merge |

867|least square fitting of plane to surface using dynamic programming dynamic programming recently been used by stone by bellman and by gluss to determine the closet fit of broken line segment to curve in an interval under the constraint that the number of segment is fixed in the present paper successive model are developed to extend the method to the fitting of broken plane segment to surface zgx defined over certain type of subareas of the x space the first model considers rectangular area with the constraint that the plane segment are defined over grid in the x space it is then shown how this model may be incorporated into an algorithm that provides successive approximation to optimal fit for any type of closed area finally application are briefly described |

950|parallel method for integrating ordinary differential equation this paper is dedicated to the proposition that in order to take full advantage for real time computation of highly parallel computer can be expected to be available in the near future much of numerical analysis will have to be recast in more parallel form by this is meant that serial algorithm ought to be replaced by algorithm which consist of several subtasks which can be computed without knowledge of the result of the other subtasks an example method is proposed for parallelizing the numerical integration of an ordinary differential equation which process by all standard method is entirely serial |

1003|computer analysis method for thermal diffusion in biochemical system in the thermal detection of rapid biochemical reaction it is necessary to correct the temperature data for transient heat conduction loss in cylindrical calorimeter to handle the complexity arising from varying thermal relaxation time of concentric insulating layer computer program wa developed which give the temperature distribution of the system function of radius and time this distribution is corrected at each step by subroutine which calculates the instantaneous chemical state of there action well the heat produced by this reaction the program is based on direct statement of fourier law of heat conduction and the chemical rate equation to provide bookkeeping law to follow the reactant and the flow of heat packet in such way that the computer continually store the heat distribution computer analysis method is here regarded one in which the physical law of process are used explicitly in the program usually this result in by passing much of the mathematical procedure conventionally used the program wa tested against some known exact solution of the heat equation and gave identical result and compared well with experimental data of known biochemical reaction the construction of computer program based on the direct statement of the physical law is principle of general applicability which been applied to several other physical phenomenon |

1012|formal parsing system automatic syntactic analysis recently become important for both natural language data processing and syntax directed compiler formal parsing system g v u t r consists of two finite disjoint vocabulary v and t many many map u from v onto t and recursive set r of string in t called syntactic sentence class every program for automatic syntactic analysis determines formal parsing system directed production analyzer i t x p is nondeterministic pushdown store machine with internal vocabulary i input vocabulary t and all production of p in the form z ay ym where z yi are element of the set i and is an element of the set t every context free language can be analyzed by directed production analyzer the kuno oettinger multiple path syntactic analyzer for english is concrete example of directed production analyzer and of working parsing algorithm the connection between structure assigned by the analyzer and those of conventional phrase structure grammar is examined in this paper |

1029|simple automatic derivative evaluation program procedure for automatic evaluation of totalpartial derivative of arbitrary algebraic function is presented the technique permit computation of numerical value of derivative without developing analytical expression for the derivative the key to the method is the decomposition of the given function by introduction of intermediate variable into series of elementary functional step library of elementary function subroutine is provided for the automatic evaluation and differentiation of these new variable the final step in this process produce the desired function derivative the main feature of this approach is it simplicity it can be used quick reaction tool where the derivation of analytical derivative is laborious and also debugging tool for program which contain derivative |

1098|comparison of list processing computer language including detailed comparison of comit ipl v lisp and slip detailed comparison is presented of comit ipl v lisp and slip four well known computer programming language which among them exhibit all the principal characteristic of existing list processing language important common feature of list processing language are reviewed form of data structure which are manipulated necessity for dynamic allocation of storage use of pushdown store and use of recursive operation principal difference between the four language under consideration are detailed representation of data both by the programmer and within the machine method for storage allocation programming formalism and special process available including arithmetic facility and usability in term of availability documentation learning aid and debugging facility rough comparison show that all the language discussed have approximately the same speed finally the author give some heuristic to aid in the selection of one of these language for use in particular problem application concluding that one of the language considered is distinctly superior in all possible list processing application |
1099|professional computer work for the blind development in computer technology have opened new professional opportunity for the intelligent blind since there are few if any occupation in which the blind can participate without serious disadvantage the opportunity offered them to gain entrance into various occupation through computer use including that of programmer is important for future rehabilitation planning also of immediate interest is the fact that the blind may be especially suited for programming work because of intense training in and constant experience with locating object in the unseen environment and also because of superbly trained memory the blind brings to the work of programming skill which the sighted had little need to acquire these qualification should result in fewer debugging problem and make the blind valuable addition to any system group before the blind could become serious professional number of aid and technique had to be developed that can mediate between machine and programmer this paper describes the technique and aid which were designed by the staff of the medical computing center of the university of cincinnati college of medicine |

1134|some effect of the computer on language structure the problem of compiling efficient code prompted the development of an intermediate language reflecting the structure of the machine that is more easily manipulated in improving object program efficiency the subject of this paper is the intermediate language and method of manipulating it compilation of series of arithmetic statement are discussed it is assumed that all function and exponential have been removed from these statement and replaced by simple variable for purpose of simplicity the treatment of subscript is ignored simplified structure is presented to illustrate the compiling method several assumption are made for purpose of simplification although there are case in which the assumption are violated in the actual machine |
1135|general business oriented language based on decision expression the structure of digital compute programming language which cover wide class of business and file processing application is presented such structure based on identifying and incorporating into compiler the aspect common to all process of such class permit writing extremely compact program even for comparatively complex application in term of table of control expression which express only information characteristic of the particular application furthermore local change of process eg change affecting only one of the output file involved can be effected by local modification in the program eg modification of only one entry of the table this structure also allows for inexpensive preparation of loading speed compiler which translate the source program into efficient machine code the approach adopted here departs from conventional mechanical language design philosophy it stress the structural analysis of the class of process to be represented in the language opposed to emphasizing formal ie content independent syntactical definition it relies exclusively on nonprocedural representation of process set table of relation between data and result there are control statement such go to etc instead of using procedure description which are one to one translation of flowchart here an invariant pattern of procedure is identified characteristic of the class of all batch file process this new philosophy the potential to overcome well known deficiency of other business oriented language and fully meet the requirement set by codasyl for such language including machine independence |

1143|analysis of decay type data comparative study been made of variety of numerical technique for fitting experimental data of the decay type by form involving the sum of exponential statistical error of the fitted parameter are also calculated these method have been applied to artificially generated set of data well to the result of experiment with radioactive tracer on both human and animal subject result show that the value of the fitted parameter are very sensitive to variation in the fitting procedure therefore great care very sensitive to variation in the fitting procedure therefore great care must be exercised in identifying such value with physical constant although the value of function derived from these fitted parameter which can definitely be associated with physical entity are generally more stable under variation in the fitting technique error bound can be so large that great confidence can be placed even in them it would therefore appear best to select uniform technique both for running the experiment and for analyzing the data and then to consider significant only relative result between one subject and the next |

1145|git heuristic program for testing pair of directed line graph for isomorphism given pair of directed line graph the problem of ascertaining whether or not they are isomorphic is one for which efficient algorithmic solution is known since straightforward enumerative algorithm might require year of running time on very high speed computer in order to compare two node graph more sophisticated approach seems called for the situation is similar to that prevailing in area such game playing and theorem proving where practical algorithm are unknown for the interesting case but where various practical though only partially successful technique are available git graph isomorphism tester incorporates variety of process that attempt to narrow down the search for an isomorphism or to demonstrate that none exists one scheme is relied upon exclusively for solution and the program is designed to avoid excessive computation along fruitless line git been written in the comit language and successfully tested on the ibm |
1146|an efficient composite formula for multidimensional quadrature s point second degree quadrature formula for integration over an s dimensional hyper rectangle is presented all but one of the point lie on the surface with weight of opposite sign attached to point on opposite face when large volume is subdivided into congruent rectangular subdivision only one point is required in each interior subdivision to achieve second degree accuracy |

1154|multi tape and infinite state automaton survey survey of machine which are more powerful than finite automaton and powerful than general turing machine is presented it is felt that the machine in this category are closely related to digital computer either the finite automaton or the unrestricted turing machine intermediate machine can be created by adjoining on infinite state memory to finite state machine and then performing any or all of the following restrict the manner in which the unbounded portion of the memory can be accessed bound the number of step allowed for computation by some increasing recursive function of the length of the input restrict the total amount of memory available in the same manner example from all three class and their property are discussed |

1159|machine independence it technology and economics survey is offered of technique for transferring program and especially compiler from one computer to another of the method examined the bootstrap technique is singled out for detailed discussion with emphasis on it economics the consideration that determine the applicability of bootstrapping in any specific case are discussed and an attempt is made to assign appropriate qualitative weight to them finally reason are given for believing that the machine independence problem is being substantially diminished by current trend in computer design and that it is this process of convergence in hardware design rather than any foreseeable software development that will lead to it satisfactory resolution |
1160|cat computer aided translation semi automatic translation system been implemented which convert fap language program into assembly language the input to the system is fap program deck which been specially prepared for translation by the user the output consists of the translated compass language program together with comprehensive diagnostic listing which the user must analyze in order to verify any questionable area of the translation the translation processor consists of three distinct phase an assembly of the fap program comprehensive analysis of the assembled code with particular regard to the action of instruction upon other instruction and upon data and finally the output pas which generates the compass program in the form of macro instruction |

1169|an algorithm for minimizing backboard wiring function partially exhaustive algorithm is presented for solving the following problem arising from automatic layout of computer given an ordered set of n computer component for each permutation of the element there is attached value of an integer function f the algorithm find local minimum of f by evaluating the set delta f of the increment corresponding to certain set of exchange of two elementsthen the exchange corresponding to the least negative increment of delta f is performed the process is iterated and stopped when the set of the increment is positive or empty set which it is proved corresponds to minimum the procedure is similar to the downhill method for finding the minimum of real function fp and can be applied to other placement problem experimental result are presented with backboard formed by many element and different initial placement |
1170|analyzing english syntax with pattern learning parser dependency analysis system based on pattern recognition and learning logic wa developed to infer word class and rule of syntactic combination from experience with text which had been analyzed the characteristic used to form word class are the depth in the dependency tree of each word the direction of it governor and the same feature for each of it immediate neighbor syntactic rule of combination show the relation of word to it governor in the depth pattern of the sentence the system wa tested on elementary basic english sentence including used earlier by knowlton in different learning parser of all sentence after experience with sentence it wa able to generalize with percent accuracy to the next in accumulative learning trial after the first sentence it averaged probability of for accurately parsing each new sentence it encountered it wa concluded that the system is adequate for learning to parse the bulk of basic english but that further development is required before conclusion about it application to ordinary english can be stored the system is operational and available on the arpasdc time shared computing system |
1171|comparison of the primal simplex and primal dual algorithm for linear programming statistical comparison of the primal dual and the more commonly used primal simplex algorithm for solving linear programming problem been made under the assumption of starting with full artificial basis under these condition the primal dual method show statistically significant superiority on randomly generated problem it also been found via regression analysis that the relevant parameter in determining the difference in the number of iteration between the algorithm is not only the number of constraint and the number of variable but also the ratio of the latter to the former |

1197|finding zero of polynomial by the q d algorithm method which find simultaneously all the zero of polynomial developed by h rutishauser been tested on number of polynomial with real coefficient this slowly converging method the quotient difference q d algorithm provides starting value for newton or bairstow algorithm for more rapid convergence necessary and sufficient condition for the existence of the q d scheme are not completely known however failure may occur when zero have equal or nearly equal magnitude success wa achieved in most of the case tried with the failure usually traceable to the equal magnitude difficulty in some case computer roundoff may result in error which spoil the scheme even if the q d algorithm doe not give all the zero it will usually find majority of them |

1235|stochastic approach to the grammatical coding of english computer program is described which will assign each word in an english text to it form class or part of speech the program operates at relatively high speed in only limited storage space about half of the word event in corpus are identified through the use of small dictionary of function word and frequently occurring lexical word some suffix test and logical decision rule are employed to code additional word finally the remaining word are assigned to one class or another on the basis of the most probable form class to occur within the already identified context the conditional probability used basis for this coding were empirically derived from separate hand coded corpuson preliminary trial the accuracy of the coder wa to with obvious way of improving the algorithm being suggested by an analysis of the result |

1265|on the relative efficiency of context free grammar recognizers number of diverse recognition procedure that have been proposed for parsing sentence with respect to context free grammar are described in this paper by mean of common device each procedure is defined by giving an algorithm for obtaining nondeterministic turing machine recognizer that is equivalent to given context free grammar the formalization of the turing machine been chosen to make possible particularly simple description of the parsing procedure considered an attempt been made to compare recognition efficiency for the procedure defined for few simple grammar and sentence formal comparison been made empirical comparison of the recognition of more realistic programming language such lisp and algol been made by mean of program which simulates the turing machine on the univac m computer several algorithm for producing grammar equivalent to given context free grammar have been considered and the increase in recognition efficiency they afford been empirically investigated |

1350|the augmented predictive analyzer for context free language it relative efficiency it been proven by greibach that for given context free grammar g standard form grammar g can be constructed which generates the same language is generated by g and whose rule are all of the form z cy ym m where z and yi are intermediate symbol and c terminal symbol since the predictive analyzer at harvard us standard form grammar it can accept the language of any context free grammar g given an equivalent standard form grammar g the structural description sdgs x assigned to given sentence x by the predictive analyzer however are usually different from the structural description sdg x assigned to the same sentence by the original context free grammar g from which g is derived in section an algorithm originally due to abbott is described standard form grammar each of whose rule is in standard form supplemented by additional information describing it derivation from the original context free grammar technique for performing the sdgs x to sdg x transformation effectively is also described in section the augmented predictive analyzer parsing algorithm for arbitrary context free language is compared with two other parsing algorithm selective top to bottom algorithm similar to iron error correcting parse algorithm and an immediate constituent analyzer which is an extension of sakai cockes algorithm for normal grammar the comparison is based upon several criterion of efficiency covering core storage requirement complexity of the program and processing time |

1379|final solution to the dangling else of algol and related language the dangling else problem consists of class of potential ambiguity in algol like conditional statement whose basic form is if b then if b then s else s where b and b are boolean expression and s and s are basic statement the difficulty lie in whether to attach the else to the first if or to the second one existing solution to the problem are either ambiguous or unnecessarily restrictive let sand s be statement we define s to be closed if s else s is not statement and to be open if s else s is statement thus an unconditional statement is closed statement open and closed conditional statement are defined by syntax equation in such way to preserve openness and closure in each case an else must always be preceded by closed statement it is shown that the syntax equation are unambiguous and that may change in the statement type required within the syntax equation would lead to either ambiguity or unnecessary restriction |
1380|simula an algol based simulation language this paper is an introduction to simula programming language designed to provide system analyst with unified concept which facilitate the concise description of discrete event system system description also serf source language simulation program simula is an extension of algol in which the most important new concept is that of quasi parallel processing |
1381|impact of computer on the undergraduate mathematics curriculum the use of computer to permit the widespread application of mathematical idea requiring computation in science and technology is extremely significant for the understanding of our current society student interest in this development is intense and if properly utilized should yield much better understanding of mathematical concept well the idea of programming and logical structure which have been introduced into many field by the use of computer the present paper suggests that that portion of the undergraduate mathematical curriculum which is preparation for the use of mathematics by person who are not professional mathematician be modified to include the extension and clarification which are possible because of computer an early introduction to programming is desirable to permit continuing use of automatic computation to illustrate and clarify mathematical concept following the calculus equation stage an intensive introduction to numerical analysis should be added to the current curriculum in addition to providing competence in the mostly used computing technique it would permit more sophisticated utilization of the advanced mathematical idea associated with complex variable and transform theory |

1386|symbolic factoring of polynomial in several variable an algorithm for finding the symbolic factor of multi variate polynomial with integer coefficient is presented the algorithm is an extension of technique used by kronecker in proof that the prime factoring of any polynomial may be found in finite number of step the algorithm consists of factoring single variable instance of the given polynomial by kronecker method and introducing the remaining variable by interpolation technique for implementing the algorithm and several example are discussed the algorithm promise sufficient power to be used efficiently in an online system for symbolic mathematics |
1387|solution of system of polynomial equation by elimination the elimination procedure described by williams been coded in lisp and formac and used in solving system of polynomial equation it is found that the method is very effective in the case of small system where it yield all solution without the need for initial estimate the method by itself appears in appropriate however in the solution of large system of equation due to the explosive growth in the intermediate equation and the hazard which arise when the coefficient are truncated comparison is made with difficulty found in other problem in non numerical mathematics such symbolic integration and simplification |
1388|automast automatic mathematical analysis and symbolic translation procedure for numerically solving system of ordinary differential equation is shown to also generate symbolic solution the procedure is based on finite taylor series expansion that includes an estimate of the error in the final result computer program is described that read in system of such equation and then generates the expansion for all of the dependent variable the expansion are determined symbolically hence any non numeric parameter in the original equation are carried automatically into the final expansion thus the exact influence of any parameter on the problem solution can be easily displayed |

1390|convert programming language is described which is applicable to problem conveniently described by transformation rule by this is meant that pattern may be prescribed each being associated with skeleton so that series of such pair may be searched until pattern is found which match an expression to be transformed the condition for match are governed by code which also allows subexpressions to be identified and eventually substituted into the corresponding skeleton the primitive pattern and primitive skeleton are described well the principle which allow their elaboration in to more complicated pattern and skeleton the advantage of the language are that it allows one to apply transformation rule to list and array easily string that both pattern and skeleton may be defined recursively and that consequence program may be stated quite concisely |

1392|experience with formac algorithm design various facet of the design and implementation of mathematical expression manipulation algorithm are discussed concrete example are provided by the formac expand and differentiation algorithm basic formac utility routine and an experiment in the extraction of the skeletal structure of an expression one recurrent theme is the need to avoid excessive intermediate expression swell in order to minimize core storage requirement although many detail from the formac implementation are presented an attempt is made to stress principle and idea of general relevance in the design of algorithm for manipulating mathematical expression |
1393|pm system for polynomial manipulation pm is an ibm program system for formal manipulation of polynomial in any number of variable with integral coefficient unrestricted in size some of the formal operation which can be performed by the system are sum difference product quotient derivative substitution and greater common divisor pm is based on the refco iii list processing system which is described and compared with the lisp and slip system the pm subroutine for arithmetic of large integer are described constituting an independently useful subsystem pm is compared with the alpak system in several respect including the choice of canonical form for polynomial new algorithm for polynomial greatest common divisor calculation is mentioned and exaples are included to illustrate it superiority |

1408|the eschenbach drum scheme the prime function of drum operating in real time is to perform access quickly the usual mean for increasing this capacity is to incorporate engineering or hardware improvement in this paper the problem is attacked not by changing the drum but rather by modifying the manner in which it operates at the outset drum is given functional definition then simple design scheme eschenbach is introduced which enormously increase the rate of accessing for drum so defined this is shown to enable system to perform job by employing fewer or expensive drum it is suggested that although the design scheme specific use the method underlying it more general applicability the question of the efficacy of the drum scheme is then raised to deal with this standard of efficiency is developed in light of realistic real time circumstance the drum scheme is then modelled in manner which permit it to be analyzed problem in queueing theory thus one is enabled to ascertain whether the drum scheme is efficient enough for it application again whereas the analysis of the drum scheme specific use the method underlying it have more general applicability |
1409|nebula digital computer using mc glass delay line memory oregon state university designed and constructed medium speed serial digital computer using glass delay line circulating at mc memory the design objective originally conceived in special seminar were to be research project in computer design to be usable an educational machineand to have easily modifiable hardware for basic research in computer system design an unusual arrangement of information within the mc memory allows simple interface with the kc arithmetic unit which result in an effective zero latency time and provides possibility for an associative memory the arithmetic unit command structure similar to large parallel machine and us flip flop arithmetic and control register throughout all hardware development been aimed toward the concept of easy modification elaborate console control for effective man machine interaction and low cost |
1410|interarrival statistic for time sharing system the optimization of time shared system performance requires the description of the stochastic process governing the user input and the program activity this paper provides statistical description of the user input process in the sdc arpa general purpose time sharing system tss the input process is assumed to be stationary and to be defined by the interarrival time distribution the data obtained appear to justify satisfactorily the common assumption that the interarrival time are serially independent the data do not appear to justify except very rough approximation the usual assumption off an exponential distribution for interarrival time much more satisfactory approximation to the data can be obtained with biphase or triphase hyperexponential distribution |
1411|comparison of several algorithm for computation of mean standard deviation and correlation coefficient several algorithm for computation of basic statistic are compared by their performance on systematically generated test data the statistic calculated were the mean standard deviation and correlation coefficient for each statistic the algorithm included the usual computing formula correction due to an accumulated error term and recursive computation of the current value of the statistic the usual computing formula were also evaluated in double precision large error were noted for some calculation using the usual computing formula the most reliable technique wa correction of the initial estimate by use of an accumulated error term to eliminate the need for making two pass on the data it wa suggested that the initial estimate of the mean be obtained from subset of the data |

1423|simple algorithm for computing the generalized inverse of matrix the generalized inverse of matrix is important in analysis because it provides an extension of the concept of an inverse which applies to all matrix it also many application in numerical analysis but it is not widely used because the existing algorithm are fairly complicated and require considerable storage space simple extension been found to the conventional orthogonalization method for inverting non singular matrix which give the generalized inverse with little extra effort and with additional storage requirement the algorithm give the generalized inverse for any m by n matrix including the special case when mn and is non singular and the case when mn and ranka n in the first case the algorithm give the ordinary inverse of in the second case the algorithm yield the ordinary least square transformation matrix invaaa and the advantage of avoiding the loss of significance which result in forming the product aa explicitly |

1462|multilevel operating system the basic software for all newer computer is built on the well established need for standard operating system this implies that all application matter how large complex or time consuming must operate under or more precisely on top of the standard system large application require supervisory monitor which handle problem similar to those of the operating system but at different level sometimes still third or even fourth such level is required or desirable this lead naturally to the concept of multilevel system similar vertically but different horizontally proper division of responsibility between level lead to greater efficiency and logical complexity while actually enhancing capability |

1469|the next programming language family of unimplemented computing language is described that is intended to span difference of application area by unified framework this framework dictate the rule about the us of user coined name and the convention about characterizing functional relationship within this framework the design of specific language split into two independent part one is the choice of written appearance of program or more generally their physical representation the other is the choice of the abstract entity such number character string list of them functional relation among them that can be referred to in the language the system is biased towards expression rather than statement it includes nonproceduralpurely functional subsystem that aim to expand the class of user need that can be met by single print instruction without sacrificing the important property that make conventional right hand side expression easy to construct and understand |
1470|the structure of programming language the following are identified major component of every programming language the elementary program statement mechanism for linking elementary statement together the mean by which program can obtain data input several alternative form of each of these component are described compared and evaluated many example frequently from list processing language illustrate the form described elementary program statement usually take the form of command requirement or implicit specification command is an imperative statement that command the action to be taken requirement describes the effect to be achieved without saying anything about the action to be taken an implicit specification is similar to requirement but the programmer must understand what action will be taken to achieve the desired effect subroutine may be entered explicitly by execute call or by function composition explicitly called subroutine generally require special linkage convention an execute subroutine call is syntactically indistinguishable from basic instruction of the programming language function composition is convenient alternative to the explicit call the three principal way of getting input for routine are by referring to the data itself by referring to the data by name and by referring to it implicitly by mean of variable or function name are useful entry point into permanent data structure but can be error causing distraction in other context the author discus advantage disadvantage and factor influencing the choice of form of component for language concludes by suggesting the evolution of programming language toward one which will permit all the most convenient way of structuring program organizing system and referencing data |

1474|test of probabilistic model for propagation of roundoff error in any prolonged computation it is generally assumed that the accumulated effect of roundoff error is in some sense statistical the purpose of this paper is to give precise description of certain probabilistic model for roundoff error and then to describe series of experiment for testing the validity of these model it is concluded that the model are in general very good discrepancy are both rare and mild the test technique can also be used to experiment with various type of special arithmetic |

1485|the structure of programming language in this paper the major component of every programming language are identified the elementary program statement mechanism for linking elementary statement together the mean by which program can obtain data input several alternative form of each of these component are also described compared and evaluated many example frequently from list processing language illustrate the form described the advantage disadvantage and factor influencing the choice of form of component for language are discussed and the paper concludes with the suggestion that programming language evolve toward one which will permit all the most convenient way of structuring program organizing system and referencing data |

1487|eliza computer program for the study ofnatural language communication between man and machine eliza is program operating within the mac time sharing system at mit which make certain kind of natural language conversation between man and computer possible input sentence are analyzed on the basis of decomposition rule which are triggered by key word appearing in the input text response are generated by reassembly rule associated with selected decomposition rule the fundamental technical problem with which eliza is concerned are the identification of key word the discovery of minimal context the choice of appropriate transformation generation of response in the absence of key word and the provision of an editing capability for eliza script discussion of some psychological issue relevant to the eliza approach well of future development concludes the paper |
1488|programming decision table in fortran cobol or algol simple broad based approach for programming decision table in fortran or cobol is developed and presented with input in standard form defined in the paper the programming of any decision table can be done with one or two fortran statement or with two cobol statement if the compute verb is available in the cobol processor it is shown that the method is applicable even when there are more than two mutually exclusive state of one two or more table condition it is further shown that multi state condition in decision table can often simplify the programming the method outlined the further advantage that all possible combination of condition are considered it is shown that the suggested procedure is easily implemented in algol |

1491|euler generalization algol and it formal definition part i method for defining programming language is developed which introduces rigorous relationship between structure and meaning the structure of language is defined by phrase structure syntax the meaning in term of the effect which the execution of sequence of interpretation rule exerts upon fixed set of variable called the environment there exists one to one correspondence between syntactic rule and interpretation rule is determined by the sequence of corresponding syntactic reduction which constitute parse the individual interpretation rule are explained in term of an elementary an d obvious algorithmic notation constructive method for evaluating text is provided and for certain decidable class of language their unambiguity is proved an example generalization of algol is described in full detail to demonstrate that concept like block structure procedure parameter etc can be defined adequately and precisely by this method |

1496|formal semantics for computer language and it application in compiler compiler semantic meta language been developed for representing the meaning of statement in large class of computer language this meta language been the basis for construction of an efficient functioning compiler compiler an informal discussion of the meta language based on the example of complete translator for small language is presented |
1497|on the normalization requirement of divisor in divide and correct method this paper present an analysis on the normalization requirement of the divisor in divide and correct method this analysis is made subject to the condition that not more than one correction is required to obtain the true quotient character from the trial estimate got from the division of two precision segment of every partial remainder by suitably rounded single precision divisor this segmented division is denoted here precision basic division it is found that the normalization requirement could be narrowed down to smaller range of divisor provided the magnitude of the character next to the leading character of the divisor is known if however the normalization is to be eliminated one to choose proper higher precision segment of operand for the basic division also considered is the possibility of eliminating the normalization by an increase on the number of correction on the quotient estimate got from precision basic division it is shown that such scheme is economical only for small radix |

1503|simscript fortran case study two program for vehicle dispatching model one written in simscript and the other in fortran iv are compared the comparison is made in term of basic program design decision storage requirement computer time used and the ease of making change in the simscript program the primary design consideration center around the choice of model variable model changing event and model testing in the fortran program basic design problem relate to the representation of the passage of time the allocation of storage and the organization of input data the comparison of these differently designed program show that the simscript program us more computer storage and more computer time but requires fewer program change to introduce model revision |
1504|algorithm for finding fundamental set of cycle for an undirected linear graph given the adjacency matrix of the graph the algorithm presented in this paper find spanning tree and then construct the set of fundamental cycle our algorithm is slower than an algorithm presented by welch by ratio of n n is the number of node but requires storage for graph with large number of node and edge when storage is limited our algorithm is superior to welchs however when the graph are small or machine storage is very large welchs algorithm is superior timing estimate and storage requirement for both method are presented |

1517|method for analyzing data from computer simulation experiment this paper address itself to the problem of analyzing data generated by computer simulation of economic system we first turn to hypothetical firm whose operation is represented by single channel multistation queueing model the firm seek to maximize total expected profit for the coming period by selecting one of five operating plan where each plan incorporates certain marketing strategy an allocation of productive input and total cost the result of the simulated activity under each plan are subjected to an f test two multiple comparison method and multiple ranking method we illustrate compare and evaluate these technique the paper adopts the position that the particular technique of analysis possibly not any one of the above chosen by the experimenter should be an expression of his experimental objective the f test test the homogeneity of the plan multiple comparison method quantify their difference and multiple ranking method directly identify the one best plan or best plan |

1524|stopping criterion for polynomial root finding when searching for the root of polynomial it is generally difficult to know just when to accept number an adequate approximation to the root in this paper an algorithm is presented which allows one to terminate the iteration process on the basis of calculated bound for the roundoff error which occurs in evaluating the polynomial this stopping criterion been tested on numerous example and been found to serve satisfactory mean for accepting complex number zero of real polynomial |
1525|on computing the fast fourier transform cooley and tukey have proposed fast algorithm for computing complex fourier transform and have shown major time saving in using it to compute large transforms on digital computer with n power of two computing time for this algorithm is proportional to n log n major improvement over other method with computing time proportional to n in this paper the fast fourier transform algorithm is briefly reviewed and fast difference equation method for accurately computing the needed trigonometric function value are given the problem of computing large fourier transform on system with virtual memory is considered and solution is proposed this method been used to compute complex fourier transforms of size n on computer with word of core storage this exceeds by factor of eight the maximum radix two transform size with fixed allocation of this amount of core storage the method also been used to compute large mixed radix transforms scaling plan for computing the fast fourier transform with fixed point arithmetic is also given |

1535|comment on index register allocation technique is presented to reduce the enumeration required by known procedure for optimal index register allocation in straight line program this technique is based on the construction of link diagram which show at any step the future occurrence of index which must be loaded into index register this diagram determines in advance the required register configuration at certain step of the program so that the program is subdivided into separate portion to which the allocation procedure may be applied independently |

1593|simple technique for digital division simple and economical method for digital division is described the method is suitable for divisor whose leading character is either radix one or is unity with the next character equal to zero also the method is direct and need only half the number of arithmetic operation needed by variant of the harvard iterative method described by gilman which is suitable for similar divisor |
1594|an algorithm for generating permutation an algorithm is described which under repeated application generates all permutation of k element only the previously generated permutation the constant k and temporary index are needed starting with particular ordering of k element abcd repeated application of the algorithm will generate k additional permutation by k successive rotation from the initial circular ordering of k object another circular ordering can be obtained by rotating the k lowest element for each new k circular ordering another k can be obtained by rotating the k lowest element by continuing in this manner application of the algorithm will generate all k circular ordering or since each circular ordering yield k permutation the algorithm generates all k permutation |

1601|parallel numerical method for the solution of equation classical iterative procedure for the numerical solution of equation provide at each stage single new approximation to the root in question technique is given for the development of numerical procedure which provide at each stage several approximation to solution of an equation the several approximation obtained in any iteration are computationally independent making the method of interest in parallel processing environment convergence is insured by extracting the best information at each iteration several family of numerical procedure which use the technique of the procedure in parallel processing environment are developed and measurement of these statistic are reported these measurement are interpreted in parallel processing environment in such an environment the procedure obtained are superior to standard algorithm |
1602|pose language for posing problem to computer language pose is described which is drastic departure from the fortranalgol type though it doe utilize fortran formula and logic representation and actually contains fortran vi subset with the new language the user need only describe his problem in equation like form the method of solution is automatically provided in conjunction with the translation from equation form to computer instruction in this way the pose language user can solve difficult computational problem like the solution of differential equation without requiring knowledge of numerical method or the intricacy of computer subroutine logic essentially all clerical operation now required for fortran programming have been automated so that the pose programmer need not be concerned with these detail |

1605|an experimental comparison of time sharing and batch processing the effectiveness for program development of the mit compatible time sharing system ct wa compared with that of the ibm ibsys batch processing system by mean of statistically designed experiment an identical set of four programming problem wa assigned to each of group of four programming subject influence external to the system such the sequence of problem solution and programmer and problem characteristic were specified design factor in the experiment data wa obtained for six variable eg programmer time computer time elapsed time etc which were considered to be definitive of system effectiveness and analysis of variance technique were employed to estimate system difference in these variable after difference due to the design factor had been eliminated statistical analysis of the experimental result provided strong evidence of important system difference well critique of the experimental design itself with implication for further experimentation |

1608|numerical integration of function that pole it is common to need to integrate numerically function that diverge somewhere outside the range of integration even if the divergence occurs quite far away integration formula like simpson that depend on fitting polynomial usually will be inaccurate near pole they will be very bad method is described that give formula that will integrate function of this kind accurately if the order and position of the pole are known explicit formula are given that are easy to use on an automatic computer it is shown that they can be used for some other singularity well pole if the integral converges integration can be carried to the singularity the accuracy of the integration with pole of second order is discussed and an example the new formula is compared with simpson the new formula are useful even far from the pole while near the pole their advantage is overwhelming |
1609|scheduling university course examination by computer new approach to the problem of scheduling course examination is presented in principle an examination schedule which requires minimum number of examination period and satisfies the constraint that student be required to take two examination simultaneously can be found in two step first course which may have their examination scheduled at the same period are grouped together in all possible way then minimum number of these group such that each course is included at least once are selected by removing multiple occurrence of course and then scheduling each group at different period minimal schedule can be obtained known algorithm for carrying out these procedure are prohibitively expensive approximation to the ideal procedure outlined above are given which yield nonminimal but feasible schedule with very small expenditure of time result of experiment using these technique are given these are encouraging and indicate that further experimentation would be worthwhile |
