1612|top to bottom parsing rehabilitated this note is concerned with the efficiency of the top to bottom parsing algorithm used in connection with programming language grammar it is shown for instance that retracing of unprofitable path can often be eliminated by suitable rearrangement of the production defining the grammar the essential weakness of the method is in dealing with complicated syntactic structure which are in practice only sparsely occupied eg arithmetic expression |
1613|one pas compilation of arithmetic expression for parallel processor under the assumption that processor may have multiplicity of arithmetic unit compiler for such processor should produce object code to take advantage of possible parallelism of operation most of the presently known compilation technique are inadequate for such processor because they produce expression structure that must be evaluated serially technique is presented here for compiling arithmetic expression into structure that can be evaluated with high degree of parallelism the algorithm is variant of the so called top down analysis technique and requires only one pas of the input text |

1630|computer representation of planar region by their skeleton any region can be regarded union of maximal neighborhood of it point and can be specified by the center and radius of these neighborhood this set is sort ofskeleton of the region the storage required to represent region in this way is comparable to that required when it is represented by encoding it boundary moreover the skeleton representation seems to have advantage when it is necessary to determine repeatedly whether point are inside or outside the region or to perform set theoretic operation on region |

1641|use of fast and slow memory in list processing language scheme is described which permitting substantial increase in memory space utilized to store list structured data it consists in reducing to one level nonhomogeneous store composed of fast core and slow disk or drum memory the space available in slow memory is divided into page each containing given number of machine word the reduction to one level memory is performed by program which leaf the most often called page in the fast memory when new page from slow store is requested the page in core having the longest period of inactivity is transferred back to the slow store the complete scheme been implemented in connection with lisp embedding into algol using an ibm with k of core memory and disk gain in memory space were about fold often happens in programming application the price of the additional space is computer time although the disk have an access time time slower than core test indicate that the actual slow down varied from to depending on the number of page available in the fast store |

1643|an improvement to iterative method of polynomial factorization method of polynomial factorization which find the zero one at time require the division of the polynomial by the accepted factor it is shown how the accuracy of this division may be increased by dividing in order of both ascending and descending power of the variable and choosing crossover point which minimizes very simply calculated error criterion |

1645|note on computing approximation to the exponential function two method are discussed which result in near minimax rational approximation to the exponential function and at the same time retain the desirable property that the approximation for negative value of the argument is the reciprocal of the approximation for corresponding positive value these method lead to approximation which are much superior to the commonly used convergents of the gaussian continued fraction for the exponential coefficient and error are given for the interval ln ln and ln ln |

1647|watfor the university of waterloo fortran iv compiler watfor is an in core load and go compiler which been implemented within the ibm operating system fortran iv wa selected the source language in order to achieve maximum language compatibility with other available compiling system in particular the ibm fortran iv system the principal advantage of the watfor compiler is that it translates fortran iv program at speed of up to statement per second since the compiler resides core there is virtually system overhead and hence large batch of student program may be processed very efficiently the compiler also provides extensive error diagnostics during both the compilation and the execution phase of program run this feature make the system attractive to both learner and learned user alike |

1650|unifying computational method for the analysis of complete factorial experiment computational method which may be used for the calculation of sum of square in the analysis of variance of complete factorial experiment and in the computation of main effect or interaction mean is described the method is elucidated unifying since one method can be used for variety of purpose each previously requiring different method the programming advantage of such method are obvious the following variant are discussed the standard analysis of variance analysis omitting certain level of one or more factor separate analysis for some level of factor or for combination of level of more than one factor these are performed simultaneously the calculation of main effect or interaction mean the mean expects the data in standard order and it leaf the data in that order so that many analysis of the same data can be performed without rearrangement the total sum of square excluding replication sum of square is partitioned into all polynomial partition and their interaction each with one degree of freedom this is so even if factor have unequally spaced factor level |
1651|an interpretive input routine for linear programming in this descriptive article an input code is presented which greatly simplifies data input to any linear programming solution routine for subsequent use either pedagogical device or for solving rather small lp problem this latter limited use derives not at all from inherent limitation in the code itself but from an efficiency evaluation large lp problem would doubtless benefit from an input system more suited for bulk data handling than the input code described from user standpoint input appears almost exactly textbook presentation of the lp problem limited only by keypunchs inability to write subscript etc the input interpreter scan column wise thus fixed format data preparation is required the user may also under very general requirement only liberally use editorial comment throughout the input deck an aid in identification eg of row constraint the article includes example of input output from solution routine presently in use and skeleton flowchart of the input interpreter |

1664|an algorithm for deriving the equation of mathematical physic by symbolic manipulation method is described whereby digital computer can be used to derive the equation of mathematical physic in any curvilinear coordinate system requested by the user the effectiveness of the technique is demonstrated by using it to derive the navier stokes equation of fluid motion and the continuity equation to derive these equation by this method the user need know only the coordinate transformation equation relating the curvilinear coordinate of interest to an orthogonal cartesian triad when this program is used and the coordinate transformation equation are supplied input the computer will derive the navier stokes equation and the continuity equation the equation obtained will be relative to the curvilinear coordinate system specified by the transformation equation used input in this paper the emphasis is on theoretical consideration and methodology rather than on programming detail result are presented for cylindrical polar and spherical polar coordinate system |
1665|automatic generation of efficient lexical processor using finite state technique the practical application of the theory of finite state automaton to automatically generate lexical processor is dealt with in this tutorial article by the use of the aed rword system developed at mit part of the aed system this system accepts input description of the multicharacter item or of word allowable in language given in term of subset of regular expression the output of the system is lexical processor which read string of character and combine them into the item defined by the regular expression each output item is identified by code number together with pointer to block of storage containing the character and character count in the item the processor produced by the system are based on finite state machine each state of machine corresponds to unique condition in the lexical processing of character string at each state character is read and the machine change to new state at each transition appropriate action are taken based on the particular character read the system been in operation since and processor generated have compared favorably in speed to carefully hand coded program to accomplish the same task lexical processor for aed and mad are among the many which have been produced the technique employed are independent of the nature of the item being evaluated if the word event is substituted for character string these processor may be described generalized decision making mechanism based upon an ordered sequence of event this allows the system to be used in range of application outside the area of lexical processing however convenient these advantage may be speed is the most important consideration in designing system for automatic generation of lexical processor the goal wa processor which completely eliminated backup or rereading which wa nearly fast hand coded processor which would analyze the language and detect error and which would be convenient and easy to use |

1679|fast fourier transform algorithm for real valued series new procedure is presented for calculating the complex discrete fourier transform of real valued time series this procedure is described for an example where the number of point in the series is an integral power of two this algorithm preserve the order and symmetry of the cooley turkey fast fourier transform algorithm while effecting the two to one reduction in computation and storage which can be achieved when the series is real also discussed are hardware and software implementation of the algorithm which perform only n log n complex multiply and add operation and which require only n real storage location in analyzing each n point record |

1684|ambiguity in limited entry decision table the use of decision table tool in system analysis and for program specification is now becoming accepted rule on redundancy contradiction and completeness for limited entry table were published in these are usually used for checking preceded if necessary by conversion from extended to limited entry form processor which automatically translate table to more conventional program usually base their diagnostic facility on these rule in this paper it is suggested that these rule are unsatisfactory and that the important aspect of checking is to eliminate ambiguity from table ambiguity is defined and discussed and procedure for producing checked out decision table is proposed the theoretical basis of the algorithm used is established the importance of well designed diagnostic facility in decision table processor is emphasized |

1691|comparison of the correlational behavior of random number generator for the ibm hutchinson state that the new prime modulo multiplicative congruential pseudorandom generator attributed to d h lehmer passed the usual statistical test for random number generator it is here empirically shown that generator of this type can produce sequence whose autocorrelation function up to lag exhibit evidence of nonrandomness for many multiplicative constant an alternative generator proposed by tausworthe which us irreducible polynomial over the field of characteristic two is shown to be free from this defect the applicability of these two generator to the ibm is then discussed since computer word size can affect generator statistical behavior the older mixed and simple congruential generator although extensively tested on computer having or more bit per word may not be optimum generator for the ibm |

1695|plexus an on line system for modeling neural network description is presented of plexus system which enables user to construct and specify neural network to analyze the output data produced by the network and to store and retrieve network and data from library the system operated entirely from digital display unit interacts directly with the user and permit easy and rapid transition between the various phase of the modeling process plexus is designed to complement neurophysiological research so that the systematic development of neural model can be coordinated with experimental work plexus network are built up from component representing individual neuron external stimulus and interconnecting fiber each component being of relatively detailed nature provision is also made for the use of experimental data input to network convenient mean for specification and modification of network and extensive error checking capability are provided data resulting from the simulation of network may be analyzed by variety of technique ranging from examination of the gross characteristic of the data to the determination of detailed statistical property |

1709|modification of efroymsons technique for stepwise regression analysis the computational technique conventionally used for stepwise multiple linear regression requires the storage of an n x n matrix of data when the number of variable n is large this requirement tax the storage capacity of presently used machinery the near symmetry of the matrix involved permit modification requiring only half the storage and computation of the conventional algorithm and this additional storage allows the analysis of problem containing more variable alternatively it permit the analysis of problem containing the same number of variable but with all computation performed in double precision |

1721|determination of the intersection point of two plane curve by mean of differential equation new method is proposed to calculate the intersection point of two plane curve the theory of singular point off system of two differential equation is used in developing the method the intersection point to be determined is identified with such singular point and appropriate modification are applied to the system to ensure that the singular point be stable ie all integral which start in the neighborhood of the singular point will always approach this point if the integral parameter tends to infinity in addition method is described for systematically searching for all intersection point in prescribed rectangular area |
1722|method of convergence improvement for some improper integral in the numerical integration of an improper integral of the first kind it is customary to truncate the integral when the change yielded by the last iteration is than some predetermined constant the efficiency of such integration scheme can often be improved by use of recent advance in the theory of nonlinear transformation however for several important integral eg integral whose integrands are rational polynomial these transformation fail to yield much improvement in this paper several method of convergence improvement are developed which greatly improve convergence of some improper integral including the integral of rational polynomial |
1723|computer construction of project network project network are used in pert and cpm an algorithm is given for constructing project network directly from the project precedence relation the algorithm creates dummy activity and topologically order the arc and node the number of node created is minimal for the given precedence relation it been experimentally programmed in fortran ii for the ibm |
1724|generalized partial pas block sort the design of partial pas block sort with arbitrary range of key and number of work file is described the design is generalization of the partial pas column sort by ashenhurst and the amphisbaenic sort by nagler the power of the sort is tabulated for various size of input file and number of work file consideration is given to the problem of combining block sort with internal sort and to the best use of direct access storage device |
1725|simple proof of lewins ordered retrieval theorem for associative memory an efficient method of ordered retrieval of binary word from an associative memory described by lewin is based on the use of special readout circuit which indicate the digit value present in the individual digit column of the memory thus the circuit indicate whether the individual digit column contain digit of both value or of only one value or contain digit at all ie that the memory is empty the use of these circuit which in this paper are termed column value indicator reduces considerably the number of memory access necessary to retrieve in order number of distinct word from the memory lewin prof that for the readout by the described method of m distinct binary word m memory access are necessary thus prof that the number of necessary memory access of his method unlike those of other method is independent of the word length in this paper very simple proof of this theorem derived from some elementary aspect of the structure of set of binary number is presented |
1726|preliminary investigation of technique for automated reading of unformatted text method for converting unstructured printed material into computer code are experimentally investigated an operator controlled mode depending on human demarcation of the various region of the page for guiding the scanner is implemented by mean of joystick and crt display this mode for which some performance figure are obtained is thought to be suitable for processing very complicated material such technical journal for simpler material for instance the claim section of patent and in application where the utmost accuracy is not necessary an unsupervised mode is advocated here the textual portion of the page are located during rapid prescan by rudimentary form of frequency analysis these area are then rescanned at higher resolution suitable for character recognition error rate of the order of percent are obtained in simple problem involving photograph of telephone company meter board other matter related to the design of general purpose page reader such the segmentation of printed text the possibility of time sharing the scanner interactive man machine operation and the facsimile reproduction of illustration are discussed |
1727|one way of estimating frequency of jump in program for the segmentation of program it is useful to have reasonable estimation of the value of sij where sij is the mean value of the number of jump from the i th instruction on to the j th instruction in the run time in the case where the sij are estimated directly the structure of the whole program must be generally taken into account therefore it is very difficult for the programmer andor the translator to obtain good estimation of the sij it is easier to estimate not sij but the quantity pijsijcisumsij j n where ci is an arbitrary positive constant for each i although the pij are for each i proportional to sij the estimation of pij is easier because we must estimate only the probability of event where instruction i is executed after instruction ii this estimation can often be done without considering the structure of the whole program in the first part of the paper using the theory of the markov chain an algorithm for the computation of the sij from the pij is found and some way of obtaining estimate of the pij are given in the second part variant of this algorithm is derived avoiding the necessity of computation involving large matrix |
1728|further experimental data on the behavior of program in paging environment result are summarized from an empirical study directed at the measurement of program operating behavior in those multiprogramming system in which program are organized into fixed length page the data collected from the interpretive execution of number of paged program are used to describe the frequency of page fault ie the frequency of those instant at which an executing program requires page of data or instruction not in main core memory these data are used also for the evaluation of page replacement algorithm and for assessing the effect on performance of change in the amount of storage allocated to executing program |

1769|the expanding world of computer the onward sweep of automatic processing of information is impeded by nine principal barrier geography cost problem complexity man machine communication inadequate sensor lack of understanding distance time and size the main incentive for breaching these barrier is the universal need for processing information ever more urgent the greater part of human work activity change from production to service computer development in hardware programming time sharing education data communication and display are judged by how effectively they remove these barrier and their barrier smashing potentiality indicate continued rapid expansion problem oriented language are particularly effective over the entire front online computer and time sharing also rate high by this measure education and increased understanding are basic to all progress with the computer this complex but powerful tool is the most important one available to government and scientist to use in studying the problem being created by the population explosion and in analyzing possible solution |

1784|practical error coefficient for estimating quadrature error for analytic function all published error coefficient for estimating quadrature error for analytic function were computed on the assumption that the quadrature rule wa exact for polynomial up to given degree since these rule use rounded value for the abscissa and weight and since the true value of the integral of some of the polynomial in question have an infinite binary expression the quadrature rule is not exact hence these error must be taken into consideration in computing practical error coefficient |

1805|productivity of multiprogrammed computer progress in developing an analytic prediction method multiprogramming it is discussed here is mode of computer operation in which two or more program are concurrently in processor memory and proceeding each using the same central processor unit cpu and input output io channel these program are actually proceeding intermittently and singly according to eligibility readiness to proceed and priority it is useful to be able to represent them proceeding continuously and simultaneously each at an effective rate which may be fraction of that which it would enjoy in the absence of the other program the effective progress rate of each program is sensitive to many detailed characteristic of itself and it co resident and simulation been the best available method of predicting it this paper present the result of progress in developing an alternative to simulation simulation tested iterative computation of these rate under certain situation the algorithm is sensitive to most of the factor that control the phenomenon including nonquantitative or topological feature of the program structure |
1806|on the downhill method the downhill method is numerical method for solving complex equation fz on which the only restriction is that the function w fz must be analytical an introduction to this method is given and critical review of relating literature is presented although in theory the method always converges it is shown that fundamental dilemma exists which may cause breakdown in practical application to avoid this difficulty and to improve the rate of convergence toward root some modification of the original method are proposed and program fortran based on the modified method is given in algorithm some numerical example are included |
1807|optimization of expression in fortran method of optimizing the computation of arithmetic and indexing expression of fortran program is presented the method is based on linear analysis of the definition point of the variable and the branching and do loop structure of the program the objective of the processing are to eliminate redundant calculation when reference are made to common subexpression value to remove invariant calculation from do loop to efficiently compute subscript containing do iteration variable and to provide efficient index register usage the method presented requires at least three pas compiler the second of which is scanned backward it been used in the development of several fortran compiler that have proved to produce excellent object code without significantly reducing the compilation speed |
1808|advanced cryptographic technique for computer cryptographic technique which can be used to maintain the confidentiality of information processed by computer are dealt with special emphasis is paid to the unique characteristic of computer file that make many cryptographic method of little use relative security cost and preferred method are included in this paper |
1809|numerical analysis in phd computer science program numerical analysis is the study of method and procedure used to obtain approximate solution to mathematical problem much of the emphasis is on scientific calculation the difficulty of education in such broad area center around the question of background and emphasis the numerical analysis program in the computer science department should emphasize an awareness of the problem of computer implementation and experimental procedure nevertheless there is need for solid background in applied mathematics |
1810|is automatic folding of program efficient enough to displace manual the operation of folding program into the available memory is discussed measurement by brown et and by nelson on an automatic folding mechanism of simple design demand paging unit built at the ibm research center by belady nelson oneil and others permitting it quality to be compared with that of manual folding are discussed and it is shown that given some care in use the unit performs satisfactorily under the condition tested even though it is operating across memory to storage interface with very large speed difference the disadvantage of prefolding which is required when the folding is manual are examined and number of the important trouble which beset computing today are shown to arise from or be aggravated by this source it is concluded that folding mechanism will probably become normal part of most computing system |
1811|case study in programming for parallel processor an affirmative partial answer is provided to the question of whether it is possible to program parallel processor computing system to efficiently decrease execution time for useful problem parallel processor system are multiprocessor system in which several of the processor can simultaneously execute separate task of single job thus cooperating to decrease the solution time of computational problem the processor have independent instruction counter meaning that each processor executes it own task program relatively independently of the other processor communication between cooperating processor is by mean of data in storage shared by all processor program for the determination of the distribution of current in an electrical network wa written for parallel processor computing system and execution of this program wa simulated the data gathered from simulation run demonstrate the efficient solution of this problem typical of large class of important problem it is shown that with proper programming solution time when n processor are applied approach n time the solution time for single processor while improper programming can actually lead to an increase of solution time with the number of processor stability of the method of solution wa also investigated |

1824|aparel parse request language aparel is described this language is an extension to an algorithmic language pli that provides the pattern matching capability normally found only in special purpose language such snobol and tmg this capability is provided through parse request stated in bnf like format these parse request form their own programming language with special sequencing rule upon successfully completing parse request an associated piece of pli code is executed this code available for use normal pli string the various piece at all level of the parse it also available normal pli variable the information concerning which of the various alternative were successful convenient facility for multiple input output stream the initiation of sequence of parse request subroutine and parse time semantic check are also included aparel proven convenient in building powerful syntax and function macro system an algebraic language preprocessor debugging system an on line command parser translator for dataless programming and general string manipulator |
1825|practical method for constructing lrk processor practical method for constructing lrk processor is developed these processor are capable of recognizing and parsing an input during single backup scan in number of step equal to the length of the input plus the number of step in it derivation the technique presented here is based on the original method described by knuth but decrease both the effort required to construct the processor and the size of the processor produced this procedure involves partitioning the given grammar into number of smaller part if an lrk processor can be constructed for each part using knuths algorithm and if certain condition relating these individual processor are satisfied then an lrk processor for the entire grammar can be constructed for them using this procedure an lr parser for algol been obtained |
1826|lisp garbage collector for virtual memory computer system in this paper garbage collection algorithm for list processing system which operate within very large virtual memory is described the object of the algorithm is more the compaction of active storage than the discovery of free storage because free storage is never really exhausted the decision to garbage collect is not easily made therefore various criterion of this decision are discussed |
1827|performance monitoring in time sharing system software measurement facility which is part of general purpose time sharing system is described the date collection facility dcf been implemented in the michigan terminal system mt for the system model it exists for the purpose of monitoring operating system and user program behavior and performance the overall structure of mt is outlined in order to explain the implementation of the dcf event in the system are identified and recorded from within the supervisor and dumped to magnetic tape by an auxiliary program for off line processing event in user program which are unrelated to system action are recorded with supervisor call the time of occurrence of each event is accurately recorded and data item are further identified by job and type the overhead associated with data collection and it interference with normal job is carefully analyzed and both are shown to be minimal several example are given of information obtained with the facility and of application in which it been useful some general guideline are offered for the construction of future monitoring program |

1829|an interactive graphical display monitor in batch processing environment with remote entry graphic monitor program is described it wa developed at carnegie mellon university for the cdc g computer which is general purpose batch processing system with remote entry the existing g system and the graphic hardware are described the graphic monitor is resident auxiliary monitor which provides comprehensive managerial capability over the graphical system in response to command from the human user it also will respond to command from user program through similar interface where routine call take the place of manual action thus the human and program can interact on symmetrical and equal basis through the medium of the graphic monitor the choice made in designing the graphic monitor given the constraint of the existing hardware and computer system are discussed the structure of the monitor program and the human and program interface are described there is also transient swapping version with small resident part and provision for swapped used submonitors |

1844|modular computer sharing system an alternative approach to the design and organization of general purpose interactive multiterminal computing system is presented the system organization described is conceptually simple arrangement of bank of interchangeable computer each of which is memoryprocessor pair that are assigned to process terminal job they arrive one of the computer serf the master or control computer and supervises the collection and distribution of message from and to the remote terminal in the simplest form there is disk drive for each connected terminal crosspoint switching network allows any such disk drive to be connected to any computer thus while each active terminal user occupies dedicated disk drive may share the computer with many other terminal user in simple manner the ratio of user to computer is dependent on both the size and power of the machine used and the computation requirement of the particular mix of user this system organization is inherently simpler and therefore more reliable approach to time sharing computer and the potential of highly available system at relatively low cost economic configuration are possible for range of system size that span at least one order of magnitude finally problem program developed by remote terminal user can be run on dedicated batch system if compatible computer are used |

1846|on simulating network of parallel process in which simultaneous event may occur some of the problem of simulating discrete event system particularly computer system on conventional digital computer are dealt with the system are assumed to be described network of interconnected sequential process briefly reviewed are the common technique used to handle such simulation when simultaneous event do not occur can be ignored or can be handled by simple priority rule following this the problem of dealing with simultaneous event in separate process is introduced an abstraction of this problem is developed which admits solution for majority of commonly encountered problem the technique will either find method of simulating the parallel event or report that none can be found in some of the latter case it is shown to be possible to find solution by extending the information available to the solution technique but in many case the technique becomes computationally unfeasible when the additional information is provided |
1847|an algorithm for finding fundamental set of cycle of graph fast method is presented for finding fundamental set of cycle for an undirected finite graph spanning tree is grown and the vertex examined in turn unexamined vertex being stored in pushdown list to await examination one stage in the process is to take the top element v of the pushdown list and examine it ie inspect all those edge v z of the graph for which z not yet been examined if z is already in the tree fundamental cycle is added if not the edge v z is placed in the tree there is exactly one such stage for each of the n vertex of the graph for large n the store required in crease n and the time ng where g depends on the type of graph involved g is bounded below by and above by and it is shown that both bound are attained in term of storage our algorithm is similar to that of gotlieb and corneil and superior to that of welch in term of speed it is similar to that of welch and superior to that of gotlieb and corneil testsshow our algorithm to be remarkably efficient g on random graph |

1853|compact list representation definition garbage collection and system implementation compact list are stored sequentially in memory rather than chained with pointer since this is not always convenient the swym system permit list to be chained compact or any combination of the two description is given of that list representation and the operator implemented most are similar to those of lisp the system garbage collector attempt to make all list compact it relocates and rearranges all of list storage using temporary storage this unique list compacting garbage collection algorithm is presented in detail several class of the macro used to implement the system are described finally consideration is given to those design factor essential to the success of plex processing system implementation |
1854|on multiprogramming machine coding and computer organization the author feel that the interrupt feature which is available in most modern computer is potent source of programming pitfall and error and that it therefore may heavily contribute to the unreliability of program making use of it programming scheme is presented which avoids the concept of the interrupt and permit the specification of concurrent or pseudoconcurrent activity in supposedly more perspicuous manner it is intended to serve basis for the construction of operating system which are prime example of program with concurrent activity the scheme includes set of basic instruction for the generation termination and synchronization of parallel process set of routine representing these instruction and thereby simulating hypothetical machine organization been implemented and test on the ibm system two program using these instruction written in pl are presented |
1855|program for the syntactic analysis of english sentence program is described which produce syntactic analysis of english sentence with respect to transformational grammar the main feature of the analyzer are that it us only limited dictionary of english word and that it pursues all analysis path simultaneously while processing the sentence from left to right the form of representation used for the dictionary and the grammar is indicated and an outline account is given of the analysis procedure technique for keeping the size of the analysis record within reasonable limit and for avoiding the need for dynamic application of certain transformational rule are described number of example of output produced by the program are given the output includes timing information |
1856|the teachable language comprehender simulation program and theory of language the teachable language comprehender tlc is program designed to be capable of being taught to comprehend english text when text which the program not seen before is input to it it comprehends that text by correctly relating each explicit or implicit assertion of the new text to large memory this memory is semantic network representing factual assertion about the world the program also creates copy of the part of it memory which have been found to relate to the new text adapting and combining these copy to represent the meaning of the new text by this mean the meaning of all text the program successfully comprehends is encoded into the same format that of the memory in this form it can be added into the memory both factual assertion for the memory and the capability for correctly relating text to the memory prior content are to be taught to the program they are needed tlc presently contains relatively small number of example of such assertion and capability but within the system notation for expressing either of these are provided thus the program now corresponds to general process for comprehending language and it provides methodology for adding the additional information this process requires to actually comprehend text of any particular kind the memory structure and comprehension process of tlc allow new factual assertion and capability for relating text to such stored assertion to generalize automatically that is once such an assertion or capability is put into the system it becomes available to help comprehend great many other sentence in the future thus the addition of single factual assertion or linguistic capability will often provide large increment in tlc effective knowledge of the world and in it overall ability to comprehend text the program strategy is presented general theory of language comprehension |

1874|generating pseudorandom number on two complement machine such the ibm the familiar multiplicative congruential generator is examined in the context of the type of two complement arithmetic used in the ibm series different sequence of residue are considered and relationship established among them it is shown that sequence of positive and negative residue may be produced more simply and economically than with the conventional approach and yet have twice the period of the latter without loss of desirable statistical property another easily generated sequence involving absolute value is also shown to have twice the period but with attractive statistical property the statistical property of these sequence are given and related to previously established criterion |
1875|polynomial and spline approximation by quadratic programming the problem of approximation to given function or of fitting given set of data where the approximating function is required to have certain of it derivation of specified sign over the whole range of approximation is studied two approach are presented in each of which quadratic programming is used to provide both the constraint on the derivative and the selection of the function which yield the best fit the first is modified bernstein polynomial scheme and the second is spline fit |
1876|generation of test matrix having certain sign pattern and prescribed positive spectrum class of orthogonal transformation is presented whose member transform given positive diagonal matrix into matrix having one of four special sign pattern |
1877|prevention of system deadlock well known problem in the design of operating system is the selection of resource allocation policy that will prevent deadlock deadlock is the situation in which resource have been allocated to various task in such way that none of the task can continue the various published solution have been somewhat restrictive either they do not handle the problem in sufficient generality or they suggest policy which will on occasion refuse request which could have been safely granted algorithm are presented which examine request in the light of the current allocation of resource and determine whether or not the granting of the request will introduce the possibility of deadlock proof given in the appendix show that the condition imposed by the algorithm are both necessary and sufficient to prevent deadlock the algorithm have been successfully used in the the system |
1878|recovery of reentrant list structure in slip one consequence of the reference count based space recovery system employed by slip is that reentrant list structure are not recovered even when explicitly erased lisp like garbage collection scheme are free of this impediment they however depend on being able to find and mark node that are reachable from program variable by tracing all descendant from program variable may then be identified and collected the list creating function list of slip may be amended to mark those list for which the programmer wish to assume responsibility given this modification lisp like garbage collector that recovers abandoned reentrant list structure may then be appended to the slip system |
1879|note on storage fragmentation and program segmentation the main purpose of this paper is the presentation of some of the result of series of simulation experiment investigating the phenomenon of storage fragmentation two different type of storage fragmentation are distinguished external fragmentation namely the loss in storage utilization caused by the inability to make use of all available storage after it been fragmented into large number of separate block and internal fragmentation the loss of utilization caused by rounding up request for storage rather than allocating only the exact number of word required the most striking result is the apparently general rule that rounding up request for storage to reduce the number of different size of block coexisting in storage cause more loss of storage by increased internal fragmentation than is saved by decreased external fragmentation described also are method of segment allocation and an accompanying technique for segment addressing which take advantage of the above result evidence is presented of possible advantage of the method over conventional paging technique |

1885|computer system for transformational grammar comprehensive system for transformational grammar been designed and implemented on the ibm computer the system deal with the transformational model of syntax along the line of chomsky aspect of the theory of syntax the major innovation include full formal description of the syntax of transformational grammar directed random phrase structure generator lexical insertion algorithm an extended definition of analysis and simple problem oriented programming language in which the algorithm for application of transformation can be expressed in this paper we present the system whole first discussing the general attitude underlying the development of the system then outlining the system and discussing it more important special feature reference are given to paper which consider some particular aspect of the system in detail |
1886|generation of optimal code for expression via factorization given set of expression which are to be compiled method are presented for increasing the efficiency of the object code produced by first factoring the expression ie finding set of subexpressions each of which occurs in two or more other expression or subexpressions once all the factor have been ascertained sequencing procedure is applied which order the factor and expression such that all information is computed in the correct sequence and factor need be retained in memory minimal amount of time an assignment algorithm is then executed in order to minimize the total number of temporary storage cell required to hold the result of evaluating the factor in order to make these technique computationally feasible heuristic procedure are applied and hence global optimal result are not necessarily generated the factorization algorithm are also applicable to the problem of factoring boolean switching expression and of factoring polynomial encountered in symbol manipulating system |

1888|spline function method for nonlinear boundary value problem the solution of the nonlinear differential equation yfx with two point boundary condition is approximated by quintic or cubic spline function yx the method is well suited to nonuniform mesh size and dynamic mesh size allocation for uniform mesh size h the error in the quintic spline yx is oh with typical error one third that from numerovs method requiring the differential equation to be satisfied at the mesh point result in set of difference equation which are block tridiagonal and so are easily solved by relaxation or other standard method |
1889|introducing computing to smaller college and university progress report by technical mean that are now routine computer service for smaller college and university can be provided by remote terminal of central facility access however is not enough effective organizational and educational methodology for introducing computing at such institution must also be developed the experience of two year with statewide network involving institution is discussed lesson include the importance of separate organization representing the small college the necessity for on campus training for the institution the need for some special programming and documentation to support such user and the development of curriculum by evolutionary mean |
1890|simulation of traffic flow in network computer simulation program which deal with traffic flow in the network of large area is described each road is segmented into block of several ten meter length and is represented by bidirectional list in computer memory the movement of car ie the transfer of car from one block to the next is expressed by proper formula this formula is based on the supposition that the speed of car in block is determined only by the density of car in the block and this speed versus density curve is empirically given the numerical value this simulation scheme it excellent point in that it make it possible to trace the dynamic behavior of traffic flow in variety of situation some example of which are given for an actual area of the city of kyoto japan |
1891|three dimensional computer display stereographic display terminal been produced using the raster display brad recently developed at brookhaven the system us rotating refresh memory to feed standard television monitor to produce stereographic display the computer calculates the projected video image of an object viewed from two separate point the resulting video map are stored on separate refresh band of the rotating memory the two output signal are connected to separate color gun of color television monitor thus creating superimposed image on the screen optical separation is achieved by viewing the image through color filter the display is interactive and can be viewed by large group of people at the same time |

1905|the simplex method of linear programming using lu decomposition standard computer implementation of dantzigs simplex method for linear programming are based upon forming the inverse of the basic matrix and updating the inverse after every step of the method these implementation have bad round off error property this paper give the theoretical background for an implementation which is based upon the lu decomposition computed with row interchange of the basic matrix the implementation is slow but good round off error behavior the implementation appears cacm algorithm |
1906|automated printed circuit routing with stepping aperture computer program for routing interconnection on two sided printed circuit board with regular pattern of line pin terminal and vias feed through hole is described in this program each interconnection is given planned routing typically down from the upper pin through via and horizontally to the lower pin from the top virtual aperture ie long horizontal slit is stepped down the board the planned routing is the basis for rerouting interconnection within the aperture to resolve conflict for line and vias below the aperture and to maximize the effective line usage if conflict not been resolved before the aperture arrives at the lower pin interconnection are deleted to resolve the conflict extension of this technique to the control of crosstalk between routed interconnection and to the problem of obtaining percent interconnect are also discussed |
1907|note on reliable full duplex transmission over half duplex link simple procedure for achieving reliable full duplex transmission over half duplex link is proposed the scheme is compared with another of the same type which recently been described in the literature finally some comment are made on another group of related transmission procedure which have been shown to be unreliable under some circumstance |
1908|time sharing and batch processing an experimental comparison of their value in problem solving situation an experimental comparison of problem solving using time sharing and batch processing computer system conducted at mit is described in this paper this study is the first known attempt to evaluate two such system for what may well be the predominant user population within the next decade the professional who nonprogrammers are using the computer an aid in decision making and problem solving rather than programming end in itself statistically and logically significant result indicate equal cost for usage of the two computer system however much higher level of performance is attained by time sharing user there are indication that significantly lower cost would have resulted if the time sharing user had stopped work when they reached performance level equal to that of the batch user the user speed of problem solving and their attitude made time sharing the more favorable system |

1911|on coordination reduction and sentence analysis class of coordination phenomenon in natural language is considered within the frame work of transformational theory to account for these phenomenon it is proposed that certain machinery be added to the syntactic component of transformational grammar this machinery includes certain rule schema the condition under which they are to be applied and condition determining the sequence of subtrees on which they are to be performed solution to the syntactic analysis problem for this class of grammar is outlined precise specification of both the generative procedure of this paper and it inverse is given in the form of lisp function definition |

1915|an algorithm for hidden line elimination the algorithm presented cause the elimination of hidden line in the representation of perspective view of concave and convex plane faced object on the picture plane all the edge of the object are considered sequentially and all plane which hide every point of an edge are found the computing time increase roughly the square of the number of edge the algorithm take advantage of reduced number of concave point and automatically recognizes if only one object with concave point is considered in this last case the result is obtained in much simpler way |

1924|organizing matrix and matrix operation for paged memory system matrix representation and operation are examined for the purpose of minimizing the page faulting occurring in paged memory system it is shown that carefully designed matrix algorithm can lead to enormous saving in the number of page fault occurring when only small part of the total matrix can be in main memory at one time examination of addition multiplication and inversion algorithm show that partitioned matrix representation ie one submatrix or partition per page in most case induced fewer page fault than row by row representation the number of page pull required by these matrix manipulation algorithm is also studied function of the number of page of main memory available to the algorithm |
1925|concept of use in contour map processing generalized technique whose use can simplify the solution of problem relating to contour map one of these technique make use of the topological property of contour map the topology is represented by graphical structure in which adjacent contour line appear connected node another generalized technique consists of utilizing geometrical property to determine the characteristic of straight line drawn on the contour map both of these technique have been applied to the problem of locating the ground track of an aircraft from elevation reading obtained during flight |
1926|description of format text processing program format is production program which facilitates the editing and printing of finished document directly on the printer of relatively small k computer system it feature good performance totally free form input very flexible formatting capability including up to eight column per page automatic capitalization aid for index construction and minimum of nontext item it is written entirely in fortran iv |

1928|exclusive simulation of activity in digital network technique for simulating the detailed logic network of large and active digital system is described essential objective sought are improved ease and economy in model generation economy in execution time and space and facility for handling simultaneous activity the main result obtained are clear and useful separation of structural and behavioral model description reduction of manual task in converting boolean logic into structural model the elimination of manual process in achieving exclusive simulation of activity an event scheduling technique which doe not deteriorate in economy the event queue grows in length and simulation procedure which deal effectively with any mixture of serial and simultaneous activity the passage of time is simulated in precise quantitative fashion and system to be simulated may be combination of synchronous and asynchronous logic certain aspect of the technique described may be used for the simulation of network structure other than digital network |
1929|image from computer and microfilm plotter digital computer are widely used for the processing of information and data of all kind including the pictorial information contained in photograph and other graphical representation efficient conversion facility for putting graphical information into the computer and retrieving it in graphical form are therefore much needed one of the most commonly employed device for obtaining permanent graphical output from digital computer is the microfilm plotter regrettably present model have provision for producing image with continuous gray scale or half tone in this note several programming technique are described for obtaining half tone picture from microfilm plotter under the control of digital computer illustrative example of several method are given |
1930|extremely portable random number generator extremely portable subroutine are sometimes needed for which moderate quality and efficiency suffice typically this occurs for library function like random number generation and in core sorting which are not entirely universal or are not used in standardized way the literature on random number generator doe not seem to contain an algorithm that meet requirement of this sort an extremely portable line fortran program is provided which based on an important paper by coveyou and macpherson using their method fourier analysis is applied to the probability function for the consecutive n tuples provided by our generator with n than or equal to while the small modulus which must be used to maintain portability prevents the quality of the generator from being high the generator compare well with the bound established in the above mentioned paper |
1931|interval arithmetic determinant evaluation and it use in testing for chebyshev system two recent paper one by hansen and one by hansen and r r smith have shown how interval arithmetic ia can be used effectively to bound error in matrix computation in the present paper method proposed by hasen and r r smith is compared with straightforward use of ia in determinant evaluation computational result show the accuracy and running time that can be expected when using ia for determinant evaluation an application using ia determinant in program to test set of function to see if they form chebyshev system is then presented |
1932|the logarithmic error and newton method for the square root the problem of obtaining optimal starting value for the calculation of the square root using newton method is considered it been pointed out elsewhere that if relative error is used the measure of goodness of fit optimal result are not obtained when the initial approximation is best fit it is shown here that if instead the so called logarithmic error is used then best initial fit is optimal for both type of error moreover use of the logarithmic error appears to simplify the problem of determining the optimal initial approximation |
1933|coding the lehmer pseudo random number generator an algorithm and coding technique is presented for quick evaluation of the lehmer pseudo random number generator modulo prime mersenne number with produce number on p bit greater than computer the computation method is extendible to limited problem in modular arithmetic prime factorization for and primitive root for the next largest prime mersenne number are given for possible construction of pseudo random number generator of increased cycle length |
1934|on arithmetic expression and tree description is given of how tree representing the evaluation of an arithmetic expression can be drawn in such way that the number of accumulator needed for the computation can be represented in straightforward manner this representation reduces the choice of the best order of computation to specific problem under the theory of graph an algorithm to solve this problem is presented |
1935|randomized binary search technique mathematical model is developed for the mean and variance of the number of trial to recover given document in randomly received list of file the search method described is binary in nature and offer new potential for information retrieval system |
1936|variable length tree structure having minimum average search time sussenguth suggests in paper that file should be organized doubly chained tree structure if it is necessary both to search and to update frequently such structure provides compromise between the fast searchslow update characteristic of binary searching and the slow searchfast update characteristic of serial searching his method however contains the limiting restriction that all terminal node lie on the same level of the tree this paper considers the effect of relaxing this restriction first tree which have the property that priori the filial set of each node is well defined are studied it is proved that coding the node within each filial set with respect to the number of terminal node reachable from each is necessary and sufficient to guarantee minimum average search time then the more general case that is where the entire structure of the tree is changeable is treated procedure is developed for constructing tree with minimum average search time simple closed expression for this minimum average search time is obtained function of the number of terminal node the storage capacity required to implement the doubly chained tree structure on digital computer is also determined finally the total cost of the structure using sussenguths cost criterion is computed it is shown that significant improvement in both the average search time and the total cost can be obtained by relaxing sussenguths restriction that all terminal node lie on the same level of the tree |
1937|coda data display system coda customer oriented data system is user oriented data retrieval and display system the command language of the system provides the user with an easy mean for specifying data retrieval and display request data is displayed table and graph produced in format ready for publication in this paper the statement of the request language and the general system design are described |
1938|some criterion for time sharing system performance time sharing system defined in this article are those multiaccess system which permit terminal user to utilize essentially the full resource of the system while sharing it time with other terminal user it is each terminal user ability to utilize the full resource of the system that make quantitative evaluation of time sharing system particularly difficult six criterion are described which have been successfully used to perform first level quantitative time sharing system performance evaluation |
1939|directed random generation of sentence the problem of producing sentence of transformational grammar by using random generator to create phrase structure tree for input to the lexical insertion and transformational phase is discussed purely random generator will produce base tree which will be blocked by the transformation and which are frequently too long to be of practical interest solution is offered in the form of computer program which allows the user to constrain and direct the generation by the simple but powerful device of restricted subtrees the program is directed random generator which accepts input subtree with restriction and produce around it tree which satisfies the restriction and is ready for the next phase of the grammar the underlying linguistic model is that at noam chomsky presented in aspect of the theory of syntax the program is written in fortran iv for the ibm and is part of unified computer system for transformational grammar it is currently being used with several partial grammar of english |

1946|computing polynomial resultant bezouts determinant v collins reduced pr algorithm algorithm for computing the resultant of two polynomial in several variable key repetitive step of computation in solving system of polynomial equation by elimination are studied determining the best algorithm for computer implementation depends upon the extent to which extraneous factor are introduced the extent of propagation of error caused by truncation of real coefficient memory requirement and computing speed preliminary consideration narrow the choice of the best algorithm to bezouts determinant and collins reduced polynomial remainder sequence pr algorithm detailed test performed on sample problem conclusively show that bezouts determinant is superior in all respect except for univariate polynomial in which case collins reduced pr algorithm is somewhat faster in particular bezouts determinant prof to be strikingly superior in numerical accuracy displaying excellent stability with regard to round off error result of test are reported in detail |

1951|estimate of distribution of random variable for certain computer communication traffic model study of multiaccess computer communication characterized the distribution underlying an elementary model of the user computer interactive process the model used is elementary in the sense that many of the random variable that generally are of interest in computer communication study can be decomposed into the element of this model data were examined from four operational multiaccess system and the model is shown to be robust that is each of the variable of the model the same distribution independent of which of the four system is being examined it is shown that the gamma distribution can be used to describe the discrete variable approximation to the gamma distribution by the exponential distribution are discussed for the system studied |

1956|optimum merging from mass storage an algorithm is displayed which yield the merge order such that the total read time defined to be the sum of seek time plus data transfer time is minimized for sort using mass storage the analysis is parameterized in term of the ratio of seek time to the time it take to fill available core with record and the file size in unit of core length and thus it can be applied to any conventional cpumass storage combination an explicit formula for total read time is derived in term of the parameter which correlate very well with the total read time calculated using the optimum merge order yielded by the algorithm the formula involves the root of simple transcendental equation short table of these root is included numerical result are graphically displayed for wide range of the parameter it is found that the normalized read time for optimum merging on given hardware configuration is proportional to the file length time the logarithm of the file length |
1957|the list set generator construct for evaluating set expression the list set generator is defined and algorithm for it use are given the list set generator is construct which may be added to list processing system or any system that handle set it efficiently generates the set which result from any expression involving set and set operator the efficiency derives from evaluating the expression whole and in parallel rather than evaluating subexpressions and then using those set to arrive at the final result |

1976|multi attribute retrieval with combined index in this paper file organization scheme designed to replace the use of the popular secondary index filing scheme or inverted file on secondary key field is described through the use of redundancy and storing key or access number of the record that satisfy different combination of secondary index value in bucket it is possible to retrieve all key satisfying any input query derived from subset of field by single access to an index file although each bucket may be used for many combination of value and combination of bucket may be required for given query the method which in it degenerate case becomes the conventional secondary index filing scheme work similarly but the following advantage the elimination of multiple access in many case the elimination of false drop the elimination of computer time to perform intersection of key set each qualified for one secondary index field only and the avoidance of long string of key when an index field appearing in query very few possible value redundancy in some case is the same the secondary indexing method in the general case trade off between the number of access for query and redundancy exists |

1997|increasing the efficiency of quicksort method is presented for the analysis of various generalization of quicksort the average asymptotic number of comparison needed is shown to be an logn formula is derived expressing in term of the probability distribution of the bound of partition this formula assumes particularly simple form for generalization already considered by hoare namely choice of the bound median of random sample the main contribution of this paper is another generalization of quicksort which us bounding interval instead of single element bound this generalization turn out to be easy to implement in computer program numerical approximation show that for this version of quicksort compared with for the original this implies decrease in number of comparison of percent actual test showed about percent saving in computing time |
1998|complex matrix inversion versus real comparison of complex matrix with real matrix inversion is made it is shown that the complex inversion can be up to twice fast the real inversion further the rounding error bound for complex inversion is about one eighth that of real for gaussian elimination using extended inner product accumulation the bound is half of the real system |

2002|amesplot higher level data plotting software system amesplot is an extensible software system designed to make the display of data simple painless and neat possible the system described is hardware independent and been implemented on variety of installation of different manufacturer having diverse configuration the element common to all type of data plot are outlined and the way in which these element may be combined into system based on simple module is demonstrated these module are specified independently and are independent of the axis system or other attribute of the plot this enables plot of any complexity to be constructed by adding or replacing module the basic syntax of amesplot is outlined and brief description is given of it current utility software consisting of macro to produce self scaled plot formal tablet of text interspersed with subplots map coastline and d plot the system wa formulate d in way such that the user could supply the minimum of information and it should be fully integrable with user program written in most conventional higher language the function of positioning locating and scaling in the layout of multiple subplots of ax label and all other element of the plot are handled automatically by the software system unless the user specifies otherwise the structuring of plot from multiple independent self contained subplots is described transformation projection scaling rotation or shifting of entire plot or subplots by the action of one or more simple module is possible the user may interact freely with amesplot at three level enabling him to construct his own data marker alphabetic character and transformation and to produce variety of artistic and other effect |
2003|an interactive software system for computer aided design an application to circuit project the characteristic of an interactive software system intended to constitute an interface between designer and computer during various step of the design process are presented the main emphasis is given to the description of the feature of the two high level user oriented language operating at different level on which the interaction is based the first one is imol an interactive monitor language which is designed to perform the overall and control function of the software system it design criterion provide the user with command which are both simple and efficient in order to perform all the function needed in computer aided circuit design the second one is coif circuit oriented graphic language which is designed to describe generate and manipulate graphic problem specification it is an extension of fortran with graphic type variable so that the designer who is familiar with fortran need not learn new language the application to computer aided circuit design is in particular examined on the other hand the adopted design criterion provide sufficient generality to extend the use of the two language to different computer assisted application |

2018|full table quadratic searching for scatter storage the quadratic residue search method for hash table avoids much of the clustering experienced with linear search method the simple quadratic search only access half the table it been shown that when the length of the table is prime of the form n where n is an integer the whole table may be accessed by two quadratic search plus separate access for the original entry point search method is presented which is computationally simple all the advantage of the quadratic search and yet access all the table in one sweep |

2020|the allocation of computer resource is pricing the answer the widespread use of complex third generation computing system led to much broader concern about the mean by which the resource of these system are allocated among the user community one mean that is suggested more and more frequently is pricing procedure in this paper the manner in which one would like to allocate computing resource is considered and then the extent to which pricing mechanism fit this mold is discussed inasmuch pricing must serve rationing mechanism at time consideration is given to the mean by which price can be adjusted flexibly in order to make dynamic allocation of resource consideration is also given to the mean by which user can be insulated from the harmful effect of frequent price fluctuation although the subject of pricing been given lot of attention recently number of misconception persist about it purpose and it operation an attempt is made to clarify some of these misunderstanding and to highlight the advantage and disadvantage and to highlight the advantage and disadvantage of pricing two illustrative pricing system are also discussed in order to demonstrate the applicability of pricing in quite different environment |

2030|context sensitive parsing this paper present canonical form for context sensitive derivation and parsing algorithm which find each context sensitive analysis once and only once the amount of memory required by the algorithm is essentially more than the required to store single complete derivation in addition modified version of the basic algorithm is presented which block infinite analysis for grammar which contain loop the algorithm is also compared with several previous parser for context sensitive grammar and general rewriting system and the difference between the two type of analysis is discussed the algorithm appears to be complementary to an algorithm by s kuno in several respect including the space time trade off and the degree of context dependence involved |
2031|algorithm and bound for the greatest common divisor of n integer new version of the euclidean algorithm for finding the greatest common divisor of n integer ai and multiplier xi such that gcd xa xnan is presented the number of arithmetic operation and the number of storage location are linear in n theorem of lame that give bound for the number of iteration of the euclidean algorithm for two integer is extended to the case of n integer an algorithm to construct minimal set of multiplier is presented fortran program for the algorithm appears comm acm algorithm |
2032|file structure using hashing function general method of file structuring is proposed which us hashing function to define tree structure two type of such tree are examined and their relation to tree studied in the past is explainedresults for the probability distribution of path length are derived and illustrated |
2033|spacetime trade offs in hash coding with allowable error in this paper trade offs among certain computational factor given set of message two new hash coding method are examined and compared with particular conventional hash coding method the computational factor considered are the size of the hash area space the time required to identify message nonmember of the given set reject time and an allowable error frequency the new method are intended to reduce the amount of space required to contain the hash coded information from that associated with conventional method the reduction in space is accomplished by exploiting the possibility that small fraction of error of commission may be tolerable in some application in particular application in which large amount of data is involved and core resident hash area is consequently not feasible using conventional method in such application it is envisaged that overall performance could be improved by using smaller core resident hash area in conjunction with the new method and when necessary by using some secondary and perhaps time consuming test to catch the small fraction of error associated with new method an example is discussed which illustrates possible area of application for the new method analysis of the paradigm problem demonstrates that allowing small number of test message to be falsely identified member of the given set will permit much smaller hash area to be used without increasing reject time |
2034|the mobile programming system stage stage is the second level of bootstrap sequence which is easily implemented on any computer it is flexible provided by stage are summarized and the implementation technique which have made it possible to have stage running on new machine with than one man week of effort are discussed the approach been successful on over machine of widely varying characteristic |
