2046|relational model of data for large shared data bank future user of large data bank must be protected from having to know how the data is organized in the machine the internal representation prompting service which supply such information is not satisfactory solution activity of user at terminal and most application program should remain unaffected when the internal representation of data is changed and even when some aspect of the external representation are changed change in data representation will often be needed result of change in query update and report traffic and natural growth in the type of stored information existing noninferential formatted data system provide user with tree structured file or slightly more general network model of the data in section inadequacy of these model are discussed model based on n ary relation normal form for data base relation and the concept of universal form for data base relation and the concept of universal data sublanguage are introduced in section certain operation on relation other than logical inference are discussed and applied to the problem of redundancy and consistency in the user model |
2047|incorporating origin shift into the qr algorithm for symmetric tridiagonal matrix the qr iteration for the eigenvalue of symmetric tridiagonal matrix can be accelerated by incorporating sequence of origin shift the origin shift may be either subtracted directly from the diagonal element of the matrix or incorporated by mean of an implicit algorithm both method have drawback the direct method can unnecessarily degrade small eigenvalue while the implicit method can effectively loose the shift and thereby retard the convergence this paper present new method which neither drawback |

2050|automatic parsing for content analysis although automatic syntactic and semantic analysis is not yet possible for all of an unrestricted natural language text some application of which content analysis is one do not have such stringent coverage requirement preliminary study show that the harvard syntactic analyzer can produce correct and unambiguous identification of the subject and object of certain verb for approximately half of the relevant occurrence this provides degree of coverage for content analysis variable which compare favorably to manual method in variable which compare favorably to manual method in which only sample of the total available text is normally processed |
2051|pli program to assist the comparative linguist practical pli program is described which can assist comparative linguist to determine the regular sound correspondence between genetically related language the investigator must arrange data for input by aligning pair of suspected cognate the program tabulates the correspondence and us list processing technique to sort and count them each pair of word is then assigned relative value that is function of the total frequency in the data of each correspondence found in that pair of word the output is list of all correspondence type with their frequency of occurrence in the data and separate listing of each correspondence with all word pair showing that correspondence unless their relative value is below an arbitrarily chosen cutoff point the article explains the usefulness well the limitation of the program and illustrates it use with small portion of hypothetical data |
2052|scheduling to reduce conflict in meeting conflict in scheduling can be treated defining an undirected linear graph independently of the relation of the activity in conflict to additional constraint of time and space each connected component of such graph which can be found by an algorithm described by gotlieb and corneil corresponds to set of event that must be scheduled at different time |
2053|on the conversion of decision table to computer program the use of execution time diagnostics in pinpointing ambiguity in decision table is discussed it is pointed out that any attempt at resolving ambiguity at compile time will in general be impossible it is shown that consequence tree method of converting decision table to program are inadequate in regard to ambiguity detection two algorithm for programming decision table whose merit are simplicity of implementation and detection of ambiguity at execution time are presented the first algorithm is for limited entry decision table and clarifies the importance of proper coding of the information in the decision table the second algorithm program mixed entry decision table directly without going through the intermediate step of conversion to limited entry form thereby resulting in storage economy comparison of the algorithm and others proposed in the literature is made some feature of decision table to fortran iv translator for the ibm developed by the author are given |

2060|gedanken simple typeless language based on the principle of completeness and the reference concept gedanken is an experimental programming language with the following characteristic any value which is permitted in some context of the language is permissible in any other meaningful context in particular function and label are permissible result of function and value of variable assignment and indirect addressing are formalized by introducing value called reference which in turn posse other value the assignment operation always affect the relation between some reference and it value all compound data structure are treated function type declaration are not permitted the functional approach to data structure and the use of reference insure that any process which accepts some data structure will accept any logically equivalent structure regardless of it internal representation more generally any data structure may be implicit ie it may be specified by giving an arbitrary algorithm for computing or accessing it component the existence of label variable permit the construction of coroutines quasi parallel process and other unorthodox control mechanism variety of programming example illustrates the generality of the language limitation and possible extension are discussed briefly |
2061|an algorithm for the construction of bounded context parser an algorithm is described which accepts an arbitrary context free grammar and construct bounded context parser for it whenever such parser exists in the first part of the paper the definition of context free grammar and the working of bounded context parser are recalled the notion of reduction class for context free grammar is then introduced and it connection with the structure of bounded context parser is indicated next pushdown automaton which generate the different reduction class of context free grammar are defined finally the algorithm is described it essentially carry out an exhaustive study of all possible run of the pushdown automaton generating the reduction class in the second part the utility of the algorithm is discus ed in the light of the experience gained from it use in compiler design the algorithm is claimed to be particularly useful in the simultaneous design of language and compiler for it |

2096|experiment with the m n tree searching program the m n procedure is an improvement to the mini max backing up procedure widely used in computer program for game playing and other purpose it is based on the principle that it is desirable to have many option when making decision in the face of uncertainty the mini max procedure assigns to max min node the value of the highest lowest valued successor to that node the m n procedure assigns to max min node some function of the m n highest lowest valued successor an m n procedure wa written in lisp to play the game of kalah and it wa demonstrated that the m n procedure is significantly superior to the mini max procedure the statistical significance of important conclusion is given since information on statistical significance often been lacking in paper on computer experiment in the artificial intelligence field these experiment can perhaps serve model for future work |

2109|the use of quadratic residue research quadratic residue search method previously been suggested to avoid the clustering usually encountered when hash address collision occur and linear search method are used the search size because of the property of quadratic residue is limited to one half of the storage table it is shown that for some class of prime number the complement of the set of quadratic residue can easily be determined and hence the entire table of size p where p is that prime number can be searched |
2110|an efficient context free parsing algorithm parsing algorithm which seems to be the most efficient general context free algorithm known is described it is similar to both knuths lrk algorithm and the familiar top down algorithm it time bound proportional to n where n is the length of the string being parsed in general it n bound for unambiguous grammar and it run in linear time on large class of grammar which seems to include most practical context free programming language grammar in an empirical comparison it appears to be superior to the top down and bottom up algorithm studied by griffith and petrick |

2113|the multistore parser for hierarchical syntactic structure syntactic parser is described for hierarchical concatenation pattern that are presented to the analyzer in the form of linear string particular emphasis is given to the system of significant address by mean of which processing time for large scale matching procedure can be substantially reduced the description make frequent use of example taken from the fully operational implementation of the parser in an experimental english sentence analyzer by structuring an area of the computer central core storage in such way that the individual location of byte and bit come to represent the data involved in the matching procedure the shifting of information is reduced to minimum and the searching of list is eliminated altogether the match are traced by mean of binary mask and the state of single bit determines the operational flow of the procedure the method could be implemented with any interpretive grammar provided it can be expressed by the functional classification of the item composing the input hierarchical structure |

2127|natural language question answering system recent experiment in programming natural language question answering system are reviewed to summarize the method that have been developed for syntactic semantic and logical analysis of english string it is concluded that at least minimally effective technique have been devised for answering question from natural language subset in small scale experimental system and that useful paradigm evolved to guide research effort in the field current approach to semantic analysis and logical inference are seen to be effective beginning but of questionable generality with respect either to subtle aspect of meaning or to application over large subset of english generalizing from current small scale experiment to language processing system based on dictionary with thousand of entry with correspondingly large grammar and semantic system may entail new order of complexity and require the invention and development of entirely different approach to semantic analysis and question answering |

2144|on accurate floating point summation the accumulation of floating point sum is considered on computer which performs t digit base b floating point addition with exponent in the range m to m an algorithm is given for accurately summing n t digit floating point number each of these n number is split into q part forming qn t digit floating point number each of these is then added to the appropriate one of n auxiliary t digit accumulator finally the accumulator are added together to yield the computed sum in all qnn t digit floating point addition are performed under usual condition the relative error in the computed sum is at most tvb t for some v further with an additional qn t digit addition the computed sum can be corrected to full t digit accuracy for example for the ibm b t m m typical value for q and n are q and n in this case becomes n and we have tvb t x |

2160|canonical structure in attribute based file organization new file structure for attribute based retrieval is proposed in this paper it allows query involving arbitrary boolean function of the attribute value pair to be processed without taking intersection of list the structure is highly dependent on the way in which the file is to be used and is uniquely determined by the specification of the allowed query thus for example the structure for retrieval on the basis of range of value of given attribute would be very different from one where only retrieval on the basis of single value is permitted the file organization being proposed is based on the atom of boolean algebra generated by the query the desirable property claimed for this structure are proved and file maintenance question are discussed |

2174|the stable marriage problem the original work of gale and shapley on an assignment method using the stable marriage criterion been extended to find all the stable marriage assignment the algorithm derived for finding all the stable marriage assignment is proved to satisfy all the condition of the problem algorithm applies to this paper |
2175|subexpression ordering in the execution of arithmetic expression an arithmetic expression can often be broken down into it component subexpressions depending on the hardware environment in which the expression is to be executed these subexpressions can be evaluated in serial in parallel or in combination of these mode this paper show that expression execution time can be minimized only if consideration is given to the ordering of the subexpressions in particular subexpressions should be executed in order of decreasing memory and processor time requirement this observation is valid for configuration ranging from uniprocessor with an unbuffered main memory to multiprocessor with cache buffer memory if the number of subexpressions which can be executed in parallel exceeds the number of available processor then execution of some of these subexpressions must be postponed procedure is given which combine this requirement with the earlier ordering consideration to provide an optimal execution sequence |
2176|buffer allocation in merge sorting fixed buffer allocation for merge sorting is presented here which minimizes the number of input output operation for given order of merge when sorting on movable arm disk the number of seek is equal to the number of input output operation and the seek time usually control the sort time first some standard terminology is introduced then the input buffer allocation method is described followed by an analysis of the improvement to be expected over more conventional allocation this analysis make use of particular distribution function an analysis of completely different distribution is given which yield similar result this suggests that the result do not depend on particular distribution function an optimum output buffer size is also determined it is concluded that this buffering allocation can significantly reduce the time of merge sorting on movable arm disk when the input data are not random and that this output buffer allocation should be used whether the data is random or not |

2178|language extension for graph processing and it formal semantics simple programming language extension graspe for processing directed graph is defined graspe consists of type of directed graph data structure and set of primitive operation for manipulating these structure graspe may be most easily implemented by embedding it in host language emphasis is placed both on graspe itself and on it method of definition commonly the definition of language involves definition of the syntactic element and explanation of the meaning to be assigned them the semantics the definition of graspe here is solely in term of it semantics that is the data structure and operation are defined precisely but without assignment of particular syntactic representation only when the language is implemented is assignment of an explicit syntax necessary an example of an implementation of graspe embedded in lisp is given an illustration the advantage and disadvantage of the definition of language in term of it semantics are discussed |

2186|numerical property of the ritz trefftz algorithm for optimal control in this paper the ritz trefftz algorithm is applied to the computer solution of the state regulator problem the algorithm represents modification of the ritz direct method and is designed to improve the speed of solution and the storage requirement to the point where real time implementation becomes feasible the modification is shown to be more stable computationally than the traditional ritz approach the first concern of the paper is to describe the algorithm and establish it property valid and useful numerical technique in particular such useful property definiteness and reasonableness of condition are established for the method the second part of the paper is devoted to comparison of the new technique with the standard procedure of numerically integrating matrix riccati equation to determine feedback matrix the new technique is shown to be significantly faster for comparable accuracy |

2188|an approach to the optimum design of computer graphic system display system designer are faced with the difficult task of selecting major subsystem in an intelligent way each subsystem is chosen from large number of alternative the selection is based on consideration such system response time system cost and the distribution of data storage and processing between the graphic processor and it supporting data processing system the work reported here develops an objective quantitative design procedure and help give better understanding of now to configure display system this is accomplished by mean of mathematical model of computer driven graphic system the parameter of the model are function of the capability of the graphic hardware and of the computational requirement of the graphic application the model can be analyzed using numerical queueing analysis or simulation to obtain an average response time prediction by combining the model with an optimization the best graphic system configuration subject to cost constraint is found for several application the optimum configuration are in turn used to find general display system design guideline |
2189|generation of rosary permutation expressed in hamiltonian circuit systematic generation of specific class of permutation fundamental to scheduling problem is described in nonoriented complete graph with n vertex hamitonian circuit equivalent to n specific permutation of n element termed rosary permutation can be defined each of them corresponds to two circular permutation which mirror image each other and is generated successively by number system covering n set of edge every set of edge ek ek k k n is determined recursively by constructing hamiltonian circuit with k vertex from hamiltonian circuit with k vertex starting with the hamiltonian circuit of vertex the basic operation consists of transposition of pair of adjacent vertex where the position of the pair in the permutation is determined by ek two algorithm treating the same example for five vertex are presented it is very easy to derive all possible n permutation from the n rosary permutation be cycling the permutation and by taking them in the reverse order procedure which can be performed fairly efficiently by computer |

2194|how to keep the address short an algorithm is presented for minimizing the sum of the length of the block of coding produced by an assembler or compiler when the length of each computer instruction is assumed to be either long or short long if the memory location addressed is more than predetermined distance from the current location short otherwise and there are block of instruction whose beginning origin are separated by prespecified amount for example some computer permit either bit addressing interpreted relative to the location counter or full bit addressing of all of memory when assembling or compiling two or more block of instruction which have many mutual reference in such computer there is simple iterative procedure for keeping many of the address short possible this paper demonstrates that wide class of problem of this type can be formulated covering problem solvable by mean of elementary arithmetic operation on the column vector of ternary matrix |
2195|on the optimal detection of curve in noisy picture technique for recognizing system of line is presented in this technique the heuristic of the problem is not embedded in the recognition algorithm but is expressed in figure of merit multistage decision process is then able to recognize in the input picture the optimal system of line according to the given figure of merit due to the global approach greater flexibility and adequacy in the particular problem is achieved the relation between the structure of the figure of merit and the complexity of the optimization process is then discussed the method described is suitable for parallel processing because the operation relative to each state can be computed in parallel and the number of stage is equal to the length n of the curve or to log n if the approximate method is used |
2196|man machine approach toward solving the traveling salesman problem the traveling salesman problem belongs to an important class of scheduling and routing problem it is also subproblem in solving others such the warehouse distribution problem it been attacked by many mathematical method with but meager success only for special form of the problem or for problem with moderate number of point can it be solved exactly even if very large amount of computer time are used heuristic procedure have been proposed and tested with only slightly better result this paper describes computer aided heuristic technique which us only modest amount of computer time in real time to solve large point problem this technique take advantage of both the computer and the human problem solving ability the computer is not asked to solve the problem in brute force way in many of today heuristic but it is asked to organize the data for the human so that the human can solve the problem easily the technique used in this paper seems to point to new direction in the field of man machine interaction and in the field of artificial intelligence |

2202|dynamic microprogramming processor organization and programming dynamically microprogrammed processor is characterized by small k bit word read write micro storage the access time of this storage is similar to the cycle time of the machine nsec this microstorage is used to contain both data and subroutine the micro instruction in such processor differ from the conventional in that they perform only purely combinatorial operation sequencing is under the control of the microinstruction the presence of the read write microstorage permit more flexible assignment of resource than the read only storage in particular the processor developed in this paper stress the simultaneous operation within the microinstruction of the adder shifter masker and testing facility of the processor microassembly language is developed and the overhead involved in subroutine linkage is analyzed the efficiency of flexible software linkage scheme is examined to it overhead for various subroutine characteristic finally three example of problem oriented programming are considered and the resulting coding is compared against system assembly language version with the technology normalized |

2210|toward automatic program synthesis an elementary outline of the theorem proving approach to automatic program synthesis is given without dwelling on technical detail the method is illustrated by the automatic construction of both recursive and iterative program operating on natural number list and tree in order to construct program satisfying certain specification theorem induced by those specification is proved and the desired program is extracted from the proof the same technique is applied to transform recursively defined function into iterative program frequently with major gain inefficiency it is emphasized that in order to construct program with loop or with recursion the principle of mathematical induction must be applied the relation between the version of the induction rule used and the form of the program constructed is explored in some detail |

2215|application of game tree searching technique to sequential pattern recognition sequential pattern recognition spr procedure doe not test all the feature of pattern at once instead it selects feature to be tested after receiving the result of that test the procedure either classifies the unknown pattern or selects another feature to be tested etc medical diagnosis is an example of spr in this paper the author suggest that spr be viewed one person game played against nature chance virtually all the powerful technique developed for searching two person strictly competitive game tree can easily be incorporated either directly or by analogy into spr procedure in particular one can incorporate the mini average backing up procedure and the gamma procedure which are the analogue of the minimax backing up procedure and the alpha beta procedure respectively some computer simulated experiment in character recognition are presented the result indicate that the approach is promising |
2216|on the probability distribution of the value of binary tree an integral equation is derived for the generating function for binary tree value the value reflecting sorting effort the analysis doe not assume uniformly distributed branching ratio and therefore is applicable to family of sorting algorithm discussed by hoare singleton and van emden the solution to the integral equation indicates that using more advanced algorithm in the family make only minor reduction in the expected sorting effort but substantially reduces the variance in sorting effort statistical test of the value of several thousand tree containing up to point have given first second and third moment of the value distribution function in satisfactory agreement with the moment computed from the generating function the empirical test well the analytical result are in agreement with previously published result for the first moment in the case of uniform and nonuniform distribution of branching ratio and for the second moment in the case of uniform distribution of branching ratio |

2219|policy driven scheduler for time sharing system the service received by process from time sharing operating system can be characterized by resource count sumwirij where rij is the number of unit of service received by process i from resource i and wi is the cost per unit of the service each class of user can be characterized by policy function which specifies the amount of service user who belongs to this class should receive function of time priority change dynamically function of the difference between the service promised to the user by the policy function and the service actually receives scheduling and swapping algorithm which keep the resource count of each process above it policy function will provide the specified level of service overhead can be reduced by avoiding swap of process which have received at least his level of service the algorithm been implemented in general purpose operating system and it provided significantly better service to interactive and to batch job than the previous scheduler |

2232|pattern width at given angle that the pattern feature width function of angle posse several possible interpretation is demonstrated in this paper which is review of the width concept in pattern recognition and the geometrical concept itself the object of the work is to clarify how the word description can be made precise so that computer algorithm for feature extraction may be obtained the focus is on the theoretical subject matter the result consist of set theoretic definition of width at angle theorem relating it to the pattern boundary radius vector and description of alternate width all width are calculated for an illustrative example graphical and tabular comparison are given substantial variation in width at angle magnitude is found the principal conclusion is that the set theoretic width at angle is useful pattern feature when it can be easily computed further investigation of the information contained in only part of width function is recommended for case where computation of width at angle is difficult |
2233|signature simulation and certain cryptographic code three cypher allegedly authored by thomas jefferson beale in have been the subject of intensive study for over year generation of cryptanalyst have expended untold man year thus far without success attempting tode code them vast army of fortune hunter and treasure seeker have devoted herculean labor to digging up the rolling hill of virginia trying to locate the promised bonanza the history of pertinent activity would fill volume yet serious student of cryptography have always had nagging doubt about the cypher authenticity it been alleged that the known solution to cypher number two i have deposited in the county of bedford about four mile from bufords in an excavation or vault with the aid of an unsanitized version of the declaration of independence wa merely superb imaginative and grandiose hoax perpetrated age ago for whatever reason modern computer technology could obviously perform signature analysis the process of encoding itself so to yield new clue and deeper insight into their construction for the benefit of the uninitiated the encoding method used in the second cypher employ specified document whose word are simply numbered consecutively and first letter of these word are sought out at random to match the letter of these word are sought out at random to match the letter of the clear text or message the sequence of number corresponding to these match is then written down the final code while primitive the process the advantage of relative security until the source document becomes known at that moment the cypher can be decoded even by second grader the work now completed with the help of our univac includes numerous analytical study of the beale cypher and various type of simulation for example we have turned the entire process of simulated encoding by various scheme over to the machine and analyzed the signature of these synthetic code we have also encoded various message by hand using different text and variety of method to obtain their signature these simulation provide convincing evidence that the signature are both process and data dependent they indicate also very strongly that mr beales cypher are for real and that it is merely matter of time before someone find the correct source document and locates the right vault in the common wealth of virginia |

2245|trace driven modeling and analysis of cpu scheduling in multiprogramming system microscopic level job stream data obtained in production environment by an event driven software probe is used to drive model of multiprogramming computer system the cpu scheduling algorithm of the model is systematically varied this technique called trace driven modeling provides an accurate replica of production environment for the testing of variation in the system at the same time alteration in scheduling method can be easily carried out in controlled way with cause and effect relationship being isolated the scheduling method tested included the best possible and worst possible method the traditional method of multiprogramming theory round robin first come first served etc and dynamic predictor the relative and absolute performance of these scheduling method are given it is concluded that successful cpu scheduling method must be preemptive and must prevent given job from holding the cpu for too long period |

2247|on the criterion to be used in decomposing system into module this paper discus modularization mechanism for improving the flexibility ad comprehensibility of system while allowing the shortening of it development time the effectiveness of modularization is dependent upon the criterion used in dividing the system into module system design problem is presented and both conventional and unconventional decomposition are described it is shown that the unconventional decomposition have distinct advantage for the goal outlined the criterion used in arriving at the decomposition are discussed the unconventional decomposition if implemented with the conventional assumption that module consists of one or more subroutine will be efficient in most case an alternative approach to implementation which doe not have this effect is sketched |

2249|comparison of multivariate normal generator three method for generating outcome on multivariate normal random vector with specified variance covariance matrix are presented comparison is made to determine which method requires the least computer execution time and memory space when utilizing the ibm all method use basis standard gaussian random number generator result of the comparison indicate that the method based on triangular factorization of the covariance matrix generally requires memory space and computer time than the other two method |

2252|method for incrementally compiling language with nested statement structure method of incremental compilation is presented which applies especially to programming language in which statement can be nested such algol and pli the method permit editing of the source language using general purpose text editor and incremental processing of change without frequent recompilation of entire routine the essential point of the method are the syntax of the language is restricted insof ar which construct may occur on line an internal data structure called the skeleton is maintained to represent the statement structure the recompilation is partially batched in the sense that recompilation of modified line doe not occur until the last of set of editing command been received and the parsing and compilation are factored into two part that done on individual line and that done globally to handle the relationship between the line |

2263|the conversion of limited entry decision table to optimal and near optimal flowchart two new algorithm two new algorithm for deriving optimal and near optimal flowchart from limited entry decision table are presented both take into account rule frequency and the time needed to test condition one of the algorithm called the optimum finding algorithm lead to flowchart which truly minimizes execution time for decision table in which simple rule are already contracted to complex rule the other one called the optimum approaching algorithm requires many fewer calculation but doe not necessarily produce the optimum flowchart the algorithm are first derived for treating decision table not containing an else rule but the optimum approaching algorithm is shown to be equally valid for table including such rule both algorithm are compared with existing one and are applied to somewhat large decision table derived from real case from this comparison two conclusion are drawn the optimum approaching algorithm will usually lead to better result than comparable existing one and will not require more but usually computation time in general the greater computation effort needed for applying the optimum finding algorithm will not be justified by the small reduction in execution time obtained |
2264|derived semantics for some programming language construct the construct of simple programming language are introduced and described informally in term of value and side effect translator is defined which translates the language into flowchart for simple machine the action of the machine in executing flowchart is defined proof is constructed that the effect of translating and executing any program can be expressed solely in term of the value and side effect of the program during the course of constructing the proof formal definition of the concept of value and side effect are derived in order to make the proof rigorous correctness of the implementation involves checking that the definition derived in the step above are an acceptable formalization of the informal description given in the first step |
2265|model for type checking most current programming language treat computation over different class of object eg number string label and function for correct compilation and execution the following question then arises is program properly constructed so that it operation and operand are compatible the activity of answering this question is usually called type checking this paper attempt to isolate the notion of type checking and present partial solution to the type checking problem based on the notion of abstraction and application of function in particular program is mapped into an expression within decidable subset of the lambda calculus which characterizes the type relation within the program and eliminates all other information the determination of the type wise correctness or incorrectness of the program is resolved by reducing it corresponding lambda calculus expression to one of two normal form the constant correct for type wise correct program or the constant error an application to type checking in algol is made and the attendant problem faced for any notion of type checking are discussed |

2288|file organization the consecutive retrieval property the consecutive retrieval property is an important relation between query set and record set it existence enables the design of an information retrieval system with minimal search time and redundant storage some important theorem on the consecutive retrieval property are proved in this paper condition under which the consecutive retrieval property exists and remain invariant have been established an outline for designing an information retrieval system based on the consecutive retrieval property is also discussed |
2289|cellular array for the solution of graph problem cellular array is two dimensional checkerboard type interconnection of identical module or cell where each cell contains few bit of memory and small amount of combinational logic and communicates mainly with it immediate neighbor in the array the chief computational advantage offered by cellular array is the improvement in speed achieved by virtue of the possibility for parallel processing in this paper it is shown that cellular array are inherently well suited for the solution of many graph problem for example the adjacency matrix of graph is easily mapped onto an array each matrix element is stored in one cell of the array and typical row and column operation are readily implemented by simple cell logic major challenge in the effective use of cellular array for the solution of graph problem is the determination of algorithm that exploit the possibility for parallelism especially for problem whose solution appear to be inherently serial in particular several parallelized algorithm are presented for the solution of certain spanning tree distance and path problem with direct application to wire routing pert chart analysis and the analysis of many type of network these algorithm exhibit computation time that in many case grows at rate not exceeding log n where n is the number of node in the graph straightforward cellular implementation of the well known serial algorithm for these problem require about n step and noncellular implementation require from n to n step |

2341|block new data type for snobol new data type called block been implemented for snobol block is three dimensional aggregate of character in the form of right parallelepiped best thought of three dimensional extension to string the third dimension is used for overstriking block may be printed concatenated in any of three dimension and merged on the basis of program defined connection point some block adapt in size and shape to their environment block and their operation are mainly used for composing printable output variety of graphical problem including flowcharting bargraphs logic diagram mathematical equation formation and text justification and preparation have been programmed on printer in what appears to be an easy and natural way in addition to these somewhat specialized application block appear to be good general purpose device independent output formation mechanism especially suitable for nonnumerical work the concept of block is largely language independentthat is block require little in the way of specialized syntax and could readily be absorbed into the external structure of most programming language |
2342|interference between communicating parallel process various kind of interference between communicating parallel process have been examined by dijkstra knuth and others solution have been given for the mutual exclusion problem and associated subproblems in the form of parallel program and informal proof of correctness have been given for these solution in this paper system of parallel process is regarded machine which proceeds from one state s ie collection of pertinent data value and process configuration to next state s in accordance with transition rule s s set of such rule yield sequence of state which dictate the system behavior the mutual exclusion problem and the associated subproblems are formulated question of inclusion between set of state or of the existence of certain sequence mechanical proof procedure is shown which will either verify prove the correctness of or discredit prove the incorrectness of an attempted solution with respect to any of the interference property it is shown how to calculate transition rule from the partial rule by which the individual process operate the formation of partial rule and the calculation of transition rule are both applicable to hardware process well to software process and symmetry between process is not required |
2343|proposal to establish pseudo virtual memory via writable overlay many computer system solve executable storage size problem for large program by using overlay however it appears that one overlay scheme contains well balanced combination of the most useful capability which are found in various existing technique proposal is presented which utilizes several of the best capability from existing scheme and is complemented by several additional feature eg writable overlay the writable overlay capability provides virtual memory effect although the programmer may still be required to design the overlay configuration since overlay structuring is complex task several tool including graphic display are included in the proposal in order to aid the programmer in the design the content of overlay is briefly discussed and it is noted that many of the detail of the final overlay configuration may be decided after the fact |
2344|on the optimization of performance of time sharing system by simulation simulation model of time sharing system with finite noncontiguous store and an infinite auxiliary store is used to study the variation of system parameter such store size number of job allowed to execute simultaneously job scheduling algorithm etc the effect of these variation on measure of system performance is used to ascertain which of the parameter controllable by the job scheduling algorithm including the scheduling itself require optimization and which of the parameter not normally controllable by the scheduling algorithm have marked effect on system performance system performance is based upon the mean cost of delay to all job processed it is shown that significant improvement in the measure of system performance can be obtained by using variable time slice technique and by selecting the optimum round robin cycle time it appears that these feature would benefit from optimization whereas other parameter controllable by the scheduling algorithm affect system performance in predictable manner and would not benefit from optimization feature not normally under the control of the scheduling algorithm can also have marked effect on the measure of performance in particular supervisor overhead the size of the store and the speed of the cpu comparison is made between the result of the simulation model and two analytical equation for quantum oriented nonpreemptive time sharing system the comparison is found to be very favorable |

2353|fast finite difference solution of biharmonic problem setting the reynolds number equal to zero in method for solving the navier stroke equation numerically result in fast numerical method for biharmonic problem the equation is treated system of two second order equation and simple smoothing process is essential for convergence an application is made to crack type problem |
2354|implementing clenshaw curtis quadrature ii computing the cosine transformation in companion paper to this i methodology and experience the automatic clenshaw curtis quadrature scheme wa described and how each quadrature formula used in the scheme requires cosine transformation of the integrand value wa shown the high cost of these cosine transformation been serious drawback in using clenshaw curtis quadrature two other problem related to the cosine transformation have also been trouble some first the conventional computation of the cosine transformation by recurrence relation is numerically unstable particularly at the low frequency which have the largest effect upon the integral second in case the automatic scheme should require refinement of the sampling storage is required to save the integrand value after the cosine transformation is computed this second part of the paper show how the cosine transformation can be computed by modification of the fast fourier transform and all three problem overcome the modification is also applicable in other circumstance requiring cosine or sine transformation such polynomial interpolation through the chebyshev point |
2355|implementing clenshaw curtis quadrature i methodology and experience clenshaw curtis quadrature is particularly important automatic quadrature scheme for variety of reason especially the high accuracy obtained from relatively few integrand value however it received little use because it requires the computation of cosine transformation and the arithmetic cost of this been prohibitive this paper is in two part companion paper ii computing the cosine transformation show that this objection can be overcome by computing the cosine transformation by modification of the fast fourier transform algorithm this first part discus the strategy and various error estimate and summarizes experience with particular implementation of the scheme |
2356|technique for software module specification with example this paper present an approach to writing specification for part of software system the main goal is to provide specification sufficiently precise and complete that other piece of software can be written to interact with the piece specified without additional information the secondary goal is to include in the specification more information than necessary to meet the first goal the technique is illustrated by mean of variety of example from tutorial system |
2357|mux simple approach to on line computing an on line system operating part of normal batch system for the cdc computer is described the system which required one man year for initial software implementation although basically simple provides the necessary element to input and modify file submit them for batch execution and provide result at the user terminal multiplexer designed and developed part of the project cost one man year for design and checkout and for part and fabrication all aspect of the system are described including design criterion implementation cost overhead and user reaction |
2358|the multics virtual memory concept and design experience with use of on line operating system grown the need to share information among system user become increasingly apparent many contemporary system permit some degree of sharing usually sharing is accomplished by allowing several user to share data via input and output of information stored in file kept in secondary storage through the use of segmentation however multics provides direct hardware addressing by user and system program of all information independent of it physical storage location information is stored in segment each of which is potentially sharable and carry it own independent attribute of size and access privilege here the design and implementation consideration of segmentation and sharing in multics are first discussed under the assumption that all information resides in large segmented main memory since the size of main memory on contemporary system is rather limited it is then shown how the multics software achieves the effect of large segmented main memory through the use of the honeywell segmentation and paging hardware |
2359|an improved index sequential access method using hashed overflow the index sequential access method isam is one of the most important file management system used with moveable head disk device this study investigates the use of an unconventional method of treating overflow record the method is to use hashing technique to allocate space for such record if certain condition are satisfied this is superior to the conventional isam method of chaining the overflow record via linked list technique these condition are long overflow chain with significant overflow lack of tight disk space constraint record key which are small compared to the total record size and significant use of the file in the index opposed to the sequential mode using hashed overflow the time to locate record is dependent not on the total volume of overflow record in conventional isam but on the percentage use of space dedicated to overflow record |

2365|matrix computation with fortran and paging the efficiency of conventional fortran program for matrix computation can often be improved by reversing the order of nested loop such modification produce modest saving in many common situation and very significant saving for large problem run under an operating system which us paging |
2366|complex gamma function with error control an algorithm to compute the gamma function and log gamma function of complex variable is presented the standard algorithm is modified in several respect to insure the continuity of the function value and to reduce accumulation of round off error in addition to computation of function value this algorithm includes an object time estimation of round off error experimental data with regard to the effectiveness of this error control are presented fortran program for the algorithm appears in the algorithm section of this issue |

2368|an implemented graph algorithm for winning shannon switching game in this tutorial paper computer program which win shannon switching game is described since these game are played on graph the program is good example of the implementation of graph algorithm the two player in shannon switching game connect and cut have nonsimilar goal either connect cut or the player moving first is guaranteed the existence of winning strategy the simple strategy explained in this paper is valid in all three case in fact the major routine never need to know whether the computer is connect or cut |

2372|on the implementation of security measure in information system the security of an information system may be represented by model matrix whose element are decision rule and whose row and column index are user and data item respectively set of four function is used to access this matrix at translation and execution time distinguishing between data dependent and data independent decision rule enables one to perform much of the checking of security only once at translation time rather than repeatedly at execution time the model is used to explain security feature of several existing system and serf framework for proposal for general security system implementation within today language and operating system |

2375|comparative analysis of disk scheduling policy five well known scheduling policy for movable head disk are compared using the performance criterion of expected seek time system orientedand expected waiting time individual io request oriented both analytical and simulation result are obtained the variance of waiting time is introduced another meaningful measure of performance showing possible discrimination against individual request then the choice of utility function to measure total performance including system oriented and individual request oriented measure is described such function allows one to differentiate among the scheduling policy over wide range of input loading condition the selection and implementation of maximum performance two policy algorithm are discussed |
2376|synchronization of communicating process formalization of well defined synchronization mechanism can be used to prove that concurrently running process of system communicate correctly this is demonstrated for system consisting of many sending process which deposit message in buffer and many receiving process which remove message from that buffer the formal description of the synchronization mechanism make it very easy to prove that the buffer will neither overflow nor underflow that sender and receiver will never operate on the same message frame in the buffer nor will they run into deadlock |
2377|hardware architecture for implementing protection ring protection of computation and information is an important aspect of computer utility in system which us segmentation memory addressing scheme protection can be achieved in part by associating concentric ring of decreasing access privilege with computation this paper describes hardware processor mechanism for implementing these ring of protection the mechanism for implementing these ring of protection the mechanism allow cross ring call and subsequent return to occur without trapping to the supervisor automatic hardware validation of reference across ring boundary is also performed thus call by user procedure to protected subsystem including the supervisor is identical to call to companion user procedure the mechanism of passing and referencing argument are the same in both case well |

2424|dynamic verification of operating system decision dynamic verification of decision implies that every time the decision is made there is consistency check performed on the decision using independent hardware and software the dynamic verification of operating system decision is used on the prime system being designed and constructed at the university of california berkeley prime is an experimental time sharing which is to have the property of continuous availability data privacy and cost effectiveness the technique of dynamic verification allows the construction of an operating system which doe not make certain decision improperly even in the presence of single hardware or software fault furthermore multiple fault lead to unreliable operation only if the fault happen to reinforce each other on prime dynamic verification is used to ensure that one user information cannot become available to another user gratuitously even in the presence of single hardware or software faultthe amount of additional hardware and software required for dynamic verification can be modest |

2438|model and stack implementation of multiple environment many control and access environment structure require that storage for procedure activation exist at time when control is not nested within the procedure activated this is straightforward to implement by dynamic storage allocation with linked block for each activation but rather expensive in both time and space this paper present an implementation technique using single stack to hold procedure activation storage which allows retention of that storage for duration not necessarily tied to control flow the technique the property that in the simple case it run identically to the usual automatic stack allocation and deallocation procedure application of this technique to multitasking coroutines backtracking label valued variable and functional argument are discussed in the initial model single real processor is assumed and the implementation assumes multiple process coordinate by passing control explicitly to one another multiprocessor implementation requires only few change to the basic technique described |

2451|design of tree structure for efficient querying standard information retrieval operation is to determine which record in data collection satisfy given query expressed in term of data value the process of locating the desired response can be represented by tree search model this paper pose an optimization problem in the design of such tree to serve well specified application the problem is academic in the sense that ordinarily the optimal tree cannot be implemented by mean of practical technique on the other hand it is potentially useful for the comparison it affords between observed performance and that of an intuitively attractive ideal search procedure practical application of such model this paper considers the design of novel tree search scheme based on bit vector representation of data and show that essentially the same algorithm can be used to design either an ideal search tree or bit vector tree an experimental study of small formatted file illustrates the concept |

2453|information theory applied to the conversion of decision table to computer program using idea from information theory this paper develops heuristic algorithm that convert limited entry decision table to tree structured computer program with near minimum average processing time the method is applicable to any limited entry decision table and doe not require that action have single rule or that the cost of testing condition be equal it is thus more general than the previously published heuristic algorithm compared to the optimal algorithm of reinwald and soland this algorithm is easy to code and take much smaller translation time it is thus felt that it is more useful in practice the algorithm is well suited for manual conversion of decision table to flowchart |

2470|fen an axiomatic basis for program semantics formal system is presented which abstract the notion of data item function and relation it is argued that the system is more suitable than set theory or it derivative for the concise and accurate description of program semantics it is shown how the system can be used to build composite data type out of simper one with the operation of rowing structuring and uniting it is also demonstrated that completely new primitive type can be introduced into language through the mechanism of singleton data type both deterministic and nondeterministic function are shown to be definable in the system it is described how the local environment can be modeled data item and how imperative statement can be considered function on the environment the nature of recursive function is briefly discussed and technique is presented by which they can be introduced into the system the technique is contrasted with the use of the paradoxical combinator the question of local and global environment and of various mode of function calling and parameter passing are touched upon the theory is applied to the proof of several elementary theorem concerning the semantics of the assignment conditional and iterative statement an appendix is included which present in detail the formal system governing web and fen the abstraction used informally in the body of the paper |

2481|the distribution of program in primary and fast buffer storage virtual memory computer system with fast buffer cache memory between primary memory and the central processing unit is considered the optimal distribution of program between the buffer and primary memory is studied using the program lifetime function expression for the distribution of program which maximizes the useful fraction of the cost time integral of primary and fast buffer storage are obtained for swapping and nonswapping buffer management policy |
2482|mixed solution for the deadlock problem mixture of detection avoidance and prevention provide more effective and practical solution to the deadlock problem than any one of these alone the individual technique can be tailored for subproblems of resource allocation and still operate together to prevent deadlock this paper present method based on the concept of the hierarchical operating system for constructing appropriate mixture and suggests appropriate subsystem for the most frequently occurring resource allocation problem |
2483|coko iii the cooper koz chess program coko iii is chess player written entirely in fortran on the ibm coko iii play minimal chess game at the rate of sec cpu time per move with level close to lower chess club play selective tree searching procedure controlled by tactical chess logistics allows deployment of multiple minimal game calculation to achieve some optimal move selection the tree searching algorithm are the heart of cokos effectiveness yet they are conceptually simple in addition an interesting phenomenon called tree searching catastrophe plagued cokos entire development just it trouble human player standard exponential growth is curbed to large extent by the definition and trimming of the fischer set clear distinction between tree pruning and selective tree searching is also made representation of the chess environment is described along with strategical preanalysis procedure that map the lasker region specific chess algorithm are described which could be used command structure by anyone desiring to do some chess program experimentation comparison is made of some mysterious action of human player and coko iii |
2484|note on information organization and storage since the logical structure of data base can be represented by tree or graph it is quite natural for u to view the process of designing data base that of constructing tree or graph general method for constructing such tree or graph is provided there are three important element in this general construction method namely set of binary relation an algorithm for constructing subset of set and an algorithm for selecting an element from the given set of object the use of different relation and algorithm result in different information structure list tree ring etc thus the problem of information organization and storage is reduced to that of defining relation and formulating algorithm under given set of constraint the result presented may be valuable to designer useful design concept and may serve basis for developing formal theory on the subject |
2485|managing the computer resource stage hypothesis based on the study of expenditure for data processing descriptive stage hypothesis is presented it is suggested that the planning organizing and controlling activity associated with managing the computer resource will change in character over period of time and will evolve in pattern roughly correlated to four stage of the computer budget stage i computer acquisition stage ii intense system development stage iii proliferation of control and stage iv userservice orientation each stage is described and related to individual task for managing the computer resource |

2496|on the near optimality of the shortest latency time first drum scheduling discipline for computer system in which it is practical to determine the instantaneous drum position popular discipline for determining the sequence in which the record are to be accessed is the so called shortest latency time first sltf discipline when collection of varying length record is to be accessed from specified drum position it is known that the sltf discipline doe not necessarily minimize the drum latency time however we show that the total time to access the entire collection for any sltf schedule is never much drum revolution longer than minimum latency schedule |
2497|synchronizing processor with memory content generated interrupt implementation of the lock unlock method of synchronizing processor in multiprocessor system usually require uninterruptable memory pause type instruction an interlock scheme called read interlock which doe not require memory pause instruction been developed for dual dec pdp system with real time requirement the read interlock method doe require specialread interlock instruction in the repertoire of the processor and special read interlock cycle in the repertoire of the memory module when processor examines lock memory location with read interlock instruction it will be interrupted if the lock wa already set examining lock immediately set it if it wa not already set this event sequence is read interlock cycle writing into lock clear it having the processor interrupted upon encountering set lock instead of branching is advantageous if the branch would have resulted in an effective interrupt |
2498|minimizing wasted space in partitioned segmentation paged virtual memory system using finite number of page size is considered two algorithm for assigning page to segment are discussed both of these algorithm are simple to implement the problem of choosing the page size to minimize the expected value of total wasted space in internal fragmentation and in page table per segment is then solved for probability density function of segment size which may be expressed convex combination of erlang density |
2499|efficient multiprogramming resource allocation and accounting although sometimes thought of only component of time sharing operation multiprogramming can involve broader question of resource allocation since fairness is not required to meet response criterion in multiprogrammed system it may serve maximal resource use to be unfair for example by holding an inputoutput channel idle for program while it completes small amount of processor usage enabling further use of the channel several application of this principle are given and it is suggested that multiprogramming executive might dynamically adjust it allocation algorithm to gain efficiency allocation of resource is closely connected to accounting for those resource raising the problem of repeatability minimal uncharged overhead and relative weighting of charge for dependent resource since weighting may depend on allocation algorithm these are not arbitrary accounting parameter often the only repeatable accounting is one which omits an extensive overhead will be paid and should multiprogramming prove efficient overcharge will result multiprogramming turn on allocation of the memory resource essential to control of other resource the general suggestion for allocation and accounting are applied to this question and some detail provided for the case of monitor which control virtual memory machine |
2500|practical approach to managing resource and avoiding deadlock resource scheduling and allocation can be expensive with regard to time and space in multiprogramming or time sharing environment involving large number of task and resource with conflicting requirement detection andor prevention of deadlock can require massive amount of additional overhead if efficient usage of resource is to be maintained resource management program is described which us linked list along with other technique to overcome large portion of this overhead the program which is currently running part of large scale general purpose operating system keep resource relatively active but doe not detect or prevent all deadlock in it implemented state certain change which would permit more comprehensive level of deadlock preventiondetection at additional cost have not been incorporated in the running system due to the infrequency of deadlock situation |

2515|minimal event node network of project precedence relation procedure for constructing minimal event node network to represent set of precedence relation without parallel activity is presented minimal event node network is an event node network in which both the number of node and the number of arc are the minimum to preserve the given precedence relation counterexample are given to show that the algorithm presented by c fisher j s liebman and g l nemhauser produce event node network which are not minimal since our procedure includes the set covering problem the time required may grow exponentially with the number of given activity |

2525|statistical study of the accuracy of floating point number system this paper present the statistical result of test of the accuracy of certain arithmetic system in evaluating sum product and inner product and analytic error estimate for some of the computation the arithmetic system studied are digit hexadecimal and digit binary floating point number representation combined with the usual chop and round mode of arithmetic with various number of guard digit and with modified round mode with guard digit in certain sense arithmetic system differing only in their use of binary or hexadecimal number representation are shown to be approximately statistically equivalent inaccuracy further the usual round mode with guard digit is shown to be statistically superior in accuracy to the usual chop mode in all case save one the modified round mode is found to be superior to the chop mode in all case |
2526|asymmetric memory hierarchy study is presented of some of the system implication of memory hierarchy in which the backing or secondary store very small read time relative of both the time required for writing and to the read time of conventional backing storage device several analytic model are introduced and it is shown that such hierarchy may operate in way which differ from those of more conventional hierarchy in particular it is shown that it may not be necessary to multiprogram in such situation in the past backing storage device have been roughly symmetric with respect to their read and write time this situation may not continue several device are currently under development which may have very small read timewrite time ratio this study place particular emphasis on one such system the rca readwrite holographic optical memory |

2534|design and implementation of diagnostic compiler for pli plc is compiler for dialect for pli the design objective wa to provide maximum degree of diagnostic assistance in batch processing environment for the most part this assistance is implicit and is provided automatically by the compiler the most remarkable characteristic of plc is it perseverance it completes translation of every program submitted and continues execution until user established error limit is reached this requires that the compiler repair error encountered during both translation and execution and the design of plc is dominated by this consideration plc also introduces several explicit user controlled facility for program testing to accommodate these extension to pli without abandoning compatibility with ibm compiler plc permit pseudo comment construction whose content can optionally be considered either source test or comment in spite of the diagnostic effort plc is fast and efficient processor it effectively demonstrates that compiler can provide better diagnostic assistance than is customarily offered even when sophisticated source language is employed and that this assistance need not be prohibitively costly |
2535|the effect of multiplexing on computer communication system study is made of the way in which asynchronous time division multiplexing change the stochastic nature of the arrival process from user to the computer and consequently affect the performance of time shared computer communication system it is concluded that while for certain value of system parameter there is noticeable improvement in the performance of the computer model in the sense that time shared scheduling delay are reduced these improvement are offset by the transmission delay imposed by multiplexing so that there may be little or change in the computer communication system performance analytical and simulation result are based on the model of the computer communication system being an md queue the multiplexor in tandem with single exponential server the computer analytical result include general description of the output process of an md queue and the condition under which this output process is approximately poisson |

2537|common phrase and minimum space text storage method for saving storage space for text string such compiler diagnostic message is described the method relies on hand selection of set of text string which are common to one or more message these phrase are then stored only once the storage technique give rise to mathematical optimization problem determine how each message should use the available phrase to minimize it storage requirement this problem is nontrivial when phrase which overlap exist however dynamic programming algorithm is presented which solves the problem in time which grows linearly with the number of character in the text algorithm applies to this paper |

2541|an overview of the ispl computer system design this paper explores the advantage of the concurrent design of the language operating system and machine via microcode to create an interactive programming laboratory it describes the synergistic effect that the freedom to move and alter feature from one of these domain to another had on the design of this system which not been implemented this freedom simplified both incremental compilation and the system addressing structure and centralized the communication mechanism enabling the construction of hierarchical subsystem it also suggested an important new concept for operating system separation of the scheduling from the maintenance function in resource allocation this separation enables incorporation of new scheduling algorithm decision of what to do without endangering the system integration correctly performing the scheduling decision |
2542|software design and evaluation system critical failure of current software system design and implementation methodology is that the performance of proposed design is not evaluated before it is actually implemented in this paper the reason for this failure are explored and new methodology which overcomes many of the difficulty is proposed system which integrates performance evaluation with design and implementation is described this system is based on simple high level language which is used to describe the evolving system at all stage of it development the source language description is used direct input to performance analysis and simulation routine using the performance information obtained from these routine feedback the problem which adversely affect performance are detected early enough so that they can be corrected without costly major reimplementation of the proposed system |

2554|reduction of band symmetric generalized eigenvalue problem an algorithm is described for reducing the generalized eigenvalue problem ax lambda bx to an ordinary problem in case and b are symmetric band matrix with b positive definite if n is the order of the matrix and m the bandwidth the matrix and b are partitioned into m by m block and the algorithm is described in term of these block the algorithm reduces the generalized problem to an ordinary eigenvalue problem for symmetric band matrix c whose bandwidth is the same and b the algorithm is similar to those of rutishauser and schwartz for the reduction of symmetric matrix to band form the calculation c requires order mn operation the round off error in the calculation of c is of the same order the sum of the error at each of the nm step of the algorithm the latter error being largely determined by the condition of b with respect to inversion |
2555|variable precision exponentiation previous paper presented an efficient algorithm called the recomputation algorithm for evaluating rational expression to within any desired tolerance on computer which performs variable precision arithmetic operation the recomputation algorithm can be applied to expression involving any variable precision operation having p sumei error bound where p denotes the operation precision and ei denotes the error in the operation ith argument this paper present an efficient variable precision exponential operation with an error bound of the above order other operation such log and co which have simple series expansion can be handled similarly |

2559|the reallocation of hash coded table when the space allocation for hash coded table is altered the table entry must be rescattered over the new space technique for accomplishing this rescattering is presented the technique is independent of both the length of the table and the hashing function used and can be utilized in conjunction with linear reallocation of the table being rescattered moreover it can be used to eliminate previously flagged deletion from any hash coded table or to change from one hashing method to another the efficiency of the technique is discussed and theoretical statistic are given |
