2567|an exponential method for the solution of system of ordinary differential equation an explicit coupled single step method for the numerical solution of initial value problem for system of ordinary differential equation is presented the method wa designed to be general purpose in nature but to be especially efficient when dealing with stiff system of differential equation it is in general second order except for the case of linear system with constant coefficient and linear forcing term in that case the method is third order it been implemented and put to routine usage in biological application where stiffness frequently appears with favorable result when compared to standard fourth order runge kutta implementation computation time required by this method ranged from comparable for certain nonstiff problem to better than two order of magnitude faster for some highly stiff system |
2568|graph formulation of school scheduling algorithm the problem classically titled the examination schedule problem take various form in the literature most of these formulation can be presented in the terminology of classical network theory one such formulation is given nondirected network partition it node into minimal number of subset such that two member of the same subset are connected by anarc an obvious lower limit to this number is the size of the largest strongly connected subgraph kirchgassner proved that an upper limit is this size plus one one logical extension of the previous work is the introduction of variable length examination where wi is the number of period for exam i the object of this paper is to generalize the definition of largest strongly connected subgraph to include the weighting of node to present an approximate algorithm which usually find the largest strongly connected subgraph and to discus the application of this algorithm to the solution of school scheduling and exam scheduling problem |
2569|computer generation of gamma random variate with non integral shape parameter when the shape parameter is integral generating gamma random variable with digital computer is straightforward there is simple method for generating gamma random variate with non integral shape parameter common procedure is to approximately generate such random variable by use of the so called probability switch method another procedure which is exact is due to johnk this paper present rejection method for exactly generating gamma random variable when is greater than the efficiency of the rejection method is shown to be better than the efficiency of johnks method the paper concludes that when is non integral the following mix of procedure yield the best combination of accuracy and efficiency when is than use johnks method when is than and is than use the rejection method when is greater than use the probability switch method |
2570|comparison of list schedule for parallel processing system the problem of scheduling two or more processor to minimize the execution time of program which consists of set of partially ordered task is studied case where task execution time are deterministic and others in which execution time are random variable are analyzed it is shown that different algorithm suggested in the literature vary significantly in execution time and that the b schedule of coffman and graham is near optimal dynamic programming solution for the case in which execution time are random variable is presented |
2571|an analytic model of the hasp execution task monitor the hasp execution task monitor periodically rearranges the dispatching chain to give task preemptive execution priority in inverse order to that of their cpu utilization history the effect is to keep the io bound task active and to prevent cpu bound task from locking out other task this paper develops simple model of the execution task monitor and employ it to study the effectiveness of the monitor in improving system performance modified strategy monitor control is investigated for the case of task execution in memory hierarchy of varying speed |
2572|argument for moratorium on the construction of community information utility in this article the author urge prudent and decentralized approach to the question of the design and desirability of computerized community information utility before accepting the inevitability and desirability of this or any technology we should be sure of the feasibility internally and externally of what is proposed project and perhaps wait for change in complementary technique evaluate current and projected supplementary technique establish the existence of demand for what is proposed take step to involve representative group of ultimate user in system design and carefully think through possible side effect on man and his world view current proposal for community information utility are examined in this framework and the conclusion is drawn that society is not yet in position to justify either the construction of an information utility in prototype community or the acceptance of policy in favor of it widespread implementation |

2579|register allocation via usage count this paper introduces the notion of usage count show how usage count can be developed by algorithm that eliminate redundant computation and describes how usage count can provide the basis for register allocation the paper compare register allocation based on usage count to other commonly used register allocation technique and present evidence which show that the usage count technique is significantly better than these other technique |

2581|locally organized parser for spoken input this paper describes lpars locally organized parsing system designed for use in continuous speech recognizer lpars process string of phoneme which contains ambiguity and error the system is locally organized in the sense that it build local parse structure from reliable word candidate recognized anywhere in an input utterance these local structure are used island of reliability to guide the search for more highly garbled word which might complete the utterance |
2582|improving locality by critical working set new approach to program locality improvement via restructuring is described the method is particularly suited to those system where primary memory is managed according to working set strategy it is based on the concept of critical working set working set which doe not contain the next memory reference the data the method operates upon are extracted from trace of the program to be restructured it is shown that except in some special case the method is not optimum however the experimental result obtained by using the method to restructure an interactive text editor and the file system module of an operating system have shown it substantial superiority over the other method proposed in the literature |

2592|on generation of test problem for linear programming code user of linear programming computer code have realized the necessity of evaluating the capacity effectiveness and accuracy of the solution provided by such code large scale linear programming code at most installation are assumed to be generating correct solution without ever having been bench marked by test problem with known solution the reason for this failure to adequately test the code is that rarely are there large problem with known solution readily available this paper present theoretical justification and an illustrative implementation of method for generating linear programming test problem with known solution the method permit the generation of test problem that are of arbitrary size and have wide range of numerical characteristic |
2593|back end computer for data base management it is proposed that the data base management function be placed on dedicated back end computer which accepts command in relatively high level language such the codasyl data base task group april report from host computer access the data base on secondary storage and return result the advantage of such configuration are discussed an experimental implementation called the experimental data management system xdms is described and certain conclusion about the back end approach are drawn from this implementation |
2594|structured data structure programming system which permit arbitrary linked list structure enable the user to create complicated structure without sufficient protection deletion can result in unreachable data element and there is guarantee that addition will be performed properly to remedy this situation this paper proposes gauge which provides for the creation of restricted class of data structure but ensures the correctness of the program this is accomplished by an explicit structure declaration facility restriction on the permissible operation and execution time check |
2595|note on the calculation working set size finite length reference string of arbitrary structure are considered and an exact expression for average working set size in term of corrected interreference interval statistic is derived an example is discussed upper and lower bound are obtained and the average working set size function is shown to be efficiently obtained for set of page size in single pas of the reference string this work follows the development of paper by denning and schwartz who consider infinite length reference string which satisfy certain statistical property and who derive an expression relating the asymptotic average working set size to the asymptotic missing page rate function under working set replacement |
2596|weighted buddy method for dynamic storage allocation an extension of the buddy method called the weighted buddy method for dynamic storage allocation is presented the weighted buddy method allows block size of k and k whereas the original buddy method allowed only block size of k this extension is achieved at an additional cost of only two bit per block simulation result are presented which compare this method with the buddy method these result indicate that for uniform request distribution the buddy system total memory fragmentation than the weighted buddy algorithm however the total fragmentation is smaller for the weighted buddy method when the request are for exponentially distributed block size |
2597|monitor an operating system structuring concept this paper develops brinch hansens concept of monitor method of structuring an operating system it introduces form of synchronization describes possible method of implementation in term of semaphore and give suitable proof rule illustrative example include single resource scheduler bounded buffer an alarm clock buffer pool disk head optimizer and version of the problem of reader and writer |
2598|extending the information theory approach to converting limited entry decision table to computer program this paper modifies an earlier algorithm for converting decision table into flowchart which minimize subsequent execution time when compiled into computer program the algorithm considered in this paper perform limited search and accordingly do not necessarily result in globally optimal solution however the greater search effort needed to obtain globally optimal solution for complex decision table is usually not justified by sufficient saving in execution time there is an analogy between the problem of converting decision table into efficient flowchart and the well understood problem in information theory of noiseless coding the result of the noiseless coding literature are used to explore the limitation of algorithm used to solve the decision table problem the analogy between the two problem is also used to develop improvement to the information algorithm in extending the depth of search under certain condition and in proposing additional condition to be added to the decision table finally the information algorithm is compared with an algorithm proposed in recent paper by verhelst |

2606|new integration algorithm for ordinary differential equation based on continued fraction approximation new integration algorithm is found and an implementation is compared with other programmed algorithm the new algorithm is step by step procedure for solving the initial value problem in ordinary differential equation it is designed to approximate pole of small integer order in the solution of the differential equation by continued fraction obtained by manipulating the sum of truncated taylor series expansion the new method is compared with gragg bulirsh stoer and the taylor series method the taylor series method and the new method are shown to be superior in speed and accuracy while the new method is shown to be most superior when the solution is required near singularity the new method can finally be seen to pas automatically through singularity where all the other method which are discussed will have failed |

2620|execution time requirement for encipherment program although encipherment often been discussed mean to protect computer data it cost are not well established five experiment were conducted to measure the cpu time on cdc required by additive cipher programmed both in assembly language and in fortran null transformation to measure the time to move data without encipherment encipherment with one word key encipherment with word key double key encipherment and encipherment using pseudo random key the result were analyzed for consistency over run and the effect of constant and intermittent error were considered timing rate for assembly language encipherment ranged from character per second for pseudo random key cipher to character per second for constant one word key cipher the latter is almost equivalent to the rate required simply to move data without encipherment fortran test required over four time much cpu time this paper introduces the idea on enciphering time coefficient the ratio of enciphering time to the time taken to fetch and store data without encipherment |
2621|high security log in procedure the protection of time sharing system from unauthorized user is often achieved by the use of password by using one way cipher to code the password the risk involved with storing the password in the computer can be avoided we discus the selection of suitable one way cipher and suggest that for this purpose polynomial over prime modulus are superior to one way cipher derived from sannon code |
2622|user authentication scheme not requiring secrecy in the computer in many computer operating system user authenticates himself by entering secret password known solely to himself and the system the system compare this password with one recorded in password table which is available to only the authentication program the integrity of the system depends on keeping the table secret in this paper password scheme is presented which doe not require secrecy in the computer all aspect of the system including all relevant code and data base may be known by anyone attempting to intrude the scheme is based on using function h which the would be intruder is unable to invert this function is applied to the user password and the result compared to table entry match being interpreted authentication of the user the intruder may know all about h and have access to the table but can penetrate the system only if can invert h to determine an input that produce given output this paper discus issue surrounding selection of suitable h two different plausible argument are given that penetration would be exceedingly difficult and it is then argued that more rigorous result are unlikely finally some human engineering problem relating to the scheme are discussed |

2625|capability based addressing various addressing scheme making use of segment table are examined the inadequacy of these scheme when dealing with shared address are explained these inadequacy are traced to the lack of an efficient absolute address for object in these system the direct use of capability an address is shown to overcome these difficulty because it provides the needed absolute address implementation of capability based addressing is discussed it is predicted that the use of tag to identify capability will dominate hardware address translation scheme which never requires the modification of the representation of capability is suggested the scheme us main memory hash table for obtaining segment location in main memory given it unique code the hash table is avoided for recently accessed segment by mean of set of associative register computer using capability based addressing may be substantially superior to present system on the basis of protection simplicity of programming convention and efficient implementation |

2627|scheduling independent task to reduce mean finishing time sequencing to minimize mean finishing time or mean time in system is not only desirable to the user but it also tends to minimize at each point in time the storage required to hold incomplete task in this paper deterministic model of independent task is introduced and new result are derived which extend and generalize the algorithm known for minimizing mean finishing time in addition to presenting and analyzing new algorithm it is shown that the most general mean finishing time problem for independent task is polynomial complete and hence unlikely to admit of non enumerative solution |
2628|minimal total processing time drum and disk scheduling discipline this article investigates the application of minimal total processing time mtpt scheduling discipline to rotating storage unit when random arrival of request is allowed fixed head drum and moving head drum and moving head disk storage unit are considered and emphasis is placed on the relative merit of the mtpt scheduling discipline with respect to the shortest latency time first sltf scheduling discipline the result of the simulation study presented show that neither scheduling discipline is unconditionally superior to the other for most fixed head drum application the sltf discipline is preferable to mtpt but for intra cylinder disk scheduling the mtpt discipline offer distinct advantage over the sltf discipline the computational requirement of an algorithm that implement the mtpt scheduling discipline are shown to be comparable to sltf algorithm in both case the sorting procedure is the most time consuming phase of the algorithm |

2652|reduction of compilation cost through language contraction programming language tailored to particular group of user can often be constructed by removing unwanted feature from general purpose language this paper describes the use of simulation technique to predict the saving in compilation cost achievable by such an approach the result suggest function which describes the effect of change in the power of language on the compilation cost of an algorithm expressed in that language when feature not actually used by the algorithm are removed from the language the cost of compiling the algorithm decrease moderately but when feature that are needed are removed the compilation cost increase sharply |

2680|optimal space allocation on disk storage device when the amount of space required for file storage exceeds the amount which can be kept on line decision must be made to which file are to be permanently resident and which mountable these decision will affect the number of mount request issued to the operator this is often bottleneck in computing facility and reducing the number of mount thus decrease turnaround time an optimization model for the assignment of file to disk pack and pack to either resident or nonresident status is presented heuristic are suggested for those case in which it is inefficient to compute the actual optimum |

2692|reentrant polygon clipping new family of clipping algorithm is described these algorithm are able to clip polygon against irregular convex plane faced volume in three dimension removing the part of the polygon which lie outside the volume in two dimension the algorithm permit clipping against irregular convex window polygon to be clipped are represented an ordered sequence of vertex without repetition of first and last in marked contrast to representation collection of edge wa heretofore the common procedure output polygon have an identical format with new vertex introduced in sequence to describe any newly cut edge or edge the algorithm easily handle the particularly difficult problem of detecting that new vertex may be required at corner of the clipping window the algorithm described achieve considerable simplicity by clipping separately against each clipping plane or window boundary code capable of clipping the polygon against single boundary is reentered to clip against subsequent boundary each such reentrant stage of clipping need store only two vertex value and may begin it processing soon the first output vertex from the proceeding stage is ready because the same code is reentered for clipping against subsequent boundary clipping against very complex window shape is practical for perspective application in three dimentions six plane truncated pyramid is chosen the clipping volume the two additional plane parallel to the projection screen serve to limit the range of depth preserved through the projection perspective projection method which provides for arbitrary view angle and depth of field in spite of simple fixed clipping plane is described this method is ideal for subsequent hidden surface computation |

2695|tridiagonalization by permutation tridiagonalizing matrix by similarity transformation is an important computational tool in numerical linear algebra consider the class of sparse matrix which can be tridiagonalized using only row and corresponding column permutation the advantage of using such transformation include the absence of round off error and improved computation time when compared with standard transformation graph theoretic algorithm which examines an arbitrary n x n matrix and determines whether or not it can be permuted into tridiagonal form is given the algorithm requires arithmetic while the number of comparison the number of assignment and the number of increment are linear in n this compare very favorably with standard transformation method if the matrix is permutable into tridiagonal form the algorithm give the explicit tridiagonal form otherwise early rejection will occur |
2696|method of bivariate interpolation and smooth surface fitting based on local procedure method is designed for interpolating value given at point of rectangular grid in plane by smooth bivariate function zzx the interpolating function is bicubic polynomial in each cell of the rectangular grid emphasis is an avoiding excessive undulation between given grid point the proposed method is an extension of the method of univariate interpolation developed earlier by the author and is likewise based on local procedure |
2697|fast method for solving class of tridiagonal linear system the solution of linear system having real symmetric diagonally dominant tridiagonal coefficient matrix with constant diagonal is considered it is proved that the diagonal of the lu decomposition converges when floating point precision it is also proved that the computed lu decomposition converges when floating point arithmetic is used and that the limit of the lu diagonal using floating point are roughly within machine precision of the limit using real arithmetic this fact is exploited to reduce the number of floating point operation required to solve linear system from n to nk where k is much than n the order of the matrix if the element of the subdiagonals and superdiagonals are then only nk operation are needed the entire lu decomposition take k word of storage and considerable saving in array subscripting are achieved upper and lower bound on k are obtained in term of the ratio of the coefficient matrix diagonal constant and parameter of the floating point number system various generalization of these result are discussed |
2698|syntax directed least error analysis for context free language practical approach least error recognizer is developed informally using the well known recognizer of earley along with element of bellman dynamic programming the analyzer take general class of context free grammar driver and any finite string input recognition consists of least error count for corrected version of the input relative to the driver grammar the algorithm design emphasizes practical aspect which help in programming it |
2699|automatic data structure choice in language of very high level setl is set theoretically oriented language of very high level whose repertoire of semantic object includes finite set ordered n tuples and set of ordered n tuples usable mapping this paper describes the structure of an optimizer for this language among other method of interest the optimizer us technique which allow relation of inclusion and membership to be established the domain and range of tabulated mapping to be estimated from above and below and the single valuedness of tabulated mapping to be proved once fact of this kind have been established automatic choice of data structure becomes possible the method employed are based upon and extend known technique of data flow analysis |
2700|reduction method of proving property of parallel program when proving that parallel program given property it is often convenient to assume that statement is indivisible ie that the statement cannot be interleaved with the rest of the program here sufficient condition are obtained to show that the assumption that statement is indivisible can be relaxed and still preserve property such halting thus correctness proof of parallel system can often be greatly simplified |
2701|fast and usually linear algorithm for global flow analysis abstract only complete paper jacm january new algorithm for global flow analysis on reducible graph is presented the algorithm is shown to treat very general class of function space for graph of edge the algorithm worst case time bound of oe log function operation it is also shown that in programming term the number of operation is proportional to plus the number of exit from program loop consequently restriction to one entry one exit control structure linearity the algorithm can be extended to yet larger class of function space and graph by relaxing the time bound example are given of code improvement problem which can be solved using the algorithm |
2702|on the complexity of lrk testing the problem of determining whether an arbitrary context free grammar is member of some easily parsed subclass of grammar such the lrk grammar is considered the time complexity of this problem is analyzed both when k is considered to be fixed integer and when k is considered to be parameter of the test in the first case it is shown that for every k there exists an onk algorithm for testing the lrk property where n is the size of the grammar in question on the other hand if both k and the subject grammar are problem parameter then the complexity of the problem depends very strongly on the representation chosen for k more specifically it is shown that this problem is np complete when k is expressed in unary when k is expressed in binary the problem is complete for nondeterministic exponential time these result carry over to many other parameterized class of grammar such the llk strong llk slrk lck and strong lck grammar |
2703|the intrinsically exponential complexity of the circularity problem for attribute grammar attribute grammar are an extension of context free grammar devised by knuth mechanism for including the semantics of context free language with the syntax of the language the circularity problem for grammar is to determine whether the semantics for all possible sentence program in fact will be well defined it is proved that this problem is in general computationally intractable specifically it is shown that any deterministic algorithm which solves the problem must for infinitely many case use an exponential amount of timean improved version of knuths circularity testing algorithm is also given which actually solves the problem within exponential time |
2704|exception handling issue and proposed notation this paper defines exception condition discus the requirement exception handling language feature must satisfy and proposes some new language feature for dealing with exception in an orderly and reliable way the proposed language feature serve to highlight exception handling issue by showing how deficiency in current approach can be remedied |

2709|genealogy of control structure the issue of program control structure had history of heated controversy to put this issue on solid footing this paper review numerous theoretical result on control structure and explores their practical implication the classic result of bohm and jacopini on the theoretical completeness of if then else and while do is discussed several recent idea on control structure are then explored these include review of various other control structure result on timespace limitation and theorem relating the relative power of control structure under notion of equivalence in conclusion the impact of theoretical result on the practicing programmer and the importance of one in one out control structure operational abstraction are discussed it is argued further that there is insufficient evidence to warrant more than if then else while do and their variant |

2712|horners rule for the evaluation of general closed queueing network the solution of separable closed queueing network requires the evaluation of homogeneous multinomial expression the number of term in those expression grows combinatorially with the size of the network such that direct summation may become impractical an algorithm is given which doe not show combinatorial operation count the algorithm is based on generalization of horners rule for polynomial it is also shown how mean queue size and throughput an be obtained at negligible extra cost once the normalization constant is evaluated |

2733|deterministic parsing of ambiguous grammar method of describing the syntax of programming language in way that are more flexible and natural than conventional bnf description are considered these method involve the use of ambiguous context free grammar together with rule to resolve syntactic ambiguity it is shown how efficient lr and ll parser can be constructed directly from certain class of these specification |
2734|on the external storage fragmentation produced by first fit and best fit allocation strategy published comparison of the external fragmentation produced by first fit and best fit memory allocation have not been consistent through simulation series of experiment were performed in order to obtain better data on the relative performance of first fit and best fit and better understanding of the reason underlying observed difference the time memory product efficiency of first fit and best fit were generally within to percent of each other except for small population the size of the request population had little effect on allocation efficiency for exponential and hyperexponential distribution of request first fit outperformed best fit but for normal and uniform distribution and for exponential distribution distorted in various way best fit outperformed first fit it is hypothesized that when first fit outperforms best fit it doe so because first fit by preferentially allocating toward one end of memory encourages large block to grow at the other end sufficient contiguous space is thereby more likely to be available for relatively large request result of simulation experiment supported this hypothesis and showed that the relative performance of first fit and best fit depends on the frequency of request when the coefficient of variation of the request distribution is greater than or approximately equal to unity first fit outperformed best fit |

2737|determining the minimum area encasing rectangle for an arbitrary closed curve this paper describes method for finding the rectangle of minimum area in which given arbitrary plane curve can be contained the method is of interest in certain packing and optimum layout problem it consists of first determining the minimal perimeter convex polygon that encloses the given curve and then selecting the rectangle of minimum area capable of containing this polygon three theorem are introduced to show that one side of the minimum area rectangle must be colinear with an edge of the enclosed polygon and that the minimum area encasing rectangle for the convex polygon is also the minimum area rectangle for the curve |

2749|significant event simulation this paper compare new method of simulation organization called the significant event method with an old one called the clock pulse method using example two automobile traffic model the significant event method is found to be more efficient than the clock pulse method at low level of system interaction and efficient at high level simple mathematical model for the trade off in the relative running time of the two method is developed the model aid in choosing between the two simulation method for particular experiment it is concluded that the significant event method can be of value in the simulation of some system when computational efficiency is of sufficient importance |

2800|connection between accuracy and stability property of linear multistep formula this paper is concerned with stability and accuracy of family of linear k step formula depending on parameter with particular emphasis on the numerical solution of stiff ordinary differential equation an upper bound pk is derived for the order of accuracy of ainf stable formula three criterion are given for stability it is shown that for pk k arbitrary ainf stability implies certain necessary condition for stability and for strict stability meaning that the extraneous root of ppsi satisfy psi for pk and ainf stability for k together with another constraint implies strict stability and for certain one parameter class of formula with pk andor ainf stability implies stability |
2801|storage efficient representation of decimal data usually n decimal digit are represented by n bit in computer actually two bcd digit can be compressed optimally and reversibly into bit and three digit into bit by very simple algorithm based on the fixed length combination of two variable field length encoding in over half of the case the compressed code result from the conventional bcd code by simple removal of redundant bit long decimal message can be subdivided into three digit block and separately compressed the result differs from the asymptotic minimum length by only percent the hardware requirement is small and the mapping can be done manually |
2802|the new math of computer programming structured programming proved to be an important methodology for systematic program design and development structured program are identified compound function expression in the algebra of function the algebraic property of these function expression permit the reformulation expansion well reduction of nested subexpression independently of it environment thus modeling what is known stepwise program refinement well program execution finally structured programming is characterized in term of the selection and solution of certain elementary equation defined in the algebra of function these solution can be given in general formula each involving single parameter which display the entire freedom available in creating correct structured program |
2803|pseudoinverses and conjugate gradient this paper is devoted to the study of connection between pseudoinverses of matrix and conjugate gradient and conjugate direction routine |
2804|elementary divisor of tensor product the elementary divisor of tensor product of linear transformation have been known for year this paper provides short easily accessible proof of these result and point out an interesting combinatorial consequence of the proof |
2805|perturbation of eigenvalue of non normal matrix the problem considered is to give bound for finite perturbation of simple and multiple eigenvalue of nonnormal matrix where these bound are in term of the eigenvalue the departure from normality and the frobenius norm of the perturbation matrix but not in term of the eigen system the bound which are derived are shown to be almost attainable for any set of matrix |
2806|two hadamard number for matrix discussion is given of two function of the entry of square matrix both related to hadamards determinant theorem which have some merit alternative to norm bound condition number one for linear system is known the other for eigen system seems to be new |
2807|on the stability of gauss jordan elimination with pivoting the stability of the gauss jordan algorithm with partial pivoting for the solution of general system of linear equation is commonly regarded suspect it is shown that in many respect suspicion are unfounded and in general the absolute error in the solution is strictly comparable with that corresponding to gaussian elimination with partial pivoting plus back substitution however when is ill conditioned the residual corresponding to the gauss jordan solution will often be much greater than that corresponding to the gaussian elimination solution |
2808|the lemniscate constant the lemniscate constant and indeed some of the method used for actually computing them have played an enormous part in the development of mathematics an account is given here of some of the method used most of the derivation can be made by elementary method this material can be used for teaching purpose and there is much relevant and interesting historical material the acceleration method developed for the purpose of evaluating these constant are useful in other problem |
2809|positivity and norm following some line of joint work with s householder the character and use of algebraic method in the theory of norm is demonstrated new result concerning norm with value in an archimedian vector lattice not necessarily being totally ordered are given in particular for the generalization of order unit norm l norm and m norm an example of application to operator norm is given concerning contraction property of positive operator |
2810|professionalism in the computing field the term professional mean different thing to different people nevertheless there are certain general technical and social standard normally associated with professional further the term is more generally applied to the practitioner rather than to the researcher but within the rather broad definition specified the computing practitioner is yet not regarded professional each of the four type of institution academic industry government and the professional society that educate employ regulate and mold the practitioner contributes to the nonprofessional status of the computing practitioner the role of these institution are examined various shortcoming are noted and recommended change are suggested in the last analysis professional status is not bestowed it is earned however university and industry specifically can make certain improvement to help the computing practitioner achieve professional status |
2811|structural pattern recognition of carotid pulse wave using general waveform parsing system general waveform parsing system with application to structural pattern recognition of carotid pulse wave is described the carotid arterial pulse wave is of medical importance because of variation in it structure induced by arterial aging and cardiovascular disease the syntax driven waveform analysis system been applied with good result to these pulse wave to detect and measure structural variation the waveform parsing system is modeled on compiler compiler system and allows the user to enter application specific information data it is thus general enough to be applicable to other waveform |

2815|high level binding with low level linkers an easy to implement scheme is described by which compiler can enforce agreement between complex data type in separately compiled module the scheme is designed to work with any existing link editor or linking loader matter how deficient obscure run time error caused by inconsistent usage are forestalled by static error detected at linking time |
2816|optimal reorganization of distributed space disk file in most database organization the cost of accessing the database will increase due to structural change caused by update and insertion by reorganizing the database the access cost can be reduced basic problem is to establish the proper tradeoff between performance storage cost and reorganization cost this paper considers the optimum point at which to reorganize database disk file organization which allows for distributed free space is described cost function describing the excess cost due to physical disorganization is defined and this function is minimized to obtain the optimum reorganization point numerical example based on the characteristic of existing disk storage device are given |
2817|the notion of consistency and predicate lock in database system in database system user access shared data under the assumption that the data satisfies certain consistency constraint this paper defines the concept of transaction consistency and schedule and show that consistency requires that transaction cannot request new lock after releasing lock then it is argued that transaction need to lock logical rather than physical subset of the database these subset may be specified by predicate an implementation of predicate lock which satisfies the consistency condition is suggested |

2820|the design and implementation of table driven interactive diagnostic programming system cap is highly interactive diagnostic compilerinterpreter that allows beginning programmer to prepare debug and execute fairly simple program at graphic display terminal complete syntax checking and most semantic analysis is performed the program is entered and it is subsequently edited analysis is performed character by character the most remarkable feature of cap is it ability to automatically diagnose error both at compile time and at run time error are not automatically corrected instead cap interacts with the student to help him find the cause of his error most component of cap are table driven both to reduce the space needed for implementation and to increase the flexibility of the multilingual system over student have used cap to learn fortran pli or cobolin conjunction with computer assisted course on introductory computer science |

2826|interactive skeleton technique for enhancing motion dynamic in key frame animation significant increase in the capability for controlling motion dynamic in key frame animation is achieved through skeleton control this technique allows an animator to develop complex motion sequence by animating stick figure representation of an image this control sequence is then used to drive an image sequence through the same movement the simplicity of the stick figure image encourages high level of interaction during the design stage it compatibility with the basic key frame animation technique permit skeleton control to be applied selectively to only those component of composite image sequence that require enhancement |
2827|parametric algorithm for drawing picture of solid object composed of quadric surface an algorithm for drawing picture of three dimensional object with surface made up of patch of quadric surface is described the emphasis of this algorithm is on calculating the intersection of quadric surface parameterization scheme is used each quadric surface intersection curve qsic is represented set of coefficient and parameter limit each value of the parameter represents at most two point and these may easily be distinguished this scheme can find the coordinate of point of even quartic fourth order intersection curve using equation of more than second order method of parameterization for each type of osic are discussed well surface bounding and hidden surface removal |
2828|hierarchical geometric model for visible surface algorithm the geometric structure inherent in the definition of the shape of three dimensional object and environment is used not just to define their relative motion and placement but also to assist in solving many other problem of system for producing picture by computer by using an extension of traditional structure information or geometric hierarchy five significant improvement to current technique are possible first the range of complexity of an environment is greatly increased while the visible complexity of any given scene is kept within fixed upper limit second meaningful way is provided to vary the amount of detail presented in scene third clipping becomes very fast logarithmic search for the resolvable part of the environment within the field of view fourth frame to frame coherence and clipping define graphical working set or fraction of the total structure that should be present in primary store for immediate access by the visible surface algorithm finally the geometric structure suggests recursive descent visible surface algorithm in which the computation time potentially grows linearly with the visible complexity of the scene |
2829|texture and reflection in computer generated image in catmull developed new algorithm for rendering image of bivariate surface patch this paper describes extension of this algorithm in the area of texture simulation and lighting model the parameterization of patch defines coordinate system which is used key for mapping pattern onto the surface the intensity of the pattern at each picture element is computed weighted average of region of the pattern definition function the shape and size of this weighting function are chosen using digital signal processing theory the patch rendering algorithm allows accurate computation of the surface normal to the patch at each picture element permitting the simulation of the mirror reflection the amount of light coming from given direction is modeled in similar manner to the texture mapping and then added to the intensity obtained from the texture mapping several example of image synthesized using these new technique are included |

2832|faster retrieval from context tree corrigendum context tree provide convenient way of storing data which is to be viewed hierarchy of context this note present an algorithm which improves on previous context tree retrieval algorithm it is based on the observation that in typical us context change are infrequent relative to retrieval so that data can be cached to speed up retrieval retrieval is started from the position of the previous retrieval and auxiliary structure are built up to make the search rapid algorithm for addition and deletion of data and for garbage collection are outlined |
2833|an efficient incremental automatic garbage collector this paper describes new way of solving the storage reclamation problem for system such lisp that allocates storage automatically from heap and doe not require the programmer to give any indication that particular item are longer useful or accessible reference count scheme for reclaiming non self referential structure and linearizing compacting copying scheme to reorganize all storage at the user discretion are proposed the algorithm are designed to work well in system which use multiple level of storage and large virtual address space they depend on the fact that most cell are referenced exactly once and that reference count need only be accurate when storage is about to be reclaimed transaction file store change to reference count and multiple reference table store the count for item which are referenced more than once |

2837|new upper bound for selection the worst case minimum number of comparison complexity vin of the i th selection problem is considered new upper bound for vin improves the bound given by the standard hadian sobel algorithm by generalization of the kirkpatrick hadian sobel algorithm and extends kirkpatricks method to much wider range of application this generalization compare favorably with recent algorithm by hyafil |
2838|analysis of an algorithm for real time garbage collection real time garbage collection system avoids suspending the operation of list processor for the long time that garbage collection normally requires by performing garbage collection on second processor in parallel with list processing operation or on single processor time shared with them algorithm for recovering discarded list structure in this manner are presented and analyzed to determine sufficient condition under which the list processor never need to wait on the collector these technique are shown to require at most twice much processing power regular garbage collector if they are used efficiently the average behavior of the program is shown to be very nearly equal to the worst case performance so that the sufficient condition are also suitable for measuring the typical behavior of the algorithm |
2839|an insertion technique for one sided height balanced tree restriction on height balanced binary tree is presented it is seen that this restriction reduces the extra memory requirement by half from two extra bit per node to one and maintains fast search capability at cost of increased time requirement for inserting new node |
2840|protection in operating system model of protection mechanism in computing system is presented and it appropriateness is argued the safety problem for protection system under this model is to determine in given situation whether subject can acquire particular right to an object in restricted case it can be shown that this problem is decidable ie there is an algorithm to determine whether system in particular configuration is safe in general and under surprisingly weak assumption it cannot be decided if situation is safe various implication of this fact are discussed |

2846|compressed try this paper present new data structure called compressed trie or c trie to be used in information retrieval system it the same underlying m ary tree structure trie where m is parameter of the trie but whereas the field of the node in trie have to be large enough to hold key or at least pointer the field in c trie are only one bit long in the analysis part of the paper it will be shown that for collection of n key the retrieval time measured in term of bit inspection of one key is of the order logmn and the storage requirement of the order nmlog n bit this improvement in storage requirement and retrieval time is achieved at the cost of decreasing the flexibility of the structure and therefore updating cost are increased first the c trie is analyzed data structure and then several method of it use for relatively static database are discussed |
2847|sampling from the gamma distribution on computer this paper describes method of generating gamma variate that appears to be costly than wallace recently suggested method for large shape parameter the cost of computation is proportional to whereas wallace method is proportional to experimentation by robinson and lewis indicates that for small the method suggested here also dominates method recently suggested by dieter and ahrens albeit those method dominate for large the method suggested here us the rejection technique |
2848|synthesis of decision rule decision table can be used an effective tool during an interview to record the logic of process to be automated the result of such an interview is not structure of complete decision table but rather set of decision rule the purpose of this paper is to provide procedure for synthesizing the decision rule and thus provide an aid in developing structure of complete decision table |
2849|ethernet distributed packet switching for local computer network ethernet is branching broadcast communication system for carrying digital data packet among locally distributed computing station the packet transport mechanism provided by ethernet been used to build system which can be viewed either local computer network or loosely coupled multiprocessor an ethernet shared communication facility it ether is passive broadcast medium with central control coordination of access to the ether for packet broadcast is distributed among the contending transmitting station using controlled statistical arbitration switching of packet to their destination on the ether is distributed among the receiving station using packet address recognition design principle and implementation are described based on experience with an operating ethernet of node along kilometer of coaxial cable model for estimating performance under heavy load and packet protocol for error controlled communication are included for completeness |
2850|symbolic execution and program testing this paper describes the symbolic execution of program instead of supplying the normal input to program eg number one supply symbol representing arbitrary value the execution proceeds in normal execution except that value may be symbolic formula over the input symbol the difficult yet interesting issue arise during the symbolic execution of conditional branch type statement particular system called effigy which provides symbolic execution for program testing and debugging is also described it interpretively executes program written in simple pli style programming language it includes many standard debugging feature the ability to manage and to prove thing about symbolic expression simple program testing manager and program verifier brief discussion of the relationship between symbolic execution and program proving is also included |
2851|formal verification of parallel program two formal model for parallel computation are presented an abstract conceptual model and parallel program model the former model doe not distinguish between control and data state the latter model includes the capability for the representation of an infinite set of control state by allowing there to be arbitrarily many instruction pointer or process executing the program an induction principle is presented which treat the control and data state set on the same ground through the use of place variable it is observed that certain correctness condition can be expressed without enumeration of the set of all possible control state example are presented in which the induction principle is used to demonstrate proof of mutual exclusion it is shown that assertion oriented proof method are special case of the induction principle special case of the assertion method which is called parallel place assertion is shown to be incomplete formalization of deadlock is then presented the concept of norm is introduced which yield an extension to the deadlock problem of floyds technique for proving termination also discussed is an extension of the program model which allows each process to have it own local variable and permit shared global variable correctness of certain form of implementation is also discussed an appendix is included which relates this work to previous work on the satisfiability of certain logical formula |

2855|an efficient list moving algorithm using constant workspace an efficient algorithm is presented for moving arbitrary list structure using storage apart from program variable other than that required to hold the original list and the copy the original list is destroyed it is moved mark bit are necessary but pointer to the copy must be distinguishable from pointer to the original the algorithm is superior in execution speed to previous algorithm for the same problem some variation and extension of the algorithm are discussed |
2856|the synthetic approach to decision table conversion previous approach to the problem of automatically converting decision table to computer program have been based on decomposition at any stage one condition is selected for testing and two smaller problem decision table with one condition are created an optimal program with respect to average execution time or storage space for example is located only through implicit enumeration of all possible decision tree using technique such branch and bound the new approach described in this paper us dynamic programming to synthesize an optimal decision tree from which program can be created using this approach the efficiency of creating an optimal program is increased substantially permitting generation of optimal program for decision table with many ten to twelve condition |
2857|referencing list by an edge an edge reference into list structure is pair of pointer to adjacent node such reference often requires little additional space but it use can yield efficient algorithm for instance circular link between the end of list is redundant if the list is always referenced by that edge and list traversal is easier when that link is null edge reference also allow threading of nonrecursive list can replace some header cell and enhance the famous exclusive or trick to double link list |
2858|process for the determination of address in variable length addressing an algorithm is presented for the assignment of instruction address and format under the following condition the length of the instruction varies function of the distance of the instruction from it target there exists an optimality criterion which implies some preferential choice subject to the addressing constraint this may be for example achieving the smallest number of long instruction in which case the total code length is minimized or minimizing the assigned address of specified point in the program the algorithm is suitable for arbitrary program structure and choice of optimization criterion |
2859|interference in multiprocessor computer system with interleaved memory this paper analyzes the memory interference caused by several processor simultaneously using several memory module exect result are computed for simple model of such system the limiting value is derived for the relative degree of memory interference the system size increase the model of the limiting behavior of the system yield approximate result for the simple model and also suggests that the result are valid for much larger class of model including those more nearly like real system that the simple model are tested against some measurement of program behavior and simulation of system using memory reference from real program the model result provide good indication of the performance that should be expected from real system of this type |
2860|practitioner guide to addressing algorithm this paper consolidates number of popular rule of thumb which have been suggested for the design of record addressing algorithm and discus the applicability of these rule to large commercial database guideline for selecting identifier transformation overflow technique loading factor bucket size and loading order and considered particular attention is focused on the reasonableness of common heuristic for determining primary or secondary bucket size mathematical model which explicitly considers storage device characteristic and timespace cost tradeoff is used to analyze the effect of design parameter on overall system cost specific design example is presented and solved |

2862|analysis of the pff replacement algorithm via semi markov model an analytical model is presented to estimate the performance of the page fault frequency pff replacement algorithm in this model program behavior is represented by the lru stack distance model and the pff replacement algorithm is represented by semi markov model using these model such parameter the inter page fault interval distribution the probability of the number of distinct page being referenced during an inter page fault interval etc are able to be analytically determined using these model to evaluate these parameter value permit study of the performance of the replacement algorithm by simulating the page fault event rather than every page reference event this significantly reduces the required computation time in estimating the performance of the pff algorithm |
2863|vmin an optimal variable space page replacement algorithm criterion for comparing variable space page replacement algorithm is presented an optimum page replacement algorithm called vmin is described and shown to be optimum with respect to this criterion the result of simulating vmin dennings working set and the page partitioning replacement algorithm on five virtual memory program are presented to demonstrate the improvement possible over the known realizable variable space algorithm |
2864|characteristic of program locality the term locality been used to denote that subset of program segment which are referenced during particular phase of it execution program behavior can be characterized in term of it residence in locality of various size and lifetime and the transition between these locality in this paper the concept of locality is made more explicit through formal definition of what constitutes phase of localized reference behavior and by corresponding mechanism for the detection of locality in actual reference string this definition provides for the existence of hierarchy of locality at any given time and the reasonableness of the definition is supported by example taken from actual program empirical data from sample of production algol program is used to display distribution of locality size and lifetime and these result are discussed in term of their implication for the modeling of program behavior and memory management in virtual memory system |
2865|verifying property of parallel program an axiomatic approach an axiomatic method for proving number of property of parallel program is presented hoare given set of axiom for partial correctness but they are not strong enough in most case this paper defines more powerful deductive system which is in some sense complete for partial correctness crucial axiom provides for the use of auxiliary variable which are added to parallel program an aid to proving it correct the information in partial correctness proof can be used to prove such property mutual exclusion freedom from deadlock and program termination technique for verifying these property are presented and illustrated by application to the dining philosopher problem |
2866|proving monitor interesting scheduling and sequential property of monitor can be proved by using state variable which record the monitor history and by defining extended proof rule for their wait and signal operation these two technique are defined discussed and applied to example to prove property such freedom from indefinitely repeated overtaking or unnecessary waiting upper bound on queue length and historical behavior |
2867|modularization and hierarchy in family of operating system this paper describes the design philosophy used in the construction of family of operating system it is shown that the concept of module and level do not coincide in hierarchy of function family member can share much software result of the implementation of run time module at the lowest system level |
2868|reflection on an operating system design the main feature of general purpose multiaccess operating system developed for the cdc at berkeley are presented and it good and bad point are discussed they appear in retrospect distinctive feature of the design were the use of capability for protection and the organization of the system into sequence of layer each building on the facility provided by earlier one and protecting itself from the malfunction of later one there were serious problem in maintaining the protection between layer when level were added to the memory hierarchy these problem are discussed and new solution is described |
2869|security kernel validation in practice security kernel is software and hardware mechanism that enforces access control within computer system the correctness of security kernel on pdp is being proved this paper describes the technique used to carry out the first step of the proof validating formal specification of the program with respect to axiom for secure system |
2870|lattice model of secure information flow this paper investigates mechanism that guarantee secure information flow in computer system these mechanism are examined within mathematical framework suitable for formulating the requirement of secure information flow among security class the central component of the model is lattice structure derived from the security class and justified by the semantics of information flow the lattice property permit concise formulation of the security requirement of different existing system and facilitate the construction of mechanism that enforce security the model provides unifying view of all system that restrict information flow enables classification of them according to security objective and suggests some new approach it also lead to the construction of automatic program certification mechanism for verifying the secure flow of information through program |
2871|logical analysis of program most present system for verification of computer program are incomplete in that intermediate inductive assertion must be provided manually by the user termination is not proven and incorrect program are not treated unified solution to these problem this paper suggests conducting logical analysis of program by using invariant which express what is actually occurring in the program the first part of the paper is devoted to technique for the automatic generation of invariant the second part provides criterion for using the invariant to check simultaneously for correctness including termination or incorrectness third part examines the implication of the approach for the automatic diagnosis and correction of logical error |

2875|development of an international system for legal protection of computer program |
2876|intentional resolution of privacy protection in database system traditionally privacy protection in database system is understood to be the control over what information given user can get from database this paper is concerned with another independent dimension of privacy protection the control over what user is allowed to do with piece of information supplied to him by the database the ability to condition the supply of information on it intended use is called here intentional resolution of privacy protection the practical importance of intentional resolution is demonstrated by several example and it realization is discussed it is shown that intentional resolution can be achieved but that it involves radical change from the traditional approach to the process of user database interaction in particular it appears to be necessary for the database to impose certain amount of control over the internal behavior of user program which interact with it model for user database interaction which admits such control is developed |
2877|program data flow analysis procedure the global data relationship in program can be exposed and codified by the static analysis method described in this paper procedure is given which determines all the definition which can possibly reach each node of the control flow graph of the program and all the definition that are live on each edge of the graph the procedure us an interval ordered edge listing data structure and handle reducible and irreducible graph indistinguishably |
2878|joining policy in multipriority multiclass batch computer system consider multipriority batch computer system which user from several different class may join it toll service and waiting charge such system is formulated here semi markov decision process in which the aim of arriving user is to minimize their expected loss the optimal joining policy is one of arriving user who may join the system at some of it queue is control limit policy with single control number for any possible queue and the user class newly arriving user will join queue that is not filled up to the control number corresponding to this queue and the user class in this paper control number well lower and upper bound for the control number and the capacity of the system queue are derived |

2880|fast division technique for constant divisor fast algorithm for division by constant divisor is presented the method proved very useful implemented microcode ona binary machine and can be adapted directly into hardware the mathematical foundation of the algorithm are presented well some performance measure |
2881|counterintuitive example of computer paging counterexample is exhibited to natural conjecture concerning the optimal way to group record into page in the independent reference model of computer paging an organization is said to be optimal if the least recently used miss ratio is minimized |
2882|stochastic evaluation model for database organization in data retrieval system experimental work in the valuation of large scale data retrieval system been scarce due to it difficulty and prohibitive cost this paper discus simulation model of data retrieval system which the effect of significantly reducing the cost of experimentation and enabling research never attempted before the model is designed to estimate the retrieval workload of alternative data retrieval system these data retrieval system can be organized under several database organization including inverted list threaded list and cellular list organization and hybrid combination of these system effectiveness of the methodology is demonstrated by using the model to study the effect of database organization in data retrieval system in particular the impact of query complexity is analyzed |
2883|an application of heuristic search method to edge and contour detection this paper present method for detecting edge and contour in noisy picture the property of an edge are embedded in figure of merit and the edge detection problem becomes the problem of minimizing the given figure of merit this problem can be represented shortest path problem on graph and can be solved using well known graph search algorithm the relation between this representation of the minimization problem and dynamic programming approach are discussed showing that the graph search method can lead to substantial improvement in computing time moreover if heuristic search method are used the computing time will depend on the amount of noise in the picture some experimental result are given these show how various information about the shape of the contour of an object can be embedded in the figure of merit thus allowing the extraction of contour from noisy picture and the separation of touching object |
2884|permutation enumeration four new permutation algorithm classical permutation enumeration algorithm encounter special case requiring additional computation every nth permutation when generating the n permutation on n mark four new algorithm have the attribute that special case occur every nn permutation two of the algorithm produce the next permutation with single exchange of two mark the other two algorithm infrequently exchange more than two mark but the rule for generating the next permutation are very simple performance test which have counted execution of assignment statement comparison arithmetic operation and subscripted array reference have shown superiority of the new algorithm compared to boothroyds implementation of m b well algorithm and ehrlich implementation of the johnson trotter algorithm |
2885|on self organizing sequential search heuristic this paper examines class of heuristic for maintaining sequential list in approximately optimal order with respect to the average time required to search for specified element assuming that each element is searched for with fixed probability independent of previous search performed the move to front and transposition heuristic are shown to be optimal to within constant factor and the transposition rule is shown to be the more efficient of the two empirical evidence suggests that transposition is in fact optimal for any distribution of search probability |
2886|semantic evaluation from left to right this paper describes attribute grammar and their use for the definition of programming language and compiler formal definition of attribute grammar and discussion of some of it important aspect are included the paper concentrate on the evaluation of semantic attribute in few pass from left to right over the derivation tree of program condition for an attribute grammar is given which assures that the semantics of any program can be evaluated in single pas over the derivation tree and an algorithm is discussed which decides how many pass from left to right are in general necessary given the attribute grammar these notion are explained in term of an example grammar which describes the scope rule of algol practical question such the relative efficiency of different evaluation scheme and the ease of adapting the attribute grammar of given programming language to the left to right evaluation scheme are discussed |
2887|study of error error proneness and error diagnosis in cobol this paper provides data on cobol error frequency for correction of error in student oriented compiler improvement of teaching and change in programming language cobol wa studied because of economic importance widespread usage possible error including design and lack of research the type of error were identified in pilot study then using the error type found error were classified in run of cobol student error density wa high percent of the type contained percent of the total frequency which implies high potential effectiveness for software based correction of cobol surprisingly only four high frequency error were error prone which implies minimal error inducing design percent of cobol misspelling were classifiable in the four error category of previous researcher which implies that cobol misspelling are correctable by existent algorithm reserved word usage wa not error prone which implies minimal interference with usage of reserved word over percent of error diagnosis wa found to be inaccurate such feedback is not optimal for user particularly for the learning user of cobol |
2888|information reference coding item in business system have to be identified by reference code which can later be used data code and file key in an associated data processing system in business system associated with large collection of integrated file database it is vital to assign code in methodical way so to control future extension and change while maintaining correct program action the principle of methodical coding are discussed and the way in which logical connection between data item must be reflected in the reference code framework is shown through set theoretic information model |
2889|performance of height balanced tree this paper present the result of simulation that investigate the performance of height balanced hbk tree it is shown that the only statistic of hb tree avl tree that is function of the size of the tree is the time to search for an item in the tree for sufficiently large tree the execution time of all procedure for maintaining hb tree are independent of the size of the tree in particular an average of restructures are required per insertion with an average of node revisited to restore the hb property an average of restructures are required per deletion with an average of node revisited to restore the hb property moreover the execution time of procedure for maintaining hbk tree for k are also independent of the size of the tree except for the average number of node revisited on delete operation in order to restore the hbk property on trace back the cost of maintaining hbk tree drop sharply the allowable imbalance k increase both analytical and experimental result that show the cost of maintaining hbk tree function of k are discussed |
2890|on quadratic adaptive routing algorithm two analytic model of store and forward communication network are constructed one to find the optimal message routing and the other to illustrate the equilibrium stationary state maintained by an adaptive routing algorithm these model show that adaptive routing doe not satisfy the necessary condition for an optimal routing adaptive routing tends to overuse the direct path and underuse alternate route because it doe not consider the impact of it current routing decision on the future state of the network the form of the optimality condition suggests that modification of the adaptive algorithm will result in optimality the modification requires the substitution of quadratic bias term instead of linear one in the routing table maintained at each network node simulation result are presented which confirm the theoretical analysis for simple network |
2891|an anomaly in disk scheduling comparison of fcfs and sstf seek scheduling using an empirical model for disk access model for disk access based on published measurement is developed the model is used to show that under highly probable condition fcfs seek scheduling is superior to sstf scheduling in the sense of having lower mean queue length simple example of an arrival sequence illustration this anomaly is presented |
2892|study of line overhead in the arpanet the form extent and effect of the communication line overhead in the arpanet are considered the source of this over head is separated into various level of protocol hierarchy and the characteristic of each level are summarized then the line efficiency for various model of system use is studied some measurement of line efficiency for the arpanet are presented and by extrapolation these measurement are used to anticipate overhead in heavily loaded network similar result are derived for recently proposed network protocol and compared with those for the current system |
2893|computer an innovation in american local government computer and electronic data processing are major technological innovation in the operation of american local government this paper establishes that there is substantial variation among the larger local government in the rate at which they adopt computer technology in the level of financial support they provide for edp and in the extensiveness and sophistication of their automated application the central question addressed is what might explain the difference between government in the extent to which they adopt and use computer hypothesis are tested for several stream of explanatory factor using data from more than city and county government the finding identify certain local government milieu which are particularly conducive to higher level of computer innovation somewhat unexpected finding reveal the significant impact of the distribution of control over edp decision and the dominant political value within the government other important factor include the measured need for computer application and the presence of external funding support for computing finally the paper suggests framework for identifying the key determinant of other technological innovation |
