2897|case study of new code generation technique for compiler recent development in optimizing technique have allowed new design for compiler to emerge such compiler translates the parsed source code into lower level code by sequence of step each step expands higher level statement into block of lower level code and then performs optimization on the result each statement only one possible expansion the task of tailoring this code to take advantage of any special case is done by the optimization this paper provides evidence that this strategy can indeed result in good object code the traditionally difficult pli concatenate statement wa investigated detailed example set of fairly simple optimization wa identified which allow the compiler to produce good code more elaborate optimization can further improve the object code for most context of the concatenate statement the code produced by compiler using the expansion optimization strategy described above compare favorably with the code produced by conventional pli optimizing compiler |

2901|an encoding method for multifield sorting and indexing sequence of character string with an order relation imposed between sequence are considered an encoding scheme is described which produce single order preserving string from sequence of string the original sequence can be recovered from the encoded string and one sequence of string precedes another if and only if the encoding of the first precedes the encoding of the second the string may be variable length without maximum length restriction and symbol need be reserved for control purpose hence any symbol may occur in any string the scheme is useful for multifield sorting multifield indexing and other application where ordering on more than one field is important |
2902|dynamic memory allocation in computer simulation this paper investigates the performance of dynamic memory allocation algorithm when used to service simulation program represented by test case algorithm performance wa measured in term of processing time memory usage and external memory fragmentation algorithm main taining separate free space list for each size of memory block used tended to perform quite well compared with other algorithm simple algorithm operating on memory ordered list without any free list performed surprisingly well algorithm employing power of two block size had favorable processing requirement but generally unfavorable memory usage algorithm employing lifo fifo or memory ordered free list generally performed poorly compared with others |
2903|improving program by the introduction of recursion new technique of program transformation called recursion in troduction is described and applied to two algorithm which solve pattern matching problem by using recursion in troduction algorithm which manipulate stack are first translated into recursive algorithm in which stack operation occur these algorithm are then subjected to second transformation method of recursion elimination called tabulation to produce program with very efficient running time in particular it is shown how the fast linear pattern matching algorithm of knuth morris and pratt can be derived in few step from simple nonlinear stack algorithm |

2905|perfect hashing function single probe retrieving method for static set refinement of hashing which allows retrieval of an item in static table with single probe is considered given set i of identifier two method are presented for building in mechanical way perfect hashing function ie function transforming the element of i into unique address the first method the quotient reduction method is shown to be complete in the sense that for every set i the smallest table in which the element of i can be stored and from which they can be retrieved by using perfect hashing function constructed by this method can be found however for nonuniformly distributed set this method can give rather sparse table the second method the remainder reduction method is not complete in the above sense but it seems to give minimal or almost minimal table for every kind of set the two technique are applicable directly to small set some method to extend these result to larger set are also presented rough comparison with ordinary hashing is given which show that this method can be used conveniently in several practical application |

2911|anomalous behavior of the fifty percent rule in dynamic memory allocation this paper report simulation data showing that in dynamic memory allocation the average free to allocated block ratio can differ considerably and in both direction from the prediction of the percent rule new derivation is given and it is shown that previous derivation make an assumption that may be violated frequently on the basis of the simulation data and the derivation it is hypothesized that the anomalous behavior result from the combined effect of systematic placement and the statistic of the release process additional simulation support this hypothesis systematic placement which refers to the natural convention of always allocating storage request against the same end of the free block selected by the allocation strategy tends to order block within contiguous group according to their allocation time the degree of anomalous behavior depends on the extent to which allocated block are released in the order of their allocation for non markovian release process the extent of the correlation between allocation order and release order varies approximately inversely with the coefficient of variation of the memory residence time distribution the simulation show that allocation efficiency depends strongly on the residence time distribution efficiency decrease the distribution coefficient of variation increase some practical implication are briefly discussed |
2912|concurrent reading and writing the problem of sharing data among asynchronous process is considered it is assumed that only one process at time can modify the data but concurrent reading and writing is permitted two general theorem are proved and some algorithm are presented to illustrate their use these include solution to the general problem in which read is repeated if it might have obtained an incorrect result and two technique for transmitting message between process these solution do not assume any synchronizing mechanism other than data which can be written by one process and read by other process |

2916|fast string searching algorithm an algorithm is presented that search for the location i of the first occurrence of character string pat in another string string during the search operation the character of pat are matched starting with the last character of pat the information gained by starting the match at the end of the pattern often allows the algorithm to proceed in large jump through the text being searched thus the algorithm the unusual property that in most case not all of the first i character of string are inspected the number of character actually inspected on the average decrease function of the length of pat for random english pattern of length the algorithm will typically inspect i character of string before finding match at i furthermore the algorithm been implemented so that on the average fewer than ipatlen machine instruction are executed these conclusion are supported with empirical evidence and theoretical analysis of the average behavior of the algorithm the worst case behavior of the algorithm is linear in ipatlen assuming the availability of array space for table linear in patlen plus the size of the alphabet |

2919|the programmer workbench machine for software development on almost all software development project the assumption is made that the program development function will be done on the same machine on which the eventual system will run it is only when this production machine is unavailable or when it programming environment is totally inadequate that alternative are considered in this paper it is suggested that there are many other situation where it would be advantageous to separate the program development and main tenance function onto specialized computer which is dedicated to that purpose such computer is here called programmer workbench the four basic section of the paper in troduce the subject outline the general concept discus area where such an approach may prove beneficial and describe an operational system utilizing this concept |
2920|game interpretation of the deadlock avoidance problem the deadlock avoidance problem may be defined informally the determination from some priori information about the process resource operating system etc of the safe situation which may be realized without endangering the smooth running of the system when each process specifies it future need by flowchart of need defined step global approach to the phenomenon and it in terpretation game between the operating system and the process allows formalization of risk and safety concept the bipartite graph representation of this game may then be used to construct explicitly the set of safe state and to study their property |
2921|regular right part grammar and their parser this paper in troduces an alternative to context free grammar called regular right part rrp grammar which resemble pascal syntax diagram formally rrp grammar have production right part which are nondeterministic finite state machine fsms and special case regular expression since these can be converted to fsms rrp grammar describe the syntax of programming language more concisely and more understandably than is possible with cf grammar also in troduced is class of parser rrp lrm k parser which includes the cf lrk parser and provides the same advantage informally an rrp lrm k parser can determine the right end of each handle by considering at most k symbol to the right of the handle and the left end after the right end been found by considering at most m symbol to the left of the handle mechanism for determining the left end is required because there is bound on the length of the handle |
2922|two level control structure for nondeterministic programming the basic idea of nondeterministic programming are critically reconsidered to single out proper attitude and programming style for language allowing direct control of nondeterministic feature the proposed attitude aim at retaining the purity of the nondeterministic formulation of search process on one level the attempt level deferring the coordination of problem solving effort to another the choice level the feasibility of recognizing these two level is discussed stressing that the structure to be managed at the choice level is free of context the leaf are computational environment each holding an alternative under inspection while the other node are associated with choice poin t according to the proposed programming style generative function is associated with each choice poin t which express the desired choice strategy the main advantage on this approach is the localization of the search strategy each nonterminal node of the tree keep track of the state of the computation it wa when the choice poin t wa last interrogated holding at the same time the strategy to coordinate the available alternative example are given in term of nd lisp an extension of lisp designed and implemented according to these guideline |
2923|high level data flow analysis in contrast to the predominant use of low level in termediate text high level data flow analysis deal with program essentially at source level and exploit the control flow information implicit in the parse tree the need for high level flow analysis arises from several aspect of recent work on advanced method of program certification and optimization this paper proposes simple general method of high level data flow analysis that allows free use of escape and jump statement avoids large graph when compiling large program facilitates updating of data flow information to reflect program change and derives new global information helpful in solving many familiar global flow analysis problem an illustrative application to live variable analysis is presented many of the graph involved are constructed and analyzed before any program are compiled thus avoiding certain cost that low level method incur repeatedly at compile time |

method of logic have significance in the other direction for the more applied part of computability theory programming language offer an obvious opportunity their syntactic formalization is well advanced however the semantical theory can hardly be said to be complete though we have many example we have still to give wide ranging mathematical answer to these query what is machine what is computable process how or how well doe machine simulate process program naturally enter in giving description of process the definition of the precise meaning of program then requires u to explain what are the object of computation in way the static of the problem and how they are to be transformed the dynamic so far the theory of automaton and of net though most in teresting for dynamic have exact if we can find the right abstraction to represent the necessary structure the experience of many independent worker with the method of data type lattice or partial ordering under an information 2981|subgoal induction proof method subgoal induction is presented an alternative or supplement to the commonly used inductive assertion method it major virtue is that it can often be used to prove loop correctness directly from it input output specification without the use of an invariant the relation between subgoal induction and other commonly used induction rule is explored and in particular it is shown that subgoal induction can be viewed specialized form of computation induction set of sufficient condition are presented which guarantee that an input output specification is strong enough for the induction step of proof by subgoal induction to be valid |

3002|record and file partitioning model one of the main objective in the design of file system is the reduction of storage and data transfer cost this paper present model in which several request access the file system and each request requires information from one or more variable length data item the probability of access and the distribution of each data item length are assumed to be known and to be mutually independent the file system us one or more storage device and each record may be partitioned into subrecords that are stored on different device one of the subrecords is designated the primary record when request for record is made the primary record is first accessed and other subrecords are accessed only if the pertinent information is not stored in the primary record the model that is presented in this paper both nonlinear programming model and mixed integer programming model is very general one several type of file system may be derived from it by an appropriate selection of it parameter this model already been used in the optimization of library routine storage at large scale operating system |

3008|preserving average proximity in array programmer and data structure designer are often forced to choose between alternative structure in storing these structure preserving logical adjacency or proximity is usually an important consideration the combinatorial problem of storing array various kind of list structure is examined embeddings of graph are used to model the loss of proximity involved in such storage scheme and an elementary proof that array cannot be stored linear list with bounded loss of proximity is presented average loss of proximity is then considered and it is shown that array cannot be stored linear list with only bounded loss of average proximity but can be so stored in binary tree the former result implies for instance that row major order is an asymptotically optimal storage strategy for array |

3013|some new method of detecting step edge in digital picture this note describes two operator that respond to step edge but not to ramp the first is similar to the digital laplacian but us the max rather than the sum of the x and second difference the second us the difference between the mean and median gray level in neighborhood the output obtained from these operator applied to set of test picture are compared with each other and with the standard digital laplacian and gradient third operator which us the distance between the center and centroid of neighborhood an edge value is also briefly considered it turn out to be equivalent to one of the standard digital approximation to the gradient |
3014|is sometime sometimes better than always intermittent assertion in proving program correctness this paper explores technique for proving the correctness and termination of program simultaneously this approach the intermittent assertion method involves documenting the program with assertion that must be true at some time when control pass through the corresponding point but that need not be true every time the method introduced by burstall promise to provide valuable complement to the more conventional method the intermittent assertion method is presented with number of example of correctness and termination proof some of these proof are markedly simpler than their conventional counterpart on the other hand it is shown that proof of correctness or termination by any of the conventional technique can be rephrased directly proof using intermittent assertion finally it is shown how the intermittent assertion method can be applied to prove the validity of program transformation and the correctness of continuously operating program |
3015|relaxation method for image reconstruction the problem of recovering an image function of two variable from experimentally available integral of it grayness over thin strip is of great importance in large number of scientific area an important version of the problem in medicine is that of obtaining the exact density distribution within the human body from x ray projectionsone approach that been taken to solve this problem consists of translating the available information into system of linear inequality the size and the sparsity of the resulting system typically inequality with fewer than percent of the coefficient nonzero make method using successive relaxation computationally attractive compared to other way of solving system of inequality in this paper it is shown that for consistent system of linear inequality any sequence of relaxarion parameter lying strictly between and generates sequence of vector which converges to solution under the same assumption for system of linear equation the relaxation method converges to the minimum norm solution previously proposed technique are shown to be special case of our procedure with different choice of relaxation parameter the practical consequence for image reconstruction of the choice of the relaxation parameter are discussed |

3018|covering edge by clique with regard to keyword conflict and intersection graph kellerman presented method for determining keyword conflict and described heuristic algorithm which solves certain combinatorial optimization problem in connection with this method this optimization problem is here shown to be equivalent to the problem of covering the edge of graph by complete subgraphs with the objective of minimizing the number of complete subgraphs relationship between this edge clique cover problem and the graph coloring problem is established which allows algorithm for either one of these problem to be constructed from algorithm for the other consequence of this relationship the keyword conflict problem and the edge clique cover problem are shown to be np complete and if pnp then they do not admit polynomial time approximation algorithm which always produce solution within factor than from the optimum |

3021|method for obtaining digital signature and public key cryptosystems an encryption method is presented with the novel property that publicly revealing an encryption key doe not thereby reveal the corresponding decryption key this two important consequence courier or other secure mean are not needed to transmit key since message can be enciphered using an encryption key publicly revealed by the intended recipient only can decipher the message since only know the corresponding decryption key message can be signed using privately held decryption key anyone can verify this signature using the corresponding publicly revealed encryption key signature cannot be forged and signer cannot later deny the validity of his signature this obvious application in electronic mail and electronic fund transfer system message is encrypted by representing it number m raising m to publicly specified power and then taking the remainder when the result is divided by the publicly specified product n of two large secret prime number p and q decryption is similaronly different secret power d is used where d modp q the security of the system rest in part on the difficulty of factoring the published divisor n |

3030|an example of hierarchical design and proof hierarchical programming is being increasingly recognized helpful in the construction of large program user of hierarchical technique claim or predict substantial increase in productivity and in the reliability of the program produced in this paper we describe formal method for hierarchical program specification implementation and proof we apply this method to significant list processing problem and also discus number of extension to current programming language that ease hierarchical program design and proof |
3031|abstract data type and software validation data abstraction can be naturally specified using algebraic axiom the virtue of these axiom is that they permit representation independent formal specification of data type an example is given which show how to employ algebraic axiom at successive level of implementation the major thrust of the paper is twofold first it is shown how the use of algebraic axiomatizations can simplify the process of proving the correctness of an implementation of an abstract data type second semi automatic tool are described which can be used both to automate such proof of correctness and to derive an immediate implementation from the axiom this implementation allows for limited testing of program at design time before conventional implementation is accomplished |
3032|reverse path forwarding of broadcast packet broadcast packet is for delivery to all node of network algorithm for accomplishing this delivery through store and forward packet switching computer network include transmission of separately addressed packet multidestination addressing hot potato forwarding spanning tree forwarding and source based forwarding to this list of algorithm we add reverse path forwarding broadcast routing method which exploit routing procedure and data structure already available for packet switching reverse path forwarding is practical algorithm for broadcast routing in store and forward packet switching computer network the algorithm is described being practical because it is not optimal according to metric developed for it analysis in this paper and also because it can be implemented in existing network with complexity than that required for the known alternative |
3033|optimizing decision tree through heuristically guided search optimal decision table conversion been tackled in the literature using two approach dynamic programming and branch and bound the former technique is quite effective but it time and space requirement are independent of how easy the given table is furthermore it cannot be used to produce good quasi optimal solution the branch and bound technique us good heuristic to direct the search but is cluttered up by an enormous search space since the number of solution increase with the number of test variable according to double exponential in this paper we suggest heuristically guided top down search algorithm which like dynamic programming recognizes identical subproblems but which can be used to find both optimal and quasi optimal solution the heuristic search method introduced in this paper combine the positive aspect of the above two technique compressed table with large number of variable can be handled without deriving expanded table first |

3037|linear sieve algorithm for finding prime number new algorithm is presented for finding all prime between and n the algorithm executes in time proportional to n assuming that multiplication of integer not larger than n can be performed in unit time the method the same arithmetic complexity the algorithm presented by mairson however our version is perhaps simpler and more elegant it is also easily extended to find the prime factorization of all integer between and n in time proportional to n |

3040|synthesizing constraint expression constraint network representation is presented for combinatorial search problem finding value for set of variable subject to set of constraint theory of consistency level in such network is formulated which is related to problem of backtrack tree search efficiency an algorithm is developed that can achieve any level of consistency desired in order to preprocess the problem for subsequent backtrack search or to function an alternative to backtrack search by explicitly determining all solution |
3041|median split tree fast lookup technique for frequently occuring key split tree are new technique for searching set of key with highly skewed frequency distribution split tree is binary search tree each node of which contains two key value node value which is maximally frequent key in that subtree and split value which partition the remaining key with respect to their lexical ordering between the left and right subtrees median split tree mst us the lexical median of node descendent it split value to force the search tree to be perfectly balanced achieving both space efficient representation of the tree and high search speed unlike frequency ordered binary search tree the cost of successful search of an mst is log n bounded and very stable around minimal value further an mst can be built for given key ordering and set of frequency in time n log n opposed to n for an optimum binary search tree discussion of the application of mst to dictionary lookup for english is presented and the performance obtained is contrasted with that of other technique |

3047|using synthetic image to register real image with surface model number of image analysis task can benefit from registration of the image with model of the surface being imaged automatic navigation using visible light or radar image requires exact alignment of such image with digital terrain model in addition automatic classification of terrain using satellite imagery requires such alignment to deal correctly with the effect of varying sun angle and surface slope even inspection technique for certain industrial part may be improved by this mean we achieve the required alignment by matching the real image with synthetic image obtained from surface model and known position of the light source the synthetic image intensity is calculated using the reflectance map convenient way of describing surface reflection function of surface gradient we illustrate the technique using landsat image and digital terrain model |

3052|cold start v warm start miss ratio in two level computer storage hierarchy miss ratio measurement are often made from cold start that is made with the first level store initially empty for large capacity the effect on the measured miss ratio of the miss incurred while filling the first level store can be significant even for long reference string use of warm start rather than cold start miss ratio cast doubt on the widespread belief that the observed s shape of lifetime reciprocal of miss ratio versus capacity curve indicates property of behavior of program that maintain constant number of page in main storage on the other hand if cold start miss ratio are measured function of capacity and measurement length then they are useful in studying system in which operation of program is periodically interrupted by task switch it is shown how to obtain under simple assumption the cache miss ratio for multiprogramming from cold start miss ratio value and how to obtain approximate cold start miss ratio from warm start miss ratio |

3057|optimal his togram matching by monotone gray level transformation this paper investigates the problem of optimal his togram matching using monotone gray level transformation which always assigns all picture point of given gray level i to another gray level such that if i j then tj the objective is to find transformed digital picture of given picture such that the sum of absolute error between the gray level his togram of the transformed picture and that of reference picture is minimized this is equivalent to placing k linearly ordered object of different sized one by one into k linearly ordered box of assorted size such that the accumulated error of space under packed or overpacked in the box is minimized the placement function is monotonic which ensures polynomial time solution to this problem tree search algorithm for optimal his togram matching is presented which time complexity ok x k if the monotone property is dropped then the problem becomes np complete even if it is restricted to k |

3076|value conflict and social choice in electronic fund transfer system development during the last few year computer based system which automate the transfer and recording of debit and credit have begun to be implemented on large scale these system promise both financial benefit for the institution that use them and potential convenience to their customer however they also raise significant social legal and technical question that must be resolved if full scale system for electronic fund transfer eft are not to cause more problem for the larger public than they solve this paper examines the incentive for eft development and the social problem they raise in the context of conflict between five different value position that are often implicit in analysis of proposed eft arrangement these conflict reflect the relative importance of certain problem for specific group the value position implicit in eft proposal help to organize analysis of market arrangement system reliability and privacy of transaction these topic are analyzed in this article and related to the value position held by concerned party last the way in which the public can learn about the social quality of different eft arrangement and the pace of eft development are both discussed in the context of social choice |
3077|can programming be liberated from the von neumann style functional style and it algebra of program conventional programming language are growing ever more enormous but not stronger inherent defect at the most basic level cause them to be both fat and weak their primitive word at time style of programming inherited from their common ancestor the von neumann computer their close coupling off semantics to state transition their division of programming into world of expression and world of statement their inability to effectively use powerful combining form for building new program from existing one and their lack of useful mathematical property for reasoning about program an alternative functional style of programming is founded on the use of combining form for creating program functional program deal with structured data are often nonrepetitive and nonrecursive are hierarchically constructed do not name their argument and do not require the complex machinery of procedure declaration to become generally applicable combining form can use high level program to build still higher level one in style not possible in conventional language associated with the functional style of programming is an algebra of program whose variable range over program and whose operation are combining form this algebra can be used to transform program and to solve equation whose unknown are program in much the same way one transforms equation in high school algebra these transformation are given by algebraic law and are carried out in the same language in which program are written combining form are chosen not only for their programming power but also for the power of their associated algebraic law general theorem of of the algebra give the detailed behavior and termination condition for large class of program new class of computing system us the functional programming style both in it programming language and in it state transition rule unlike von neumann language these system have semantics loosely coupled to state only one state transition occurs per major computation |

3081|shallow binding in lisp shallow binding is scheme which allows the value of variable to be accessed in bounded amount of computation an elegant model for shallow binding in lisp is presented in which context switching is an environment tree transformation called rerooting rerooting is completely general and reversible and is optional in the sense that lisp interpreter will operate correctly whether or not rerooting is invoked one very context change since rerooting leaf assoc v invariant for all variable v and all environment the programmer can have access to rerooting primitive shallow which give him dynamic control over whether access are shallow or deep and which affect only the speed of execution of program not it semantics in addition multiple process can be active in the same environment structure so long rerooting is an indivisible operation finally the concept of rerooting is shown to combine the concept of shallow binding in lisp with dijkstras display for algol and hence is general model for shallow binding |

3091|some basic determinant of computer programming productivity the propose of this research wa to examine the relationship between processing characteristic of program and experience characteristic of programmer and program development time the ultimate objective wa to develop technique for predicting the amount of time necessary to create computer program the fifteen program characteristic hypothesized being associated with an increase in programming time required are objectively measurable from preprogramming specification the five programmer characteristic are experience related and are also measurable before programming task is begun nine program characteristic emerged major influence on program development time each associated with increased program development time all five programmer characteristic were found to be related to reduced program development time multiple regression equation which contained one programmer characteristic and four program characteristic gave evidence of good predictive power for forecasting program development time |

3094|analysis of deterministic parsing algorithm this paper describes an approach for determining the minimum maximum and average time to parse sentence acceptable by deterministic parser these quantity are presented in the form of symbolic formula called time formula the variable in these formula represent not only the length of the input string but also the time to perform elementary operation such pushing popping subscripting iterating etc by binding to the variable actual numerical value corresponding to given compiler machine configuration one can determine the execution time for that configuration time formula are derived by examining the grammar rule and the program representing the algorithm one wish to analyze the approach is described by using specific grammar that defines simple arithmetic expression two deterministic parser are analyzed top down recursive descent ll parser and bottom up slr parser the paper provides estimate for the relative efficiency of the two parser the estimate applicable to specific machine the pdp are presented and substantiated buy benchmark finally the paper illustrates the proposed approach by applying it to the analysis of parser for simple programming language |
3095|selective traversal algorithm for binary search tree the problem of selecting data item from binary search tree according to list of range condition is considered the process of visiting minimal number of node to retrieve data satisfying the range condition is called selective traversal presented in this paper is an algorithm for selective traversal which us tag field for each node in the tree the algorithm is particularly useful and efficient when examination of data is more time consuming than examination of tag field |
3096|an optimal method for deletion in one sided height balanced tree one sided height balanced tree is binary tree in which every node right subtree height which is equal to or exactly one greater than the height of it left subtree it an advantage over the more general avl tree in that only one bit of balancing information is required two bit are required for the acl tree it is shown that deletion of an arbitrary node of such tree can be accomplished in ologn operation where n is the number of node in the tree moreover the method is optimal in the sense that it complexity cannot be reduced in order of magnitude this result coupled with earlier result by hirschberg indicates that of the three basic problem of insertion deletion and retrieval only insertion is adversely affected by this modification of an avl tree |
3097|optimal shift strategy for block transfer ccd memory for the purpose of this paper block transfer ccd memory is composed of serial shift register whose shift rate can vary but which have definite minimum shift rate the refresh rate and definite maximum shift rate the bit iin the shift register are numbered to n and block of n bit are always transferred always starting at bit what is the best shift strategy so that block transfer request occurring at random time will have to wait the minimal amount of time before bit can be reached the minimum shift rate requirement doe not allow one to simply park at bit and wait for transfer request the optimal strategy involves shifting slowly possible until bit is passed then shifting quickly possible until critical boundary is reached shortly before bit come around again this is called the hurry up and wait strategy and is well known outside the computer field the block transfer ccd memory can also be viewed paging drum with variable bounded rotation speed |
3098|computer generation of gamma random variable new method for generating random variable from the gamma distribution with nonintegral shape parameter is proposed this method is similar to two other method recently given by wallace and fishman it is compared with fishmans and ahrens and dieter method the core storage requirement and programming effort for this method are similar to those of fishmans method the proposed method is the same fishmans method for and is faster than fishmans method for also the proposed method is much simpler than ahrens and dieter method and is faster for |
3099|new sufficient optimality condition for integer programming and their application the purpose of this report is to present new class of sufficient optimality condition for pure and mixed integer programming problem some of the set of sufficient condition presented can be thought of generalization of optimality condition based on primal dual complementarity in linear programming these sufficient condition are particularly useful for the construction of difficult integer programming problem with known optimal solution these problem may then be used to test andor benchmark integer programming code |
3100|an interference matching technique for inducing abstraction method for inducing knowledge by abstraction from sequence of training example is described the proposed method interference matching induces abstraction by finding relational property common to two or more exemplar three task solved by program that us an interference matching algorithm are presented several problem concerning the description of the training example and the adequacy of interference matching are discussed and direction for future research are considered |
3101|the sl procedure mechanism this paper describes an integrated procedure mechanism that permit procedure to be used recursive function or coroutines this integration is accomplished by treating procedure and their activation record called environment data object and by decomposing procedure invocation into three separate component at the source language level in addition argument binding is under the control of the programmer permitting the definition of various method of argument transmission in the source language itself the resulting procedure mechanism which is part of the sl programming language is well suited to goal oriented problem and to other problem that are more readily programmed by using coroutines several example are given |

3103|automatic data structure selection an example and overview the use of several level of abstraction proved to be very helpful in constructing and maintaining program when program are designed with abstract data type such set and list programmer time can be saved by automating the process of filling in low level implementation detail in the past programming system have provided only single general purpose implementation for an abstract type thus the program produced using abstract type were then inefficient in space or time in this paper system for automatically choosing efficient implementation for abstract type from library of implementation is discussed this process is discussed in detail for an example program general issue in data structure selection are also reviewed |
3104|test data an aid in proving program correctness proof of program correctness tend to be long and tedious whereas testing though useful in detecting error usually doe not guarantee correctness this paper introduces technique whereby test data can be used in proving program correctness in addition to simplifying the process of proving correctness this method simplifies the process of providing accurate specification for program the applicability of this technique to procedure and recursive program is demonstrated |
3105|language extension for expressing constraint on data access controlled sharing of information is needed and desirable for many application and is supported in operating system by access control mechanism this paper show how to extend programming language to provide controlled sharing the extension permit expression of access constraint on shared data access constraint can apply both to simple object and to object that are component of larger object such bank account record in bank data base the constraint are stated declaratively and can be enforced by static checking similar to type checking the approach can be used to extend any strongly typed language but is particularly suitable for extending language that support the notion of abstract data type |
3106|fast algorithm for copying list structure an algorithm is presented for copying an arbitrarily linked list structure into block of contiguous storage location without destroying the original list apart from fixed number of program variable auxiliary storage such stack is used the algorithm need mark bit and operates in linear time it is shown to be significantly faster than fisher algorithm the fastest previous linear time algorithm for the same problem it speed come mainly from it efficient list traversal technique which fold the processing stack into the structure being built and from it classification of list cell into nine type which enables processing operation to be optimized for each type |

3110|assembling code for machine with span dependent instruction many modern computer contain instruction whose length depend on the distance from given instance of such an instruction to the operand of that instruction this paper considers the problem of minimizing the length of program for such machine an efficient solution is presented for the case in which the operand of every such span dependent instruction is either label or an assembly time expression of certain restricted formif this restriction is relaxed by allowing these operand to be more general assembly time expression then the problem is shown to be np complete |
3111|secure communication over insecure channel according to traditional conception of cryptographic security it is necessary to transmit key by secret mean before encrypted message can be sent securely this paper show that it is possible to select key over open communication channel in such fashion that communication security can be maintained method is described which force any enemy to expend an amount of work which increase the square of the work required of the two communicant to select the key the method provides logically new kind of protection against the passive eaves dropper it suggests that further research on this topic will be highly rewarding both in theoretical and practical sense |
3112|list processing in real time on serial computer real time list processing system is one in which the time required by the elementary list operation eg car cdr rplaca replacd eq and atom in lisp is bounded by small constant classical implementation of list processing system lack this property because allocating list cell from the heap may cause garbage collection which process requires time proportional to the heap size to finish real time list processing system is presented which continuously reclaims garbage including directed cycle while linearizing and compacting the accessible cell into contiguous location to avoid fragmenting the free storage pool the program is small and requires time sharing interrupt making it suitable for microcode finally the system requires the same average time and not more than twice the space of classical implementation and those space requirement can be reduced to approximately classical proportion by compact list representation array of different size program stack and hash linking are simple extension to our system and reference counting is found to be inferior for many application |
3113|optimal conversion of extended entry decision table with general cost criterion general dynamic programming algorithm for converting limited extended or mixed entry decision table to optimal decision tree is presented which can take into account rule frequency or probability minimum time andor space cost criterion common action set compressed rule and else rule sequencing constraint on condition test excludable combination of condition certain ambiguity and interrupted rule masking |
3114|technique for isolating difference between file simple algorithm is described for isolating the difference between two file one application is the comparing of two version of source program or other file in order to display all difference the algorithm isolates difference in way that corresponds closely to our intuitive notion of difference is easy to implement and is computationally efficient with time linear in the file length for most application the algorithm isolates difference similar to those isolated by the longest common subsequence another application of this algorithm merges file containing independently generated change into single file the algorithm can also be used to generate efficient encoding of file in the form of the difference between itself and given datum file permitting reconstruction of the original file from the difference and datum file |
3115|orderly enumeration of nonsingular binary matrix applied to text encryption nonsingular binary matrix of order n ie nonsingular over the field and an initial segment of the natural number are placed in one to one correspondence each natural number corresponds to two intermediate vector these vector are mapped into nonsingular binary matrix example of complete enumeration of all x and x nonsingular binary matrix were produced by mapping the intermediate vector to the matrix the mapping application to the vernam encipherment method using pseudorandom number sequence bit string formed form byte of text of data encryption key can be used representation of natural number this natural number is transformed to nonsingular binary matrix key leverage is obtained by using the matrix aseed in shift register sequence pseudorandom number generator |

3121|syntactic source to source transforms and program manipulation syntactic transforms are the source to source program transformation which preserve the history of computation and thus do not modify the execution time combined with small number of primitive semantic transforms they provide powerful tool for program manipulation catalogue of syntactic transforms and it use for solution of system of program equation is given example of derivation of more complex source to source transformation are also presented two case study illustrate the way in which syntactic and semantic source to source transformation may be used for development of clear simple and reasonably efficient program |

3124|recursive data structure in apl mathematical study of three approach for defining nested array in apl is presented theorem exhibiting the relationship between the definitional system are given and illustrated through graph representation one of the approach is used to define an apl array to be recursive data structure equivalent to tree structure in which all data is stored at the leaf homogeneous array of number and character an extension of apl is proposed that includes new primitive function to manipulate the nesting level of array and new operator to assist in the construction of data driven algorithm |
3125|global optimization by suppression of partial redundancy the elimination of redundant computation and the moving of invariant computation out of loop are often done separately with invariant moved outward loop by loop we propose to do both at once and to move each expression directly to the entrance of the outermost loop in which it is invariant this is done by solving more general problem ie the elimination of computation performed twice on given execution path such computation are termed partially redundant moreover the algorithm doe not require any graphical information or restriction on the shape of the program graph testing this algorithm shown that it execution cost is nearly linear with the size of the program and that it lead to smaller optimizer that requires execution time |

3128|synchronization with eventcounts and sequencer synchronization of concurrent process requires controlling the relative ordering of event in the process new synchronization mechanism is proposed using abstract object called eventcounts and sequencer that allows process to control the ordering of event directly rather than using mutual exclusion to protect manipulation of shared variable that control ordering of event direct control of ordering seems to simplify correctness argument and also simplifies implementation in distributed system the mechanism is defined formally and then several example of it use are given the relationship of the mechanism to protection mechanism in the system is explained in particular eventcounts are shown to be applicable to situation where confinement of information matter an implementation of eventcount s and sequencer in system with shared memory is described |

3138|mathematical programming updating method using modified given transformation and applied to lp problem an efficient and numerically stable method is presented for the problem of updating an orthogonal decomposition of matrix of column or row vector the fundamental idea is to add column or row analogous to adding an additional row of data in linear least square problem column or row is dropped by formal scaling with the imaginary unit followed by least square addition of the column or row the elimination process for the procedure is successive ssive application of the given transformation in modified more efficient form these idea are illustrated with an implementation of the revised simplex method the algorithm is general purpose one that doe not account for any particular structure or sparsity in the equation some suggested computational test for determining sign of various controlling parameter in the revised simplex algorithm are mentioned simple mean of constructing test case and some sample computing time are presented |

3150|beyond programming language computer technology matures our growing ability to create large system is leading to basic change in the nature of programming current programming language concept will not be adequate for building and maintaining system of the complexity called for by the task we attempt just high level language enabled the programmer to escape from the intricacy of machine order code higher level programming system can provide the mean to understand and manipulate complex system and component in order to develop such system we need to shift our attention away from the detailed specification of algorithm towards the description of the property of the package and object with which we build this paper analyzes some of the shortcoming of programming language they now exist and lay out some possible direction for future research |

3152|storage reorganization technique for matrix computation in paging environment in order to multiply matrix while minimizing the number of page fetch required it is often more efficient to reorganize the data into submatrix form and to use block multiplication rather than to use the best known algorithm which leave the matrix stored in row or column oriented form an efficient method for accomplishing this reorganization is given this also make possible the derivation of an asymptotically better bound for multiplication of matrix given in row oriented form by adapting the technique of strassen to the reorganized data the reorganizationblock multiplication scheme is shown to be advantageous for matrix and page of realistic size the strassen adaptation is not the former scheme is also shown to be advantageous even if the transpose of one of the matrix is available at additional cost |
3153|the control of response time in multi class system by memory allocation the possibility of giving different quality of service to job of different class by regulating their memory allocation is examined in the context of paged computer system two parameterized algorithm which partition the main memory between two class of job are considered initially closed system consisting of process or and paging and file device with fixed number of job is studied to determine optimal degree of multiprogramming and the proportion of processor time devoted to each class applying decomposition approach and treating the closed system single server the response time in an open system with external arrival are studied the object is to investigate the effect of the memory alocation parameter on the expected response time under the two algorithm numerical solution and economical lower bound for the expected response time function of the control parameter are obtained way of applying the result to system with more than two job class is indicated |
3154|algorithm logic control an algorithm can be regarded consisting of logic component which specifies the knowledge to be used in solving problem and control component which determines the problem solving strategy by mean of which that knowledge is used the logic component determines the meaning of the algorithm whereas the control component only affect it efficiency the efficiency of an algorithm can often by improving the control component without changing the logic of the algorithm we argue that computer program would be more often correct and more easily improved and modified if their logic and control aspect were identified and separated in the program text |

3156|computing connected component on parallel computer we present parallel algorithm which us n processor to find the connected component of an undirected graph with n vertex in time ologn an ologn time bound also can be achieved using only nnlogn processor the algorithm can be used to find the transitive closure of symmetric boolean matrix we assume that the processor have access to common memory simultaneous access to the same location is permitted for fetch instruction but not for store instruction |
3157|proving termination with multiset ordering common tool for proving the termination of program is the well founded set set ordered in such way to admit infinite descending sequence the basic approach is to find termination function that map the value of the program variable into some well founded set such that the value of the termination function is repeatedly reduced throughout the computation all too often the termination function required are difficult to find and are of complexity out of proportion to the program under consideration multisets bag over given well founded set s are set that admit multiple occurrence of element taken from s the given ordering on s induces an ordering on the finite multisets over s this multiset ordering is shown to be well founded the multiset ordering enables the use of relatively simple and intuitive termination function in otherwise difficult termination proof in particular the multiset ordering is used to prove the termination of production system program defined in term of set of rewriting rule |

3162|on improving the worst case running time of the boyer moore string matching algorithm it is shown how to modify the boyer moore string matching algorithm so that it worst case running time is linear even when multiple occurrence of the pattern are present in the text |
3163|an optimal insertion algorithm for one sided height balanced binary search tree an algorithm for inserting an element into one sided height balanced oshb binary search tree is presented the algorithm operates in time olog n where n is the number of node in the tree this represents an improvement over the best previous ly known insertion algorithm of hirschberg and kosaraju which require time olog n moreover the olog n complexity is optimal earlier result have shown that deletion in such structure can also be performed in olog n time thus the result of this paper give negative answer to the question of whether such tree should be the first example of their kind where deletion smaller time complexity than insertion furthermore it can now be concluded that insertion deletion and retrieval in oshb tree can be performed in the same time the corresponding operation for the more general avl tree to within constant factor however the insertion and deletion algorithm for oshb tree appear much more complicated than the corresponding algorithm for avl tree |
3164|progressive acyclic digraph tool for database integrity progressive acyclic digraph pad algorithm accepts are request and maintains graph in an acyclic state when request creates cycle node are detached until the new are can be entered acyclically this process is important in certain area of database implementation in which there are constraint on the permissible sequence of action two pad algorithm are presented one us simple path matrix representation and the other us list with an artificial gradient experiment suggest that for large n the second is considerably faster though both are asymptotically onr where n is the number of node and r is the expected number of node reachable along path from any given node |
3165|approximation of polygonal map by cellular map the approximation of polygonal thematic map by cellular map an important operation in geographical data processing is analyzed the data organization used for representing the polygonal map is widely used segment based data structure where class label identify the region bordering each segment on either side the approximation algorithm presented operates on such an organization eliminating the need for the recognition of region boundary each segment is examined only once the versatility of the new organization is further illustrated by the outline of algorithm for area computation and point inclusion the algorithm is applied to set of soil map converted to computer readable form by mean of coordinate digitizer |
3166|computing standard deviation accuracy four algorithm for the numerical computation of the standard deviation of unweighted sampled data are analyzed two of the algorithm are well known in the statistical and computational literature the other two are new algorithm specifically intended for automatic computation our discussion is expository with emphasis on reaching suitable definition of accuracy each of the four algorithm is analyzed for the condition under which it will be accurate we conclude that all four algorithm will provide accurate answer for many problem but two of the algorithm one new one old are substantially more accurate on difficult problem than are the other two |

3175|breaking substitution cipher using relaxation algorithm substitution cipher are code in which each letter of the alphabet one fixed substitute and the word division do not change in this paper the problem of breaking substitution cipher is represented probabilistic labeling problem every code letter is assigned probability of representing plain text letter these probability are updated in parallel for all code letter using joint letter probability iterating the updating scheme result in improved estimate that finally lead to breaking the cipher the method is applies successfully to two example |
3176|storing sparse table the problem of storing and searching large sparse table is ubiquitous in computer science the standard technique for storing such table is hashing but hashing poor worst case performance we propose good worst case method for storing static table of n entry each an integer between and n the method requires n w word of storage and allows ologn n access time although our method is little complicated to use in practice our analysis show why simpler algorithm used for compressing lr parsing table work so well |
3177|how to share secret in this paper we show how to divide data d into n piece in such way that d is easily reconstructable from any k piece but even complete knowledge of k piece reveals olutely information about d this technique enables the construction of robust key management scheme for cryptographic system that can function securely and reliably even when misfortune destroy half the piece and security breach expose all but one of the remaining piece |
3178|introduction to the eft symposium |
3179|overview of the eft symposium it is increasingly recognized that large scale technology such eft have the potential for aiding in the solution of current societal problem yet these technology also generate problem this symposium present selected paper from conference that sought to discover what is currently known about eft impact in society and what research is needed in the future |
3180|cost of the current u payment system neither the banking industry nor public policy maker have good information on the comparative cost of alternative payment system such cash check credit card and eft transaction result eft system and service are likely to be implemented without valid assessment of whether they are cost justified lst alone justified in term of other criterion |
3181|public protection and education with eft research revealed the existence of widespread misinformation and lack of knowledge about eft among business and government well consumer result any effort to stimulate meaningful public participation in decision on the introduction of eft system will require coordinated educational effort of considerable scale in addition research revealed shortcoming in the present system for defining responsibility liability and avenue of recourse this article present several possible alternative for improving the current system but ongoing research is also needed to assure that action taken will be responsive to the changing environment and consumer need |
3182|vulnerability of eft to intentionally caused loss the hypothesis that consumer are provided greater accuracy and freedom from error and fraud with electronic fund transfer system eft is discussed in light of the technical capability and potential of the computer to protect against both accidentally and intentionally caused loss although the nomenclature for business crime remains the same for manual depository and other financial service system for example fraud theft embezzlement the characteristic of the crime are new the change resulting from the accelerating use of eft and it continual technological advance broaden the scope of security issue to be examined factor such backup requirement regulatory and legislative action and economics give rise to the urgency for immediate research into solution for emerging eft related vulnerability |
3183|policy value and eft research anatomy of research agenda there is an emerging recognition that eft system have the potential to vastly alter the payment and fund transfer system in american society number of force and actor are involved in this evolution and the value vary significantly depending on individual and institutional perspective these value conflict are highlighted in six part research agenda technological issue in eft eft impact on people economic impact of eft regulation and control of eft and evaluating and monitoring eft system |
3184|revised report on the algorithmic language algol the report give complete defining description of the international algorithmic language algol this is language suitable for expressing large class of numerical process in form sufficiently concise for direct automatic translation into the language of programmed automatic computer |

3192|the lincoln keyboard typewriter keyboard designed for computer input flexibility new typewriter keyboard for direct and punched paper tape computer input will replace the usual commercial keyboard with character chosen for the convenience of programmer the lincoln keyboard is expected to facilitate the programming of algorithmic process and should allow considerable flexibility in assembly and utility routine |

3196|the reactive typewriter program character keyboard including alphabetical upper and lower case for good readability if the machine is restricted to only single case the lower case is preferred the reactive typewriter should be portable the reactive typewriter should operate over any commercially used dial type telephone voice or telegraph telex line or over leased nondial telegraph line interchangeably |

3198|microprogramming emulator and programming language the problem we have been concerned with is that of converting language to action or intellectual energy to mechanical energy the medium that we use for this purpose is language and therefore we are preoccupied with the subject of language in the area of language investigation we have concentrated first on formalizing syntax and then on semantics |
3199|algem an algebraic manipulator algem is package of subprogram written in slip fortran iv and map ii to manipulate algebraic expression algems basic algebraic operation are addition subtraction multiplication division and exponentiation it is capable of handling any number of single letter variable variable exponent and of finding the highest common factor of two polynomial also included are such function substitution differentiation determining coefficient of specified variable solving linear equation basic io routine plus other special purpose and arithmetic routine the major innovation of algem over other manipulator is the assignment of type to all expression and the use of standard ordering procedure |
3200|formac program for the solution of linear boundary and initial value problem computer program is described which been developed for obtaining approximate solution to linear initial and boundary value problem involving differential equation for each problem input to the program includes the equation in symbolic form to be satisfied the differential equation equation describing auxiliary condition such boundary condition etc numerical description of the region in which each of the equation are to be satisfied set of function in symbolic form to be used in linear combination to approximate the solution function give the above input the program generates an approximation to the solution of the specified problemm in term of the specified function which is optimum in the least square sense |
3201|symbolic manipulation of poisson series poisson series of three variable are manageable symbolically through set of formal subroutine written partially in the ibm machine language but to be called in the fortran language for use in fortran program an effort been made to supply those operation which are most required by celestial mechanic the routine are entirely self contained subroutine and require only standard fortran inputoutput unit and they are design to avoid waste and overflow of core storage space |
3202|manip computer system for algebra and analytic differentiation mathematical expression to be operated upon is written in fortran like notation and stored in the computer string of bcd character with all blank removed it may be complicated desired parenthesis nested without restriction etc so long the entire expression or any subsequent form doe not exceed character the problemm of performing algebraic operation and obtaining analytic derivative wa translated into that of identifying and manipulating character sequence program which resulted were written in fortran iv for cdc and are discussed in detail |
3203|grad assistant program for symbolic algebraic manipulation and differentiation the general recursive algebra and differentiation assistant grad assistant now under development is set of lisp function which symbolically manipulate abd differentiate algebraic expression it is designed for use with problemms in which large amount of routine manipulation is to be done by program without human intervention thus grad must recognize necessary simplification without external guidance while some complicated expression notably one involving nested radical and trigonometric function do not yield completely to the present version it proved quite useful indeed |
3204|an on line program for non numerical algebra the goal of this program is to make step toward design of an automated mathematical assistant some requirement for such program are it must be easy to access and that the result must be obtained in reasonably short time accordingly the program is written for time shared computer the q computer system development corporation santa monica california wa chosen because it also had lisp compiler programming and debugging wa done from remote teletype console at stanford university |
